english: For, God’s are all the forces of the heavens and the earth; and God is indeed almighty, truly wise

arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَاكَ شَاهِدًا وَمُبَشِّرًا وَنَذِيرًا
english: VERILY, [O Muhammad,] We have sent thee as a witness [to the truth], and as a herald of glad tidings and a warner –

arabic: لِتُؤْمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ وَتُعَزِّرُوهُ وَتُوَقِّرُوهُ وَتُسَبِّحُوهُ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا
english: so that you [O men] might believe in God and His Apostle, and might honour Him, and revere Him, and extol His limitless glory from morn to evening

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يُبَايِعُونَكَ إِنَّمَا يُبَايِعُونَ اللَّهَ يَدُ اللَّهِ فَوْقَ أَيْدِيهِمْ ۚ فَمَنْ نَكَثَ فَإِنَّمَا يَنْكُثُ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِهِ ۖ وَمَنْ أَوْفَىٰ بِمَا عَاهَدَ عَلَيْهُ اللَّهَ فَسَيُؤْتِيهِ أَجْرًا عَظِيمًا
english: Behold, all who pledge their allegiance to thee pledge their allegiance to God: the hand of God is over their hands. Hence, he who breaks his oath, breaks it only to his own hurt; whereas he who remains true to what he has pledged unto God, on him will He bestow a reward supreme

arabic: سَيَقُولُ لَكَ الْمُخَلَّفُونَ مِنَ الْأَعْرَابِ شَغَلَتْنَا أَمْوَالُنَا وَأَهْلُونَا فَاسْتَغْفِرْ لَنَا ۚ يَقُولُونَ بِأَلْسِنَتِهِمْ مَا لَيْسَ فِي قُلُوبِهِمْ ۚ قُلْ فَمَنْ يَمْلِكُ لَكُمْ مِنَ اللَّهِ شَيْئًا إِنْ أَرَادَ بِكُمْ ضَرًّا أَوْ أَرَادَ بِكُمْ نَفْعًا ۚ بَلْ كَانَ اللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرًا
english: Those of the bedouin who stayed behind will say unto thee: “[The need to take care of] our chattels and our families kept us busy: do then, [O Prophet,] ask God to forgive us!” [Thus,] they will utter with their tongues something that is not in their hearts. Say: “Who, then, has it in his power to avert from you aught that God may have willed, whether it be His will to harm you or to confer a benefit on you? Nay, but God is fully aware of what you do

arabic: بَلْ ظَنَنْتُمْ أَنْ لَنْ يَنْقَلِبَ الرَّسُولُ وَالْمُؤْمِنُونَ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِيهِمْ أَبَدًا وَزُيِّنَ ذَٰلِكَ فِي قُلُوبِكُمْ وَظَنَنْتُمْ ظَنَّ السَّوْءِ وَكُنْتُمْ قَوْمًا بُورًا
english: Nay, you thought that the Apostle and the believers would never return to their kith and kin: and this seemed goodly to your hearts. And you entertained [such] evil thoughts because you have always been people devoid of all good!”

arabic: وَمَنْ لَمْ يُؤْمِنْ بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ فَإِنَّا أَعْتَدْنَا لِلْكَافِرِينَ سَعِيرًا
english: Now as for those who will not believe in God and His Apostle - verily, We have readied a blazing flame for all [such] deniers of the truth

arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ يَغْفِرُ لِمَنْ يَشَاءُ وَيُعَذِّبُ مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۚ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ غَفُورًا رَحِيمًا
english: But God’s is the dominion over the heavens and the earth: He forgives whomever He wills, and imposes suffering on whomever He wills - and [withal,] He is indeed much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace

arabic: سَيَقُولُ الْمُخَلَّفُونَ إِذَا انْطَلَقْتُمْ إِلَىٰ مَغَانِمَ لِتَأْخُذُوهَا ذَرُونَا نَتَّبِعْكُمْ ۖ يُرِيدُونَ أَنْ يُبَدِّلُوا كَلَامَ اللَّهِ ۚ قُلْ لَنْ تَتَّبِعُونَا كَذَٰلِكُمْ قَالَ اللَّهُ مِنْ قَبْلُ ۖ فَسَيَقُولُونَ بَلْ تَحْسُدُونَنَا ۚ بَلْ كَانُوا لَا يَفْقَهُونَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا
english: As soon as you [O believers] are about to set forth on a war that promises booty, those who stayed behind [aforetime] will surely say, “Allow us to go with you” - [thus showing that] they would like to alter the Word of God. Say: “By no means shall you go with us: God has declared aforetime [to whom all spoils shall belong].” Thereupon they will [surely] answer, “Nay, but you begrudge us [our share of booty]!” Nay, they can grasp but so little of the truth

arabic: قُلْ لِلْمُخَلَّفِينَ مِنَ الْأَعْرَابِ سَتُدْعَوْنَ إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ أُولِي بَأْسٍ شَدِيدٍ تُقَاتِلُونَهُمْ أَوْ يُسْلِمُونَ ۖ فَإِنْ تُطِيعُوا يُؤْتِكُمُ اللَّهُ أَجْرًا حَسَنًا ۖ وَإِنْ تَتَوَلَّوْا كَمَا تَوَلَّيْتُمْ مِنْ قَبْلُ يُعَذِّبْكُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
english: Say unto those bedouin who stayed behind: “In time you will be called upon [to fight] against people of great prowess in war: you will have to fight against them [until you die] or they surrender. And then, if you heed [that call], God will bestow on you a goodly reward; but if you turn away as you turned away this time, He will chastise you with grievous chastisement.”

arabic: لَيْسَ عَلَى الْأَعْمَىٰ حَرَجٌ وَلَا عَلَى الْأَعْرَجِ حَرَجٌ وَلَا عَلَى الْمَرِيضِ حَرَجٌ ۗ وَمَنْ يُطِعِ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ يُدْخِلْهُ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ ۖ وَمَنْ يَتَوَلَّ يُعَذِّبْهُ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
english: No blame attaches to the blind, nor does blame attach to the lame, nor does blame attach to the sick [for staying away from a war in God’s cause]; but whoever heeds [the call of] God and His Apostle [in deed or in heart], him will He admit into gardens through which running waters flow; whereas him who turns away will He chastise with grievous chastisement

arabic: ۞ لَقَدْ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ إِذْ يُبَايِعُونَكَ تَحْتَ الشَّجَرَةِ فَعَلِمَ مَا فِي قُلُوبِهِمْ فَأَنْزَلَ السَّكِينَةَ عَلَيْهِمْ وَأَثَابَهُمْ فَتْحًا قَرِيبًا
english: INDEED, well-pleased was God with the believers when they pledged their allegiance unto thee [O Muhammad] under that tree, for He knew what was in their hearts; and so He bestowed inner peace upon them from on high, and rewarded them with [the glad tiding of] a victory soon to come

arabic: وَمَغَانِمَ كَثِيرَةً يَأْخُذُونَهَا ۗ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ عَزِيزًا حَكِيمًا
english: and [of] many war-gains which they would achieve: for God is indeed almighty, wise

arabic: وَعَدَكُمُ اللَّهُ مَغَانِمَ كَثِيرَةً تَأْخُذُونَهَا فَعَجَّلَ لَكُمْ هَٰذِهِ وَكَفَّ أَيْدِيَ النَّاسِ عَنْكُمْ وَلِتَكُونَ آيَةً لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَيَهْدِيَكُمْ صِرَاطًا مُسْتَقِيمًا
english: [O you who believe!] God has promised you many war-gains which you shall yet achieve; and He has vouchsafed you these [worldly gains] well in advance, and has stayed from you the hands of [hostile] people, so that this [your inner strength] may become a symbol to the believers [who will come after you], and that He may guide you all on a straight way

arabic: وَأُخْرَىٰ لَمْ تَقْدِرُوا عَلَيْهَا قَدْ أَحَاطَ اللَّهُ بِهَا ۚ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرًا
english: And there are yet other [gains] which are still beyond your grasp, [but] which God has already encompassed [for you]: for God has the power to will anything

arabic: وَلَوْ قَاتَلَكُمُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَوَلَّوُا الْأَدْبَارَ ثُمَّ لَا يَجِدُونَ وَلِيًّا وَلَا نَصِيرًا
english: And [now,] if they who are bent on denying the truth should fight against you, they will indeed turn their backs [in flight], and will find none to protect them and none to bring them succour

arabic: سُنَّةَ اللَّهِ الَّتِي قَدْ خَلَتْ مِنْ قَبْلُ ۖ وَلَنْ تَجِدَ لِسُنَّةِ اللَّهِ تَبْدِيلًا
english: such being God’s way which has ever obtained in the past - and never wilt thou find any change in God’s way

arabic: وَهُوَ الَّذِي كَفَّ أَيْدِيَهُمْ عَنْكُمْ وَأَيْدِيَكُمْ عَنْهُمْ بِبَطْنِ مَكَّةَ مِنْ بَعْدِ أَنْ أَظْفَرَكُمْ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ بَصِيرًا
english: And He it is who, in the valley of Mecca, stayed their hands from you, and your hands from them, after He had enabled you to vanquish them; and God saw indeed what you were doing

arabic: هُمُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَصَدُّوكُمْ عَنِ الْمَسْجِدِ الْحَرَامِ وَالْهَدْيَ مَعْكُوفًا أَنْ يَبْلُغَ مَحِلَّهُ ۚ وَلَوْلَا رِجَالٌ مُؤْمِنُونَ وَنِسَاءٌ مُؤْمِنَاتٌ لَمْ تَعْلَمُوهُمْ أَنْ تَطَئُوهُمْ فَتُصِيبَكُمْ مِنْهُمْ مَعَرَّةٌ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ ۖ لِيُدْخِلَ اللَّهُ فِي رَحْمَتِهِ مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۚ لَوْ تَزَيَّلُوا لَعَذَّبْنَا الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
english: [It was not for your enemies sake that He stayed your hands from them: for] it was they who were bent on denying the truth, and who debarred you from the Inviolable House of Worship and prevented your offering from reaching its destination. And had it not been for the believing men and believing women [in Mecca], whom you might have unwittingly trampled underfoot, and on whose account you might have become guilty, without knowing it, of a grievous wrong-: [had it not been for this, you would have been allowed to fight your way into the city: but you were forbidden to fight] so that [in time] God might admit to His grace whomever He wills. Had they [who deserve Our mercy and they whom We have condemned] been clearly discernible [to you], We would indeed have imposed grievous suffering [at your hands] on such of them as were bent on denying the truth

arabic: إِذْ جَعَلَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فِي قُلُوبِهِمُ الْحَمِيَّةَ حَمِيَّةَ الْجَاهِلِيَّةِ فَأَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ سَكِينَتَهُ عَلَىٰ رَسُولِهِ وَعَلَى الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَأَلْزَمَهُمْ كَلِمَةَ التَّقْوَىٰ وَكَانُوا أَحَقَّ بِهَا وَأَهْلَهَا ۚ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمًا
english: Whereas they who are bent on denying the truth harboured a stubborn disdain in their hearts - the stubborn disdain [born] of ignorance God bestowed from on high His [gift of] inner peace upon His Apostle and the believers, and bound them to the spirit of God-consciousness: for they were most worthy of this [divine gift], and deserved it well. And God has full knowledge of all things

arabic: لَقَدْ صَدَقَ اللَّهُ رَسُولَهُ الرُّؤْيَا بِالْحَقِّ ۖ لَتَدْخُلُنَّ الْمَسْجِدَ الْحَرَامَ إِنْ شَاءَ اللَّهُ آمِنِينَ مُحَلِّقِينَ رُءُوسَكُمْ وَمُقَصِّرِينَ لَا تَخَافُونَ ۖ فَعَلِمَ مَا لَمْ تَعْلَمُوا فَجَعَلَ مِنْ دُونِ ذَٰلِكَ فَتْحًا قَرِيبًا
english: Indeed, God has shown the truth in His Apostle’s true vision: most certainly shall you enter the Inviolable House of Worship, if God so wills, in full security, with your heads shaved or your hair cut short, without any fear: for He has [always] known that which you yourselves could not know. And He has ordained [for you], besides this, a victory soon to come

arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي أَرْسَلَ رَسُولَهُ بِالْهُدَىٰ وَدِينِ الْحَقِّ لِيُظْهِرَهُ عَلَى الدِّينِ كُلِّهِ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِاللَّهِ شَهِيدًا
english: He it is who has sent forth His Apostle with the [task of spreading] guidance and the religion of truth, to the end that He make it prevail over every [false] religion; and none can bear witness [to the truth] as God does

arabic: مُحَمَّدٌ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ۚ وَالَّذِينَ مَعَهُ أَشِدَّاءُ عَلَى الْكُفَّارِ رُحَمَاءُ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ تَرَاهُمْ رُكَّعًا سُجَّدًا يَبْتَغُونَ فَضْلًا مِنَ اللَّهِ وَرِضْوَانًا ۖ سِيمَاهُمْ فِي وُجُوهِهِمْ مِنْ أَثَرِ السُّجُودِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ مَثَلُهُمْ فِي التَّوْرَاةِ ۚ وَمَثَلُهُمْ فِي الْإِنْجِيلِ كَزَرْعٍ أَخْرَجَ شَطْأَهُ فَآزَرَهُ فَاسْتَغْلَظَ فَاسْتَوَىٰ عَلَىٰ سُوقِهِ يُعْجِبُ الزُّرَّاعَ لِيَغِيظَ بِهِمُ الْكُفَّارَ ۗ وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ مِنْهُمْ مَغْفِرَةً وَأَجْرًا عَظِيمًا
english: MUHAMMAD is God’s Apostle; and those who are [truly] with him are firm and unyielding towards all deniers of the truth, [yet] full of mercy towards one another. Thou canst see them bowing down, prostrating themselves [in prayer], seeking favour with God and [His] goodly acceptance: their marks are on their faces, traced by prostration. This is their parable in the Torah as well as their parable in the Gospel: [they are] like a seed that brings forth its shoot, and then He strengthens it, so that it grows stout, and [in the end] stands firm upon its stem, delighting the sowers. [Thus will God cause the believers to grow in strength,] so that through them He might confound the deniers of the truth. [But] unto such of them as may [yet] attain to faith and do righteous deeds, God has promised forgiveness and a reward supreme

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تُقَدِّمُوا بَيْنَ يَدَيِ اللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
english: O YOU who have attained to faith! Do not put yourselves forward in the presence of [what] God and His Apostle [may have ordained], but remain conscious of God: for, verily, God is all-hearing, all-knowing

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَرْفَعُوا أَصْوَاتَكُمْ فَوْقَ صَوْتِ النَّبِيِّ وَلَا تَجْهَرُوا لَهُ بِالْقَوْلِ كَجَهْرِ بَعْضِكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ أَنْ تَحْبَطَ أَعْمَالُكُمْ وَأَنْتُمْ لَا تَشْعُرُونَ
english: O you who have attained to faith! Do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet, and neither speak loudly to him, as you would speak loudly to one another, lest all your [good] deeds come to nought without your perceiving it

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَغُضُّونَ أَصْوَاتَهُمْ عِنْدَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ امْتَحَنَ اللَّهُ قُلُوبَهُمْ لِلتَّقْوَىٰ ۚ لَهُمْ مَغْفِرَةٌ وَأَجْرٌ عَظِيمٌ
english: Behold, they who lower their voices in the presence of God’s Apostle - it is they whose hearts God has tested [and opened] to consciousness of Himself; [and] theirs shall be forgiveness and a reward supreme

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يُنَادُونَكَ مِنْ وَرَاءِ الْحُجُرَاتِ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ
english: Verily, [O Prophet,] as for those who call thee from without thy private apartments - most of them do not use their reason

arabic: وَلَوْ أَنَّهُمْ صَبَرُوا حَتَّىٰ تَخْرُجَ إِلَيْهِمْ لَكَانَ خَيْرًا لَهُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ
english: for, if they had the patience [to wait] until thou come forth to them [of thine own accord], it would be for their own good. Still, God is much forgiving, a dispenser of grace

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِنْ جَاءَكُمْ فَاسِقٌ بِنَبَإٍ فَتَبَيَّنُوا أَنْ تُصِيبُوا قَوْمًا بِجَهَالَةٍ فَتُصْبِحُوا عَلَىٰ مَا فَعَلْتُمْ نَادِمِينَ
english: O YOU who have attained to faith! If any iniquitous person comes to you with a [slanderous] tale, use your discernment, lest you hurt people unwittingly and afterwards be filled with remorse for what you have done

arabic: وَاعْلَمُوا أَنَّ فِيكُمْ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ۚ لَوْ يُطِيعُكُمْ فِي كَثِيرٍ مِنَ الْأَمْرِ لَعَنِتُّمْ وَلَٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ حَبَّبَ إِلَيْكُمُ الْإِيمَانَ وَزَيَّنَهُ فِي قُلُوبِكُمْ وَكَرَّهَ إِلَيْكُمُ الْكُفْرَ وَالْفُسُوقَ وَالْعِصْيَانَ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الرَّاشِدُونَ
english: And know that God’s Apostle is among you: were he to comply with your inclinations in each and every case, you would be bound to come to harm [as a community]. But as it is, God has caused [your] faith to be dear to you, and has given it beauty in your hearts, and has made hateful to you all denial of the truth, and all iniquity, and all rebellion [against what is good]. Such indeed are they who follow the right course

arabic: فَضْلًا مِنَ اللَّهِ وَنِعْمَةً ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
english: through God’s bounty and favour; and God is all-knowing, truly wise

arabic: وَإِنْ طَائِفَتَانِ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ اقْتَتَلُوا فَأَصْلِحُوا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ فَإِنْ بَغَتْ إِحْدَاهُمَا عَلَى الْأُخْرَىٰ فَقَاتِلُوا الَّتِي تَبْغِي حَتَّىٰ تَفِيءَ إِلَىٰ أَمْرِ اللَّهِ ۚ فَإِنْ فَاءَتْ فَأَصْلِحُوا بَيْنَهُمَا بِالْعَدْلِ وَأَقْسِطُوا ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ الْمُقْسِطِينَ
english: Hence, if two groups of believers fall to fighting, make peace between them; but then, if one of the two [groups] goes on acting wrongfully towards the other, fight against the one that acts wrongfully until it reverts to God’s commandment; and if they revert, make peace between them with justice, and deal equitably [with them]: for verily, God loves those who act equitably

arabic: إِنَّمَا الْمُؤْمِنُونَ إِخْوَةٌ فَأَصْلِحُوا بَيْنَ أَخَوَيْكُمْ ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
english: All believers are but brethren. Hence, [whenever they are at odds,] make peace between your two brethren, and remain conscious of God, so that you might be graced with His mercy

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا يَسْخَرْ قَوْمٌ مِنْ قَوْمٍ عَسَىٰ أَنْ يَكُونُوا خَيْرًا مِنْهُمْ وَلَا نِسَاءٌ مِنْ نِسَاءٍ عَسَىٰ أَنْ يَكُنَّ خَيْرًا مِنْهُنَّ ۖ وَلَا تَلْمِزُوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ وَلَا تَنَابَزُوا بِالْأَلْقَابِ ۖ بِئْسَ الِاسْمُ الْفُسُوقُ بَعْدَ الْإِيمَانِ ۚ وَمَنْ لَمْ يَتُبْ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الظَّالِمُونَ
english: O YOU who have attained to faith! No men shall deride [other] men: it may well be that those [whom they deride] are better than themselves; and no women [shall deride other] women: it may well be that those [whom they deride] are better than themselves. And neither shall you defame one another, nor insult one another by [opprobrious] epithets: evil is all imputation of iniquity after [one has attained to] faith; and they who [become guilty thereof and] do not repent - it is they, they who are evildoers

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اجْتَنِبُوا كَثِيرًا مِنَ الظَّنِّ إِنَّ بَعْضَ الظَّنِّ إِثْمٌ ۖ وَلَا تَجَسَّسُوا وَلَا يَغْتَبْ بَعْضُكُمْ بَعْضًا ۚ أَيُحِبُّ أَحَدُكُمْ أَنْ يَأْكُلَ لَحْمَ أَخِيهِ مَيْتًا فَكَرِهْتُمُوهُ ۚ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ تَوَّابٌ رَحِيمٌ
english: O you who have attained to faith! Avoid most guesswork [about one another] for, behold, some of [such] guesswork is [in itself] a sin; and do not spy upon one another, and neither allow yourselves to speak ill of one another behind your backs. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? Nay, you would loathe it! And be conscious of God. Verily, God is an acceptor of repentance, a dispenser of grace

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَاكُمْ مِنْ ذَكَرٍ وَأُنْثَىٰ وَجَعَلْنَاكُمْ شُعُوبًا وَقَبَائِلَ لِتَعَارَفُوا ۚ إِنَّ أَكْرَمَكُمْ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ أَتْقَاكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلِيمٌ خَبِيرٌ
english: O men! Behold, We have created you all out of a male and a female, and have made you into nations and tribes, so that you might come to know one another. Verily, the noblest of you in the sight of God is the one who is most deeply conscious of Him. Behold, God is all-knowing, all-aware

arabic: ۞ قَالَتِ الْأَعْرَابُ آمَنَّا ۖ قُلْ لَمْ تُؤْمِنُوا وَلَٰكِنْ قُولُوا أَسْلَمْنَا وَلَمَّا يَدْخُلِ الْإِيمَانُ فِي قُلُوبِكُمْ ۖ وَإِنْ تُطِيعُوا اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ لَا يَلِتْكُمْ مِنْ أَعْمَالِكُمْ شَيْئًا ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ
english: THE BEDOUIN say, “We have attained to faith.” Say [unto them, O Muhammad]: “You have not [yet] attained to faith; you should [rather] say, ‘We have [outwardly] surrendered’ - for [true] faith has not yet entered your hearts. But if you [truly] pay heed unto God and His Apostle, He will not let the least of your deeds go to waste: for, behold, God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.”

arabic: إِنَّمَا الْمُؤْمِنُونَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَرْتَابُوا وَجَاهَدُوا بِأَمْوَالِهِمْ وَأَنْفُسِهِمْ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الصَّادِقُونَ
english: [Know that true] believers are only those who have attained to faith in God and His Apostle and have left all doubt behind, and who strive hard in God’s cause with their possessions and their lives: it is they, they who are true to their word

arabic: قُلْ أَتُعَلِّمُونَ اللَّهَ بِدِينِكُمْ وَاللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
english: Say: “Do you, perchance, [want to] inform God of [the nature of] your faith although God knows all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth? Indeed, God has full knowledge of everything!”

arabic: يَمُنُّونَ عَلَيْكَ أَنْ أَسْلَمُوا ۖ قُلْ لَا تَمُنُّوا عَلَيَّ إِسْلَامَكُمْ ۖ بَلِ اللَّهُ يَمُنُّ عَلَيْكُمْ أَنْ هَدَاكُمْ لِلْإِيمَانِ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
english: Many people think that they have bestowed a favour upon thee [O Prophet] by having surrendered [to thee]. Say thou: “Deem not your surrender a favour unto me: nay, but it is God who bestows a favour upon you by showing you the way to faith - if you are true to your word!”

arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَعْلَمُ غَيْبَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بَصِيرٌ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
english: Verily, God knows the hidden reality of the heavens and the earth; and God sees all that you do

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ ق ۚ وَالْقُرْآنِ الْمَجِيدِ
english: Qaf. CONSIDER this sublime Qur’an

arabic: بَلْ عَجِبُوا أَنْ جَاءَهُمْ مُنْذِرٌ مِنْهُمْ فَقَالَ الْكَافِرُونَ هَٰذَا شَيْءٌ عَجِيبٌ
english: But nay - they deem it strange that a warner should have come unto them from their own midst; and so these deniers of the truth are saying, “A strange thing is this

arabic: أَإِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا ۖ ذَٰلِكَ رَجْعٌ بَعِيدٌ
english: Why - [how could we be resurrected] after we have died and become mere dust? Such a return seems far-fetched indeed!”

arabic: قَدْ عَلِمْنَا مَا تَنْقُصُ الْأَرْضُ مِنْهُمْ ۖ وَعِنْدَنَا كِتَابٌ حَفِيظٌ
english: Well do We know how the earth consumes their bodies, for with Us is a record unfailing

arabic: بَلْ كَذَّبُوا بِالْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَاءَهُمْ فَهُمْ فِي أَمْرٍ مَرِيجٍ
english: Nay, but they [who refuse to believe in resurrection] have been wont to give the lie to this truth whenever it was proffered to them; and so they are in a state of confusion

arabic: أَفَلَمْ يَنْظُرُوا إِلَى السَّمَاءِ فَوْقَهُمْ كَيْفَ بَنَيْنَاهَا وَزَيَّنَّاهَا وَمَا لَهَا مِنْ فُرُوجٍ
english: Do they not look at the sky above them - how We have built it and made it beautiful and free of all faults

arabic: وَالْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَاهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ وَأَنْبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِنْ كُلِّ زَوْجٍ بَهِيجٍ
english: And the earth - We have spread it wide, and set upon it mountains firm, and caused it to bring forth plants of all beauteous kinds

arabic: تَبْصِرَةً وَذِكْرَىٰ لِكُلِّ عَبْدٍ مُنِيبٍ
english: thus offering an insight and a reminder unto every human being who willingly turns unto God

arabic: وَنَزَّلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً مُبَارَكًا فَأَنْبَتْنَا بِهِ جَنَّاتٍ وَحَبَّ الْحَصِيدِ
english: And We send down from the skies water rich in blessings, and cause thereby gardens to grow, and fields of grain

arabic: وَالنَّخْلَ بَاسِقَاتٍ لَهَا طَلْعٌ نَضِيدٌ
english: and tall palm-trees with their thickly-clustered dates

arabic: رِزْقًا لِلْعِبَادِ ۖ وَأَحْيَيْنَا بِهِ بَلْدَةً مَيْتًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ الْخُرُوجُ
english: as sustenance apportioned to men; and by [all] this We bring dead land to life: [and] even so will be [man’s] coming-forth from death

arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ وَأَصْحَابُ الرَّسِّ وَثَمُودُ
english: [Long] before those [who now deny resurrection] did Noah’s people give the lie to this truth, and [so did] the folk of Ar-Rass, and [the tribes of] Thamud

arabic: وَعَادٌ وَفِرْعَوْنُ وَإِخْوَانُ لُوطٍ
english: and Ad, and Pharaoh, and Lot’s brethren

arabic: وَأَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ وَقَوْمُ تُبَّعٍ ۚ كُلٌّ كَذَّبَ الرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ وَعِيدِ
english: and the dwellers of the wooded dales [of Madyan], and the people of Tubba: they all gave the lie to the apostles - and thereupon that whereof I had warned [them] came true

arabic: أَفَعَيِينَا بِالْخَلْقِ الْأَوَّلِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِي لَبْسٍ مِنْ خَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ
english: Could We, then, be [thought of as being] worn out by the first creation? Nay - but some people are [still] lost in doubt about [the possibility of] a new creation

arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ وَنَعْلَمُ مَا تُوَسْوِسُ بِهِ نَفْسُهُ ۖ وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنْ حَبْلِ الْوَرِيدِ
english: NOW, VERILY, it is We who have created man, and We know what his innermost self whispers within him: for We are closer to him than his neck-vein

arabic: إِذْ يَتَلَقَّى الْمُتَلَقِّيَانِ عَنِ الْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ الشِّمَالِ قَعِيدٌ
english: [And so,] whenever the two demands [of his nature] come face to face, contending from the right and from the left

arabic: مَا يَلْفِظُ مِنْ قَوْلٍ إِلَّا لَدَيْهِ رَقِيبٌ عَتِيدٌ
english: not even a word can he utter but there is a watcher with him, ever-present

arabic: وَجَاءَتْ سَكْرَةُ الْمَوْتِ بِالْحَقِّ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنْتَ مِنْهُ تَحِيدُ
english: And [then,] the twilight of death brings with it the [full] truth that [very thing, O man,] from which thou wouldst always look away! –

arabic: وَنُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْوَعِيدِ
english: and [in the end] the trumpet [of resurrection] will be blown: that will be the Day of a warning fulfilled

arabic: وَجَاءَتْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَعَهَا سَائِقٌ وَشَهِيدٌ
english: And every human being will come forward with [his erstwhile] inner urges and [his] conscious mind

arabic: لَقَدْ كُنْتَ فِي غَفْلَةٍ مِنْ هَٰذَا فَكَشَفْنَا عَنْكَ غِطَاءَكَ فَبَصَرُكَ الْيَوْمَ حَدِيدٌ
english: [and will be told:] “Indeed, unmindful hast thou been of this [Day of Judgment]; but now We have lifted from thee thy veil, and sharp is thy sight today!”

arabic: وَقَالَ قَرِينُهُ هَٰذَا مَا لَدَيَّ عَتِيدٌ
english: And one part of him will say: “This it is that has been ever-present with me!”

arabic: أَلْقِيَا فِي جَهَنَّمَ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ عَنِيدٍ
english: [Whereupon God will command:] “Cast, cast into hell every [such] stubborn enemy of the truth

arabic: مَنَّاعٍ لِلْخَيْرِ مُعْتَدٍ مُرِيبٍ
english: [every] withholder of good [and] sinful aggressor [and] fomentor of distrust [between man and man – everyone]

arabic: الَّذِي جَعَلَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ فَأَلْقِيَاهُ فِي الْعَذَابِ الشَّدِيدِ
english: who has set up another deity beside God: cast him, then, cast him into suffering severe!”

arabic: ۞ قَالَ قَرِينُهُ رَبَّنَا مَا أَطْغَيْتُهُ وَلَٰكِنْ كَانَ فِي ضَلَالٍ بَعِيدٍ
english: Man’s other self’ will say: “O our Sustainer! It was not I that led his conscious mind into evil [nay,] but it had gone far astray [of its own accord]

arabic: قَالَ لَا تَخْتَصِمُوا لَدَيَّ وَقَدْ قَدَّمْتُ إِلَيْكُمْ بِالْوَعِيدِ
english: [And] He will say: “Contend not before Me, [O you sinners,] for I gave you a forewarning [of this Day of Reckoning]

arabic: مَا يُبَدَّلُ الْقَوْلُ لَدَيَّ وَمَا أَنَا بِظَلَّامٍ لِلْعَبِيدِ
english: The judgment passed by Me shall not be altered; but never do I do the least wrong unto My creatures!”

arabic: يَوْمَ نَقُولُ لِجَهَنَّمَ هَلِ امْتَلَأْتِ وَتَقُولُ هَلْ مِنْ مَزِيدٍ
english: On that Day We will ask hell, “Art thou filled?”- and it will answer, “[Nay,] is there yet more [for me]?”

arabic: وَأُزْلِفَتِ الْجَنَّةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍ
english: And [on that Day] paradise will be brought within the sight of the God-conscious, and will no longer be far away; [and they will be told]

arabic: هَٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِكُلِّ أَوَّابٍ حَفِيظٍ
english: “This is what you were promised - [promised] unto everyone who was wont to turn unto God and to keep Him always in mind –

arabic: مَنْ خَشِيَ الرَّحْمَٰنَ بِالْغَيْبِ وَجَاءَ بِقَلْبٍ مُنِيبٍ
english: [everyone] who stood in awe of the Most Gracious although He is beyond the reach of human perception, and who has come [unto Him] with a heart full of contrition

arabic: ادْخُلُوهَا بِسَلَامٍ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْخُلُودِ
english: Enter this [paradise] in peace; this is the Day on which life abiding begins!”

arabic: لَهُمْ مَا يَشَاءُونَ فِيهَا وَلَدَيْنَا مَزِيدٌ
english: In that [paradise] they shall have whatever they may desire - but there is yet more with Us

arabic: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُمْ مِنْ قَرْنٍ هُمْ أَشَدُّ مِنْهُمْ بَطْشًا فَنَقَّبُوا فِي الْبِلَادِ هَلْ مِنْ مَحِيصٍ
english: AND HOW MANY a generation have We destroyed before those [who now deny the truth] people of greater might than theirs; but [when Our chastisement befell them,] they became wanderers on the face of the earth, seeking no more than a place of refuge

arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكْرَىٰ لِمَنْ كَانَ لَهُ قَلْبٌ أَوْ أَلْقَى السَّمْعَ وَهُوَ شَهِيدٌ
english: In this, behold, there is indeed a reminder for everyone whose heart is wide-awake -that is, [everyone who] lends ear with a conscious mind

arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ وَمَا مَسَّنَا مِنْ لُغُوبٍ
english: and [who knows that] We have indeed created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six aeons, and [that] no weariness could ever touch Us

arabic: فَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ الشَّمْسِ وَقَبْلَ الْغُرُوبِ
english: HENCE, [O believer,] bear thou with patience whatever they may say, and extol thy Sustainer’s limitless glory and praise before the rising of the sun and before its setting

arabic: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَأَدْبَارَ السُّجُودِ
english: and in the night, too, extol His glory, and at every prayer’s end

arabic: وَاسْتَمِعْ يَوْمَ يُنَادِ الْمُنَادِ مِنْ مَكَانٍ قَرِيبٍ
english: And [always] listen for the day when He who issues the call [of death] shall call [thee] from close-by

arabic: يَوْمَ يَسْمَعُونَ الصَّيْحَةَ بِالْحَقِّ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ الْخُرُوجِ
english: [and bethink thyself, too, of] the Day on which all [human beings] will in truth hear the final blast - that Day of [their] coming-forth [from death]

arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نُحْيِي وَنُمِيتُ وَإِلَيْنَا الْمَصِيرُ
english: Verily, it is We who grant life and deal death; and with Us will be all journeys’ end

arabic: يَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ الْأَرْضُ عَنْهُمْ سِرَاعًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ حَشْرٌ عَلَيْنَا يَسِيرٌ
english: on the Day when the earth is riven asunder all around them as they hasten forth [towards God’s judgment]: that gathering will be easy for Us [to encompass]

arabic: نَحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ ۖ وَمَا أَنْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ بِجَبَّارٍ ۖ فَذَكِّرْ بِالْقُرْآنِ مَنْ يَخَافُ وَعِيدِ
english: Fully aware are We of what they [who deny resurrection] do say; and thou canst by no means force them [to believe in it]. Yet none the less, remind, through this Qur’an, all such as may fear My warning

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالذَّارِيَاتِ ذَرْوًا
english: CONSIDER the winds that scatter the dust far and wide

arabic: فَالْحَامِلَاتِ وِقْرًا
english: and those that carry the burden [of heavy clouds]

arabic: فَالْجَارِيَاتِ يُسْرًا
english: and those that speed along with gentle ease

arabic: فَالْمُقَسِّمَاتِ أَمْرًا
english: and those that apportion [the gift of life] at [God’s] behest

arabic: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَصَادِقٌ
english: Verily, that which you are promised is true indeed

arabic: وَإِنَّ الدِّينَ لَوَاقِعٌ
english: and, verily, judgment is bound to come

arabic: وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الْحُبُكِ
english: CONSIDER the firmament full of starry paths

arabic: إِنَّكُمْ لَفِي قَوْلٍ مُخْتَلِفٍ
english: Verily, [O men,] you are deeply at variance as to what to believe

arabic: يُؤْفَكُ عَنْهُ مَنْ أُفِكَ
english: perverted in his views thereon is he who would deceive himself

arabic: قُتِلَ الْخَرَّاصُونَ
english: They but destroy themselves, they who are given to guessing at what they cannot ascertain –

arabic: الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي غَمْرَةٍ سَاهُونَ
english: they who blunder along, in ignorance lost –

arabic: يَسْأَلُونَ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ الدِّينِ
english: they who [mockingly] ask, “When is that Day of Judgment to be?”

arabic: يَوْمَ هُمْ عَلَى النَّارِ يُفْتَنُونَ
english: [It will be] a Day when they will be sorely tried by the fire

arabic: ذُوقُوا فِتْنَتَكُمْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
english: [and will be told:] “Taste this your trial! It is this that you were so hastily asking for!”

arabic: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
english: [But,] behold, the God-conscious will find themselves amid gardens and springs

arabic: آخِذِينَ مَا آتَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحْسِنِينَ
english: enjoying all that their Sustainer will have granted them [because], verily, they were doers of good in the past

arabic: كَانُوا قَلِيلًا مِنَ اللَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ
english: they would lie asleep during but a small part of the night

arabic: وَبِالْأَسْحَارِ هُمْ يَسْتَغْفِرُونَ
english: and would pray for forgiveness from their innermost hearts

arabic: وَفِي أَمْوَالِهِمْ حَقٌّ لِلسَّائِلِ وَالْمَحْرُومِ
english: and [would assign] in all that they possessed a due share unto such as might ask [for help] and such as might suffer privation

arabic: وَفِي الْأَرْضِ آيَاتٌ لِلْمُوقِنِينَ
english: AND ON EARTH there are signs [of God’s existence, visible] to all who are endowed with inner certainty

arabic: وَفِي أَنْفُسِكُمْ ۚ أَفَلَا تُبْصِرُونَ
english: just as [there are signs thereof] within your own selves: can you not, then, see

arabic: وَفِي السَّمَاءِ رِزْقُكُمْ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ
english: And in heaven is [the source of] your sustenance [on earth] and [of] all that you are promised [for your life after death]

arabic: فَوَرَبِّ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ إِنَّهُ لَحَقٌّ مِثْلَ مَا أَنَّكُمْ تَنْطِقُونَ
english: for, by the Sustainer of heaven and earth, this [life after death] is the very truth - as true as that you are endowed with speech

arabic: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيْفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ الْمُكْرَمِينَ
english: AND HAS the story of Abraham’s honoured guests ever come within thy ken

arabic: إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا سَلَامًا ۖ قَالَ سَلَامٌ قَوْمٌ مُنْكَرُونَ
english: When those [heavenly messengers] came unto him and bade him peace, he answered, “[And upon you be] peace!” - [saying to himself,] “They are strangers.”

arabic: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِ فَجَاءَ بِعِجْلٍ سَمِينٍ
english: Then he turned quietly to his household, and brought forth a fat [roasted] calf

arabic: فَقَرَّبَهُ إِلَيْهِمْ قَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ
english: and placed it before them, saying, “Will you not eat?”

arabic: فَأَوْجَسَ مِنْهُمْ خِيفَةً ۖ قَالُوا لَا تَخَفْ ۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَامٍ عَلِيمٍ
english: [And when he saw that the guests would not eat,] he became apprehensive of them; [but] they said, “Fear not” - and gave him the glad tiding of [the birth of] a son who would be endowed with deep knowledge

arabic: فَأَقْبَلَتِ امْرَأَتُهُ فِي صَرَّةٍ فَصَكَّتْ وَجْهَهَا وَقَالَتْ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٌ
english: Thereupon his wife approached [the guests] with a loud cry, and struck her face [in astonishment] and exclaimed: “A barren old woman [like me]!”

arabic: قَالُوا كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْحَكِيمُ الْعَلِيمُ
english: They answered: “Thus has thy Sustainer decreed; and, verily, He alone is truly wise, all- knowing!”

arabic: ۞ قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكُمْ أَيُّهَا الْمُرْسَلُونَ
english: Said [Abraham]: “And what [else] may you have in view, O you [heavenly] messengers?”

arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّا أُرْسِلْنَا إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ مُجْرِمِينَ
english: They answered: “Behold, we have been sent unto a people lost in sin

arabic: لِنُرْسِلَ عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةً مِنْ طِينٍ
english: to let loose upon them stone-hard blows of chastisement

arabic: مُسَوَّمَةً عِنْدَ رَبِّكَ لِلْمُسْرِفِينَ
english: marked out in thy Sustainer’s sight for [the punishment of] such as have wasted their own selves.”

arabic: فَأَخْرَجْنَا مَنْ كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
english: And in the course of time We brought out [of Lot ’s city] such [few] believers as were there

arabic: فَمَا وَجَدْنَا فِيهَا غَيْرَ بَيْتٍ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ
english: for apart from one [single] house We did not find there any who had surrendered themselves to Us

arabic: وَتَرَكْنَا فِيهَا آيَةً لِلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ
english: And so We left therein a message for those who fear the grievous suffering [which awaits all evildoers]

arabic: وَفِي مُوسَىٰ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَاهُ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ بِسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ
english: AND IN [the story of Pharaoh and] Moses, too, [We left the same message: for] when We sent him unto Pharaoh with [Our] manifest authority

arabic: فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكْنِهِ وَقَالَ سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ
english: and he turned away in [the pride of] his power and said, “A sorcerer [is this Moses], or a madman!” –

arabic: فَأَخَذْنَاهُ وَجُنُودَهُ فَنَبَذْنَاهُمْ فِي الْيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٌ
english: We seized him and his hosts, and cast them all into the sea: and [none but Pharaoh] himself was to blame [for what happened]

arabic: وَفِي عَادٍ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ الرِّيحَ الْعَقِيمَ
english: And [you have the same message] in [what happened to the tribe of] Ad, when We let loose against them that life-destroying wind

arabic: مَا تَذَرُ مِنْ شَيْءٍ أَتَتْ عَلَيْهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتْهُ كَالرَّمِيمِ
english: which spared nothing of what it came upon, but caused [all of] it to become like bones dead and decayed

arabic: وَفِي ثَمُودَ إِذْ قِيلَ لَهُمْ تَمَتَّعُوا حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
english: And in [the story of the tribe of] Thamud, too, when they were told, “You shall enjoy your life for [but] a little while,”

arabic: فَعَتَوْا عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّاعِقَةُ وَهُمْ يَنْظُرُونَ
english: after they had turned with disdain from their Sustainer’s commandment - whereupon the thunderbolt of punishment overtook them while they were [helplessly] looking on

arabic: فَمَا اسْتَطَاعُوا مِنْ قِيَامٍ وَمَا كَانُوا مُنْتَصِرِينَ
english: for they were unable even to rise, and could not defend themselves

arabic: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِنْ قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ
english: And [thus, too, We destroyed] Noah’s people aforetime: for they were iniquitous folk

arabic: وَالسَّمَاءَ بَنَيْنَاهَا بِأَيْدٍ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ
english: AND IT IS We who have built the universe with [Our creative] power; and, verily, it is We who are steadily expanding it

arabic: وَالْأَرْضَ فَرَشْنَاهَا فَنِعْمَ الْمَاهِدُونَ
english: And the earth have We spread out wide - and how well have We ordered it

arabic: وَمِنْ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقْنَا زَوْجَيْنِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ
english: And in everything have We created opposites, so that you might bear in mind [that God alone is One]

arabic: فَفِرُّوا إِلَى اللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُمْ مِنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ
english: And so, [O Muhammad, say unto them:] “Flee unto God [from all that is false and evil]! Verily, I am a plain warner to you from Him

arabic: وَلَا تَجْعَلُوا مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُمْ مِنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ
english: And do not ascribe divinity to aught side by side with God: verily, I am a plain warner to you from Him!”

arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ مَا أَتَى الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ مِنْ رَسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُوا سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ
english: [But] thus it is: never yet came any apostle to those who lived before their time but they said, “A spel1binder

arabic: أَتَوَاصَوْا بِهِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ
english: Have they, perchance, handed down this [way of thinking] as a legacy unto one another? Nay, they are people filled with overweening arrogance

arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَمَا أَنْتَ بِمَلُومٍ
english: Turn, then, away from them, and thou shalt incur no blame

arabic: وَذَكِّرْ فَإِنَّ الذِّكْرَىٰ تَنْفَعُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
english: yet go on reminding [all who would listen]: for, verily, such a reminder will profit the believers

arabic: وَمَا خَلَقْتُ الْجِنَّ وَالْإِنْسَ إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُونِ
english: And [tell them that] I have not created the invisible beings and men to any end other than that they may [know and] worship Me

arabic: مَا أُرِيدُ مِنْهُمْ مِنْ رِزْقٍ وَمَا أُرِيدُ أَنْ يُطْعِمُونِ
english: [But withal,] no sustenance do I ever demand of them, nor do I demand that they feed Me

arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الرَّزَّاقُ ذُو الْقُوَّةِ الْمَتِينُ
english: for, verily, God Himself is the Provider of all sustenance, the Lord of all might, the Eternal

arabic: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا ذَنُوبًا مِثْلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصْحَابِهِمْ فَلَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونِ
english: And, verily, they who are bent on doing evil shall have their share [of evil] like unto the share of their fellows [of old]: so let them not ask Me to hasten [their doom]

arabic: فَوَيْلٌ لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ يَوْمِهِمُ الَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
english: For, woe unto those who are bent on denying the truth - [woe] on the Day which they have been promised

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالطُّورِ
english: CONSIDER Mount Sinai

arabic: وَكِتَابٍ مَسْطُورٍ
english: Consider [God’s] revelation, inscribed

arabic: فِي رَقٍّ مَنْشُورٍ
english: on wide-open scrolls

arabic: وَالْبَيْتِ الْمَعْمُورِ
english: Consider the long-enduring house [of worship]

arabic: وَالسَّقْفِ الْمَرْفُوعِ
english: Consider the vault [of heaven] raised high

arabic: وَالْبَحْرِ الْمَسْجُورِ
english: Consider the surf-swollen sea

arabic: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّكَ لَوَاقِعٌ
english: VERILY, [O man,] the suffering decreed by thy Sustainer [for the sinners] will indeed come to pass

arabic: مَا لَهُ مِنْ دَافِعٍ
english: there is none who could avert it

arabic: يَوْمَ تَمُورُ السَّمَاءُ مَوْرًا
english: [It will come to pass] on the Day when the skies will be convulsed in [a great] convulsion

arabic: وَتَسِيرُ الْجِبَالُ سَيْرًا
english: and the mountains will move with [an awesome] movement

arabic: فَوَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
english: Woe, then, on that Day to all who give the lie to the truth –

arabic: الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي خَوْضٍ يَلْعَبُونَ
english: all those who [throughout their lives] but idly played with things vain –

arabic: يَوْمَ يُدَعُّونَ إِلَىٰ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا
english: on the Day when they shall be thrust into the fire with [an irresistible] thrust, [and will be told]

arabic: هَٰذِهِ النَّارُ الَّتِي كُنْتُمْ بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ
english: “This is the fire which you were wont to call a lie

arabic: أَفَسِحْرٌ هَٰذَا أَمْ أَنْتُمْ لَا تُبْصِرُونَ
english: Was it, then, a delusion or is it that you failed to see [its truth]

arabic: اصْلَوْهَا فَاصْبِرُوا أَوْ لَا تَصْبِرُوا سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ إِنَّمَا تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
english: Endure it [now]! But [whether you] bear yourselves with patience or without patience, it will be the same to you: you are but being requited for what you were wont to do.”

arabic: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَنَعِيمٍ
english: [But,] verily, the God-conscious will find themselves [on that Day] in gardens and in bliss

arabic: فَاكِهِينَ بِمَا آتَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ وَوَقَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ عَذَابَ الْجَحِيمِ
english: rejoicing in all that their Sustainer will have granted them: for their Sustainer will have warded off from them all suffering through the blazing fire

arabic: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
english: [And they will be told:] “Eat and drink with good cheer as an outcome of what you were wont to do

arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مَصْفُوفَةٍ ۖ وَزَوَّجْنَاهُمْ بِحُورٍ عِينٍ
english: reclining on couches [of happiness] ranged in rows!” And [in that paradise] We shall mate them with companions pure, most beautiful of eye

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَاتَّبَعَتْهُمْ ذُرِّيَّتُهُمْ بِإِيمَانٍ أَلْحَقْنَا بِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ وَمَا أَلَتْنَاهُمْ مِنْ عَمَلِهِمْ مِنْ شَيْءٍ ۚ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ بِمَا كَسَبَ رَهِينٌ
english: And as for those who have attained to faith and whose offspring will have followed them in faith, We shall unite them with their offspring; and We shall not let aught of their deeds go to waste: [but] every human being will be held in pledge for whatever he has earned

arabic: وَأَمْدَدْنَاهُمْ بِفَاكِهَةٍ وَلَحْمٍ مِمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ
english: And We shall bestow on them fruit and meat in abundance - whatever they may desire

arabic: يَتَنَازَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا لَا لَغْوٌ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأْثِيمٌ
english: and in that [paradise] they shall pass on to one another a cup which will not give rise to empty talk, and neither incite to sin

arabic: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ غِلْمَانٌ لَهُمْ كَأَنَّهُمْ لُؤْلُؤٌ مَكْنُونٌ
english: And they will be waited upon by [immortal] youths, [as if they were children] of their own, [as pure] as if they were pearls hidden in their shells

arabic: وَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ
english: And they [who are thus blest] will turn to one another, asking each other [about their past lives]

arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبْلُ فِي أَهْلِنَا مُشْفِقِينَ
english: They will say: “Behold, aforetime - when we were [still living] in the midst of our kith and kin - we were full of fear [at the thought of God’s displeasure]

arabic: فَمَنَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا وَوَقَانَا عَذَابَ السَّمُومِ
english: and so God has graced us with His favour, and has warded off from us all suffering through the scorching winds [of frustration]

arabic: إِنَّا كُنَّا مِنْ قَبْلُ نَدْعُوهُ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْبَرُّ الرَّحِيمُ
english: Verily, we did invoke Him [alone] ere this: [and now He has shown us] that He alone is truly benign, a true dispenser of grace!”

arabic: فَذَكِّرْ فَمَا أَنْتَ بِنِعْمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكَاهِنٍ وَلَا مَجْنُونٍ
english: EXHORT, then, [O Prophet, all men:] for, by thy Sustainer’s grace, thou art neither a soothsayer nor a madman

arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ شَاعِرٌ نَتَرَبَّصُ بِهِ رَيْبَ الْمَنُونِ
english: Or do they say, “[He is but] a poet - let us wait what time will do unto him”

arabic: قُلْ تَرَبَّصُوا فَإِنِّي مَعَكُمْ مِنَ الْمُتَرَبِّصِينَ
english: Say thou: “Wait, [then,] hopefully; behold, I, too, shall hopefully wait with you!”

arabic: أَمْ تَأْمُرُهُمْ أَحْلَامُهُمْ بِهَٰذَا ۚ أَمْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ
english: Is it their minds that bid them [to take] this [attitude] - or are they [simply] people filled with overweening arrogance

arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ تَقَوَّلَهُ ۚ بَلْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
english: Or do they say, “He himself has composed this [message]”? Nay, but they are not willing to believe

arabic: فَلْيَأْتُوا بِحَدِيثٍ مِثْلِهِ إِنْ كَانُوا صَادِقِينَ
english: But then, [if they deem it the work of a mere mortal,] let them produce another discourse like it - if what they say be true

arabic: أَمْ خُلِقُوا مِنْ غَيْرِ شَيْءٍ أَمْ هُمُ الْخَالِقُونَ
english: [Or do they deny the existence of God?] Have they themselves been created without anything [that might have caused their creation]? or were they, perchance, their own creators

arabic: أَمْ خَلَقُوا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۚ بَلْ لَا يُوقِنُونَ
english: [And] have they created the heavens and the earth? Nay, but they have no certainty of anything

arabic: أَمْ عِنْدَهُمْ خَزَائِنُ رَبِّكَ أَمْ هُمُ الْمُصَيْطِرُونَ
english: [How could they?] Are thy Sustainer’s treasures with them? Or are they in charge [of destiny]

arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ سُلَّمٌ يَسْتَمِعُونَ فِيهِ ۖ فَلْيَأْتِ مُسْتَمِعُهُمْ بِسُلْطَانٍ مُبِينٍ
english: Or have they a ladder by which they could [ascend to ultimate truths and] listen [to what is beyond the reach of human perception]? Let, then, any of them who have listened [to it] produce a manifest proof [of his knowledge]

arabic: أَمْ لَهُ الْبَنَاتُ وَلَكُمُ الْبَنُونَ
english: Or, [if you believe in God, how can you believe that] He has [chosen to have] daughters, whereas you yourselves would have [only] sons

arabic: أَمْ تَسْأَلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُمْ مِنْ مَغْرَمٍ مُثْقَلُونَ
english: Or is it that [they who reject thy message, O Muhammad, fear lest] thou ask of them a reward, so that they would be burdened with debt [if they should listen to thee]

arabic: أَمْ عِنْدَهُمُ الْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ
english: Or [do they think] that the hidden reality [of all that exists] is almost within their grasp, so that [in time] they can write it down

arabic: أَمْ يُرِيدُونَ كَيْدًا ۖ فَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا هُمُ الْمَكِيدُونَ
english: Or do they want to entrap [thee in contradictions]? But they who are bent on denying the truth - it is they who are truly entrapped

arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ إِلَٰهٌ غَيْرُ اللَّهِ ۚ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
english: Have they, then, any deity other than God? Utterly remote is God, in His limitless glory, from anything to which men may ascribe a share in His divinity

arabic: وَإِنْ يَرَوْا كِسْفًا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ سَاقِطًا يَقُولُوا سَحَابٌ مَرْكُومٌ
english: AND YET, if they [who refuse to see the truth] were to see part of the sky falling down, they would [only] say, “[It is but] a mass of clouds!”

arabic: فَذَرْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَاقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ الَّذِي فِيهِ يُصْعَقُونَ
english: Hence, leave them alone until they face that [Judgment] Day of theirs, when they will be stricken with terror

arabic: يَوْمَ لَا يُغْنِي عَنْهُمْ كَيْدُهُمْ شَيْئًا وَلَا هُمْ يُنْصَرُونَ
english: the Day when none of their scheming will be of the least avail to them, and they will receive no succour

arabic: وَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا عَذَابًا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
english: But, verily, for those who are bent on doing evil, there is suffering in store [even] closer at hand than that [supreme suffering in the hereafter]: but most of them are not aware of it

arabic: وَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا ۖ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ
english: And so, await in patience thy Sustainer’s judgment, for thou art well within Our sight. And extol thy Sustainer’s limitless glory and praise whenever thou risest up

arabic: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَإِدْبَارَ النُّجُومِ
english: and extol His glory at night, and at the time when the stars retreat

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالنَّجْمِ إِذَا هَوَىٰ
english: CONSIDER this unfolding [of God’s message], as it comes down from on high

arabic: مَا ضَلَّ صَاحِبُكُمْ وَمَا غَوَىٰ
english: This fellow-man of yours has not gone astray, nor is he deluded

arabic: وَمَا يَنْطِقُ عَنِ الْهَوَىٰ
english: and neither does he speak out of his own desire

arabic: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا وَحْيٌ يُوحَىٰ
english: that [which he conveys to you] is but [a divine] inspiration with which he is being inspired –

arabic: عَلَّمَهُ شَدِيدُ الْقُوَىٰ
english: something that a very mighty one has imparted to him

arabic: ذُو مِرَّةٍ فَاسْتَوَىٰ
english: [an angel] endowed with surpassing power, who in time manifested himself in his true shape and nature

arabic: وَهُوَ بِالْأُفُقِ الْأَعْلَىٰ
english: appearing in the horizon’s loftiest part

arabic: ثُمَّ دَنَا فَتَدَلَّىٰ
english: and then drew near, and came close

arabic: فَكَانَ قَابَ قَوْسَيْنِ أَوْ أَدْنَىٰ
english: until he was but two bow-lengths away, or even nearer

arabic: فَأَوْحَىٰ إِلَىٰ عَبْدِهِ مَا أَوْحَىٰ
english: And thus did [God] reveal unto His servant whatever He deemed right to reveal

arabic: مَا كَذَبَ الْفُؤَادُ مَا رَأَىٰ
english: The [servant’s] heart did not give the lie to what he saw

arabic: أَفَتُمَارُونَهُ عَلَىٰ مَا يَرَىٰ
english: will you, then, contend with him as to what he saw

arabic: وَلَقَدْ رَآهُ نَزْلَةً أُخْرَىٰ
english: And, indeed, he saw him a second time

arabic: عِنْدَ سِدْرَةِ الْمُنْتَهَىٰ
english: by the lote-tree of the farthest limit

arabic: عِنْدَهَا جَنَّةُ الْمَأْوَىٰ
english: near unto the garden of promise

arabic: إِذْ يَغْشَى السِّدْرَةَ مَا يَغْشَىٰ
english: with the lote-tree veiled in a veil of nameless splendour…

arabic: مَا زَاغَ الْبَصَرُ وَمَا طَغَىٰ
english: [And withal,] the eye did not waver, nor yet did it stray

arabic: لَقَدْ رَأَىٰ مِنْ آيَاتِ رَبِّهِ الْكُبْرَىٰ
english: truly did he see some of the most profound of his Sustainer’s symbols

arabic: أَفَرَأَيْتُمُ اللَّاتَ وَالْعُزَّىٰ
english: HAVE YOU, then, ever considered [what you are worshipping in] Al-Lat and Al-Uzza

arabic: وَمَنَاةَ الثَّالِثَةَ الْأُخْرَىٰ
english: as well as [in] Manat, the third and last [of this triad]

arabic: أَلَكُمُ الذَّكَرُ وَلَهُ الْأُنْثَىٰ
english: Why - for yourselves [you would choose only] male offspring, whereas to Him [you assign] female

arabic: تِلْكَ إِذًا قِسْمَةٌ ضِيزَىٰ
english: that, lo and behold, is an unfair division

arabic: إِنْ هِيَ إِلَّا أَسْمَاءٌ سَمَّيْتُمُوهَا أَنْتُمْ وَآبَاؤُكُمْ مَا أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ بِهَا مِنْ سُلْطَانٍ ۚ إِنْ يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ وَمَا تَهْوَى الْأَنْفُسُ ۖ وَلَقَدْ جَاءَهُمْ مِنْ رَبِّهِمُ الْهُدَىٰ
english: These [allegedly divine beings] are nothing but empty names which you have invented - you and your forefathers - [and] for which God has bestowed no warrant from on high. They [who worship them] follow nothing but surmise and their own wishful thinking - although right guidance has now indeed come unto them from their Sustainer

arabic: أَمْ لِلْإِنْسَانِ مَا تَمَنَّىٰ
english: Does man imagine that it is his due to have all that he might wish for

arabic: فَلِلَّهِ الْآخِرَةُ وَالْأُولَىٰ
english: despite the fact that [both] the life to come and this present [one] belong to God [alone]

arabic: ۞ وَكَمْ مِنْ مَلَكٍ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ لَا تُغْنِي شَفَاعَتُهُمْ شَيْئًا إِلَّا مِنْ بَعْدِ أَنْ يَأْذَنَ اللَّهُ لِمَنْ يَشَاءُ وَيَرْضَىٰ
english: For, however many angels there be in the heavens, their intercession can be of no least avail [to anyone] - except after God has given leave [to intercede] for whomever He wills and with whom He is well-pleased

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ لَيُسَمُّونَ الْمَلَائِكَةَ تَسْمِيَةَ الْأُنْثَىٰ
english: Behold, it is [only] such as do not [really] believe in the life to come that regard the angels as female beings

arabic: وَمَا لَهُمْ بِهِ مِنْ عِلْمٍ ۖ إِنْ يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا الظَّنَّ ۖ وَإِنَّ الظَّنَّ لَا يُغْنِي مِنَ الْحَقِّ شَيْئًا
english: and [since] they have no knowledge whatever thereof, they follow nothing but surmise: yet, behold, never can surmise take the place of truth

arabic: فَأَعْرِضْ عَنْ مَنْ تَوَلَّىٰ عَنْ ذِكْرِنَا وَلَمْ يُرِدْ إِلَّا الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا
english: Avoid thou, therefore, those who turn away from all remembrance of Us and care for no more than the life of this world

arabic: ذَٰلِكَ مَبْلَغُهُمْ مِنَ الْعِلْمِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنْ ضَلَّ عَنْ سَبِيلِهِ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ اهْتَدَىٰ
english: which, to them, is the only thing worth knowing. Behold, thy Sustainer is fully aware as to who has strayed from His path, and fully aware is He as to who follows His guidance

arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ لِيَجْزِيَ الَّذِينَ أَسَاءُوا بِمَا عَمِلُوا وَيَجْزِيَ الَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا بِالْحُسْنَى
english: Indeed, unto God belongs all that is in the heavens and all that is on earth: and so He will reward those who do evil in accordance with what they did, and will reward those who do good with ultimate good

arabic: الَّذِينَ يَجْتَنِبُونَ كَبَائِرَ الْإِثْمِ وَالْفَوَاحِشَ إِلَّا اللَّمَمَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ وَاسِعُ الْمَغْفِرَةِ ۚ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِكُمْ إِذْ أَنْشَأَكُمْ مِنَ الْأَرْضِ وَإِذْ أَنْتُمْ أَجِنَّةٌ فِي بُطُونِ أُمَّهَاتِكُمْ ۖ فَلَا تُزَكُّوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ ۖ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ اتَّقَىٰ
english: As for those who avoid the [truly] grave sins and shameful deeds - even though they may sometimes stumble behold, thy Sustainer is abounding in forgiveness. He is fully aware of you when He brings you into being out of dust, and when you are still hidden in your mothers’ wombs: do not, then, consider yourselves pure - [for] He knows best as to who is conscious of Him

arabic: أَفَرَأَيْتَ الَّذِي تَوَلَّىٰ
english: HAST THOU, then, ever considered him who turns away [from remembering Us, and cares for no more than the life of this world]

arabic: وَأَعْطَىٰ قَلِيلًا وَأَكْدَىٰ
english: and gives so little [of himself for the good of his soul], and so grudgingly

arabic: أَعِنْدَهُ عِلْمُ الْغَيْبِ فَهُوَ يَرَىٰ
english: Does he [claim to] have knowledge of something that is beyond the reach of human perception, so that he can see [it clearly]

arabic: أَمْ لَمْ يُنَبَّأْ بِمَا فِي صُحُفِ مُوسَىٰ
english: Or has he never yet been told of what was [said] in the revelations of Moses

arabic: وَإِبْرَاهِيمَ الَّذِي وَفَّىٰ
english: and of Abraham, who to his trust was true

arabic: أَلَّا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٌ وِزْرَ أُخْرَىٰ
english: that no bearer of burdens shall be made to bear another’s burden

arabic: وَأَنْ لَيْسَ لِلْإِنْسَانِ إِلَّا مَا سَعَىٰ
english: and that nought shall be accounted unto man but what he is striving for

arabic: وَأَنَّ سَعْيَهُ سَوْفَ يُرَىٰ
english: and that in time [the nature of] all his striving will be shown [to him in its true light]

arabic: ثُمَّ يُجْزَاهُ الْجَزَاءَ الْأَوْفَىٰ
english: whereupon he shall be requited for it with the fullest requital

arabic: وَأَنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ الْمُنْتَهَىٰ
english: and that with thy Sustainer is the beginning and the end [of all that exists]

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ أَضْحَكَ وَأَبْكَىٰ
english: and that it is He alone who causes [you] to laugh and to weep

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ أَمَاتَ وَأَحْيَا
english: and that it is He alone who deals death and grants life

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ خَلَقَ الزَّوْجَيْنِ الذَّكَرَ وَالْأُنْثَىٰ
english: and that it is He who creates the two kinds - the male and the female –

arabic: مِنْ نُطْفَةٍ إِذَا تُمْنَىٰ
english: out of a [mere] drop of sperm as it is poured forth

arabic: وَأَنَّ عَلَيْهِ النَّشْأَةَ الْأُخْرَىٰ
english: and that [therefore] it is within His power to bring about a second life

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ أَغْنَىٰ وَأَقْنَىٰ
english: and that it is He alone who frees from want and causes to possess

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ هُوَ رَبُّ الشِّعْرَىٰ
english: and that it is He alone who sustains the brightest star

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ أَهْلَكَ عَادًا الْأُولَىٰ
english: and that it is He who destroyed the ancient [tribes of] Ad

arabic: وَثَمُودَ فَمَا أَبْقَىٰ
english: and Thamud, leaving no trace [of them]

arabic: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِنْ قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا هُمْ أَظْلَمَ وَأَطْغَىٰ
english: as well as the people of Noah before them - [since,] verily, they all had been most willful in their evildoing and most overweening –

arabic: وَالْمُؤْتَفِكَةَ أَهْوَىٰ
english: just as He thrust into perdition those cities that were overthrown

arabic: فَغَشَّاهَا مَا غَشَّىٰ
english: and then covered them from sight forever

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكَ تَتَمَارَىٰ
english: About which, then, of thy Sustainer’s powers canst thou [still] remain in doubt

arabic: هَٰذَا نَذِيرٌ مِنَ النُّذُرِ الْأُولَىٰ
english: THIS IS a warning like those warnings of old

arabic: أَزِفَتِ الْآزِفَةُ
english: that [Last Hour] which is so near draws ever nearer

arabic: لَيْسَ لَهَا مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ كَاشِفَةٌ
english: [although] none but God can unveil it

arabic: أَفَمِنْ هَٰذَا الْحَدِيثِ تَعْجَبُونَ
english: Do you, perchance, find this tiding strange

arabic: وَتَضْحَكُونَ وَلَا تَبْكُونَ
english: And do you laugh instead of weeping

arabic: وَأَنْتُمْ سَامِدُونَ
english: and divert yourselves all the while

arabic: فَاسْجُدُوا لِلَّهِ وَاعْبُدُوا ۩
english: [Nay,] but prostrate yourselves before God, and worship [Him alone]

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ اقْتَرَبَتِ السَّاعَةُ وَانْشَقَّ الْقَمَرُ
english: THE LAST HOUR draws near, and the moon is split asunder

arabic: وَإِنْ يَرَوْا آيَةً يُعْرِضُوا وَيَقُولُوا سِحْرٌ مُسْتَمِرٌّ
english: But if they [who reject all thought of the Last Hour] were to see a sign [of its approach], they would turn aside and say, “An ever-recurring delusion!” –

arabic: وَكَذَّبُوا وَاتَّبَعُوا أَهْوَاءَهُمْ ۚ وَكُلُّ أَمْرٍ مُسْتَقِرٌّ
english: for they are bent on giving it the lie, being always wont to follow their own desires. Yet everything reveals its truth in the end

arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَاءَهُمْ مِنَ الْأَنْبَاءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزْدَجَرٌ
english: And withal, there has come unto them many a tiding that should have restrained [their arrogance]

arabic: حِكْمَةٌ بَالِغَةٌ ۖ فَمَا تُغْنِ النُّذُرُ
english: far-reaching wisdom [was held out to them]: but [since] all warnings have been of no avail

arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ ۘ يَوْمَ يَدْعُ الدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَيْءٍ نُكُرٍ
english: turn thou away from them. On the Day when the Summoning Voice will summon [man] unto something that the mind cannot conceive

arabic: خُشَّعًا أَبْصَارُهُمْ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ الْأَجْدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمْ جَرَادٌ مُنْتَشِرٌ
english: they will come forth from their graves, with their eyes downcast, [swarming about] like locusts scattered [by the wind]

arabic: مُهْطِعِينَ إِلَى الدَّاعِ ۖ يَقُولُ الْكَافِرُونَ هَٰذَا يَوْمٌ عَسِرٌ
english: running in confusion towards the Summoning Voice; [and] those who [now] deny the truth will exclaim, “Calamitous is this Day!”

arabic: ۞ كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ فَكَذَّبُوا عَبْدَنَا وَقَالُوا مَجْنُونٌ وَازْدُجِرَ
english: [LONG] BEFORE those [who now deny resurrection] did Noah’s people call it a lie; and they gave the lie to Our servant and said, “Mad is he!” - and he was repulsed

arabic: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُ أَنِّي مَغْلُوبٌ فَانْتَصِرْ
english: Thereupon he called out to his Sustainer, “Verily, I am defeated; come Thou, then, to my succour!”

arabic: فَفَتَحْنَا أَبْوَابَ السَّمَاءِ بِمَاءٍ مُنْهَمِرٍ
english: And so We caused the gates of heaven to open with water pouring down in torrents

arabic: وَفَجَّرْنَا الْأَرْضَ عُيُونًا فَالْتَقَى الْمَاءُ عَلَىٰ أَمْرٍ قَدْ قُدِرَ
english: and caused the earth to burst forth with springs, so that the waters met for a purpose pre-ordained

arabic: وَحَمَلْنَاهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلْوَاحٍ وَدُسُرٍ
english: but him We bore on that [vessel] made of [mere] planks and nails

arabic: تَجْرِي بِأَعْيُنِنَا جَزَاءً لِمَنْ كَانَ كُفِرَ
english: and it floated under Our eyes: a recompense for him who had been rejected with ingratitude

arabic: وَلَقَدْ تَرَكْنَاهَا آيَةً فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ
english: And, indeed, We have caused such [floating vessels] to remain forever a sign [of Our grace unto man]: who, then, is willing to take it to heart

arabic: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
english: And how severe is the suffering which I inflict when My warnings are disregarded

arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ
english: Hence, indeed, We made this Qur’an easy to bear in mind: who, then, is willing to take it to heart

arabic: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
english: TO THE TRUTH gave the lie [the tribe of] Ad: and how severe was the suffering which I inflicted when My warnings were disregarded

arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ رِيحًا صَرْصَرًا فِي يَوْمِ نَحْسٍ مُسْتَمِرٍّ
english: Behold, We let loose upon them a raging storm wind on a day of bitter misfortune

arabic: تَنْزِعُ النَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ مُنْقَعِرٍ
english: it swept the people away as though they were palm-trunks uprooted

arabic: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
english: for, how severe is the suffering which I inflict when My warnings are disregarded

arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ
english: Hence, indeed, We made this Qur’an easy to bear in mind: who, then, is willing to take it to heart

arabic: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِالنُّذُرِ
english: [AND the tribe of] Thamud gave the lie to all [Our] warnings

arabic: فَقَالُوا أَبَشَرًا مِنَّا وَاحِدًا نَتَّبِعُهُ إِنَّا إِذًا لَفِي ضَلَالٍ وَسُعُرٍ
english: and they said: “Are we to follow one single mortal, one from among ourselves? In that case, behold, we would certainly sink into error and folly

arabic: أَأُلْقِيَ الذِّكْرُ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ بَيْنِنَا بَلْ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٌ
english: Why - on him alone from among all of us should a [divine] reminder have been bestowed? Nay, but he is a boastful liar!”

arabic: سَيَعْلَمُونَ غَدًا مَنِ الْكَذَّابُ الْأَشِرُ
english: [And God said:] “On the morrow they will come to know who the boastful liar is

arabic: إِنَّا مُرْسِلُو النَّاقَةِ فِتْنَةً لَهُمْ فَارْتَقِبْهُمْ وَاصْطَبِرْ
english: Behold, [O Salih] We are letting loose this she-camel as a test for them; and thou but watch them, and contain thyself in patience

arabic: وَنَبِّئْهُمْ أَنَّ الْمَاءَ قِسْمَةٌ بَيْنَهُمْ ۖ كُلُّ شِرْبٍ مُحْتَضَرٌ
english: And let them know that the water [of their wells] is to be divided between them, with each share of water equitably apportioned.”

arabic: فَنَادَوْا صَاحِبَهُمْ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ
english: But they summoned their [boldest] companion, and he ventured [upon the evil deed], and cruelly slaughtered [the animal]

arabic: فَكَيْفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
english: and how severe was the suffering which I inflicted when My warnings were disregarded

arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ صَيْحَةً وَاحِدَةً فَكَانُوا كَهَشِيمِ الْمُحْتَظِرِ
english: Behold, We let loose upon them one single blast [of Our punishment], and they became like the dried-up, crumbling twigs of a sheepfold

arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ
english: Hence, indeed, We made this Qur’an easy to bear in mind: who, then, is willing to take it to heart

arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍ بِالنُّذُرِ
english: LOT ’S PEOPLE [too] gave the lie to all [Our] warnings

arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ حَاصِبًا إِلَّا آلَ لُوطٍ ۖ نَجَّيْنَاهُمْ بِسَحَرٍ
english: [and so,] behold, We let loose upon them a deadly tempest; and only Lot ’s kinsfolk did We save at the break of dawn

arabic: نِعْمَةً مِنْ عِنْدِنَا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي مَنْ شَكَرَ
english: as a blessing from Us: thus do We reward all who are grateful

arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَنْذَرَهُمْ بَطْشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوْا بِالنُّذُرِ
english: For he had truly warned them of Our punishing might; but they stubbornly cast doubt on these warnings

arabic: وَلَقَدْ رَاوَدُوهُ عَنْ ضَيْفِهِ فَطَمَسْنَا أَعْيُنَهُمْ فَذُوقُوا عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
english: and even demanded that he give up his guests [to them]: whereupon We deprived them of their sight [and thus told them, as it were]: “Taste, then, the suffering which I inflict when My warnings are disregarded!”

arabic: وَلَقَدْ صَبَّحَهُمْ بُكْرَةً عَذَابٌ مُسْتَقِرٌّ
english: And, indeed, abiding suffering did befall them early on the morrow

arabic: فَذُوقُوا عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
english: “Taste, then, the suffering which I inflict when My warnings are disregarded!”

arabic: وَلَقَدْ يَسَّرْنَا الْقُرْآنَ لِلذِّكْرِ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ
english: Hence, indeed, We made this Qur’an easy to bear in mind: who, then, is willing to take it to heart

arabic: وَلَقَدْ جَاءَ آلَ فِرْعَوْنَ النُّذُرُ
english: Now surely, unto Pharaoh’s folk [too] came such warnings

arabic: كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذْنَاهُمْ أَخْذَ عَزِيزٍ مُقْتَدِرٍ
english: they, too, gave the lie to all Our messages: and thereupon We took them to task as only the Almighty, who determines all things, can take to task

arabic: أَكُفَّارُكُمْ خَيْرٌ مِنْ أُولَٰئِكُمْ أَمْ لَكُمْ بَرَاءَةٌ فِي الزُّبُرِ
english: ARE, THEN, those of you who [now] deny the truth better than those others - or have you, perchance, [been promised] immunity in the [ancient] books of [divine] wisdom

arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ نَحْنُ جَمِيعٌ مُنْتَصِرٌ
english: Or do they say, “We are a group united, [and therefore] bound to prevail”

arabic: سَيُهْزَمُ الْجَمْعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ الدُّبُرَ
english: [Yet] the hosts [of those who deny the truth] shall be routed, and they shall turn their backs [in flight]

arabic: بَلِ السَّاعَةُ مَوْعِدُهُمْ وَالسَّاعَةُ أَدْهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ
english: But nay - the Last Hour is the time when they shall truly meet their fate; and that Last Hour will be most calamitous, and most bitter

arabic: إِنَّ الْمُجْرِمِينَ فِي ضَلَالٍ وَسُعُرٍ
english: for, behold, those who are lost in sin [will at that time come to know that it is they who] were sunk in error and folly

arabic: يَوْمَ يُسْحَبُونَ فِي النَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ ذُوقُوا مَسَّ سَقَرَ
english: On the Day when they shall be dragged into the fire on their faces, [they will be told:] “Taste now the touch of hell-fire!”

arabic: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقْنَاهُ بِقَدَرٍ
english: BEHOLD, everything have We created in due measure and proportion

arabic: وَمَا أَمْرُنَا إِلَّا وَاحِدَةٌ كَلَمْحٍ بِالْبَصَرِ
english: and Our ordaining [a thing and its coming into being] is but one [act], like the twinkling of an eye

arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَهْلَكْنَا أَشْيَاعَكُمْ فَهَلْ مِنْ مُدَّكِرٍ
english: Thus, indeed, did We destroy people like you [in the past]: who, then, is willing to take it to heart

arabic: وَكُلُّ شَيْءٍ فَعَلُوهُ فِي الزُّبُرِ
english: [They were truly guilty] because all [the evil] that they ever did had been [revealed to them as such] in the [ancient] books of [divine] wisdom

arabic: وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٍ وَكَبِيرٍ مُسْتَطَرٌ
english: and everything [that man does], be it small or great, is recorded [with God]

arabic: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَنَهَرٍ
english: [Hence, too,] behold, the God-conscious will find themselves in [a paradise of] gardens and running waters

arabic: فِي مَقْعَدِ صِدْقٍ عِنْدَ مَلِيكٍ مُقْتَدِرٍ
english: in a seat of truth, in the presence of a Sovereign who determines all things

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ الرَّحْمَٰنُ
english: THE MOST GRACIOUS

arabic: عَلَّمَ الْقُرْآنَ
english: has imparted this Qur’an [unto man]

arabic: خَلَقَ الْإِنْسَانَ
english: He has created man

arabic: عَلَّمَهُ الْبَيَانَ
english: He has imparted unto him articulate thought and speech

arabic: الشَّمْسُ وَالْقَمَرُ بِحُسْبَانٍ
english: [At His behest] the sun and the moon run their appointed courses

arabic: وَالنَّجْمُ وَالشَّجَرُ يَسْجُدَانِ
english: [before Him] prostrate themselves the stars and the trees

arabic: وَالسَّمَاءَ رَفَعَهَا وَوَضَعَ الْمِيزَانَ
english: And the skies has He raised high, and has devised [for all things] a measure

arabic: أَلَّا تَطْغَوْا فِي الْمِيزَانِ
english: so that you [too, O men,] might never transgress the measure [of what is right]

arabic: وَأَقِيمُوا الْوَزْنَ بِالْقِسْطِ وَلَا تُخْسِرُوا الْمِيزَانَ
english: weigh, therefore, [your deeds] with equity, and cut not the measure short

arabic: وَالْأَرْضَ وَضَعَهَا لِلْأَنَامِ
english: And the earth has He spread out for all living beings

arabic: فِيهَا فَاكِهَةٌ وَالنَّخْلُ ذَاتُ الْأَكْمَامِ
english: with fruit thereon, and palm trees with sheathed clusters [of dates]

arabic: وَالْحَبُّ ذُو الْعَصْفِ وَالرَّيْحَانُ
english: and grain growing tall on its stalks, and sweet-smelling plants

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: خَلَقَ الْإِنْسَانَ مِنْ صَلْصَالٍ كَالْفَخَّارِ
english: He has created man out of sounding clay, like pottery

arabic: وَخَلَقَ الْجَانَّ مِنْ مَارِجٍ مِنْ نَارٍ
english: whereas the invisible beings He has created out of a confusing flame of fire

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: رَبُّ الْمَشْرِقَيْنِ وَرَبُّ الْمَغْرِبَيْنِ
english: [He is] the Sustainer of the two farthest points of sunrise, and the Sustainer of the two farthest points of sunset

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: مَرَجَ الْبَحْرَيْنِ يَلْتَقِيَانِ
english: He has given freedom to the two great bodies of water, so that they might meet

arabic: بَيْنَهُمَا بَرْزَخٌ لَا يَبْغِيَانِ
english: [yet] between them is a barrier which they may not transgress

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: يَخْرُجُ مِنْهُمَا اللُّؤْلُؤُ وَالْمَرْجَانُ
english: Out of these two [bodies of water] come forth pearls, both great and small

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: وَلَهُ الْجَوَارِ الْمُنْشَآتُ فِي الْبَحْرِ كَالْأَعْلَامِ
english: And His are the lofty ships that sail like [floating] mountains through the seas

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: كُلُّ مَنْ عَلَيْهَا فَانٍ
english: All that lives on earth or in the heavens is bound to pass away

arabic: وَيَبْقَىٰ وَجْهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ
english: but forever will abide thy Sustainer’s Self, full of majesty and glory

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: يَسْأَلُهُ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ هُوَ فِي شَأْنٍ
english: On Him depends all creatures in the heavens and on earth; [and] every day He manifests Himself in yet another [wondrous] way

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: سَنَفْرُغُ لَكُمْ أَيُّهَ الثَّقَلَانِ
english: [ONE DAY] We shall take you to task, O you sin-laden two

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: يَا مَعْشَرَ الْجِنِّ وَالْإِنْسِ إِنِ اسْتَطَعْتُمْ أَنْ تَنْفُذُوا مِنْ أَقْطَارِ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ فَانْفُذُوا ۚ لَا تَنْفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلْطَانٍ
english: O you who live in close communion with [evil] invisible beings and humans! If you [think that you] can pass beyond the regions of the heavens and the earth, pass beyond them! [But] you cannot pass beyond them, save by a sanction [from God]

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: يُرْسَلُ عَلَيْكُمَا شُوَاظٌ مِنْ نَارٍ وَنُحَاسٌ فَلَا تَنْتَصِرَانِ
english: A flash of fire will be let loose upon you, and smoke, and you will be left without succour

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: فَإِذَا انْشَقَّتِ السَّمَاءُ فَكَانَتْ وَرْدَةً كَالدِّهَانِ
english: And when the sky is rent asunder and becomes red like [burning] oil

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لَا يُسْأَلُ عَنْ ذَنْبِهِ إِنْسٌ وَلَا جَانٌّ
english: For on that Day neither man nor invisible being will be asked about his sins

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: يُعْرَفُ الْمُجْرِمُونَ بِسِيمَاهُمْ فَيُؤْخَذُ بِالنَّوَاصِي وَالْأَقْدَامِ
english: All who were lost in sin shall by their marks be known, and shall by their forelocks and their feet be seized

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: هَٰذِهِ جَهَنَّمُ الَّتِي يُكَذِّبُ بِهَا الْمُجْرِمُونَ
english: This will be the hell which those who are lost in sin [now] call a lie

arabic: يَطُوفُونَ بَيْنَهَا وَبَيْنَ حَمِيمٍ آنٍ
english: between it and [their own] burning-hot despair will they wander to and fro

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: وَلِمَنْ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِ جَنَّتَانِ
english: BUT FOR THOSE who of their Sustainer’s Presence stand in fear, two gardens [of paradise are readied]

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow? –

arabic: ذَوَاتَا أَفْنَانٍ
english: [two gardens] of many wondrous hues

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: فِيهِمَا عَيْنَانِ تَجْرِيَانِ
english: In [each of] these two [gardens] two springs will flow

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: فِيهِمَا مِنْ كُلِّ فَاكِهَةٍ زَوْجَانِ
english: In [each of] these two will two kinds of every fruit be [found]

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer s powers can you disavow

arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ فُرُشٍ بَطَائِنُهَا مِنْ إِسْتَبْرَقٍ ۚ وَجَنَى الْجَنَّتَيْنِ دَانٍ
english: [In such a paradise the blest will dwell,] reclining upon carpets lined with rich brocade; and the fruit of both these gardens will be within easy reach

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: فِيهِنَّ قَاصِرَاتُ الطَّرْفِ لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنْسٌ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَانٌّ
english: In these [gardens] will be mates of modest gaze, whom neither man nor invisible being will have touched ere then

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: كَأَنَّهُنَّ الْيَاقُوتُ وَالْمَرْجَانُ
english: [When you are promised splendours] as though [of] rubies and [of] pearls –

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: هَلْ جَزَاءُ الْإِحْسَانِ إِلَّا الْإِحْسَانُ
english: Could the reward of good be aught but good

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: وَمِنْ دُونِهِمَا جَنَّتَانِ
english: And besides those two will be yet two [other] gardens

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow? –

arabic: مُدْهَامَّتَانِ
english: two [gardens] of the deepest green

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: فِيهِمَا عَيْنَانِ نَضَّاخَتَانِ
english: In [each of] these two [gardens] will two springs gush forth

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: فِيهِمَا فَاكِهَةٌ وَنَخْلٌ وَرُمَّانٌ
english: In both of them will be [all kinds of] fruit, and date-palms and pomegranates

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: فِيهِنَّ خَيْرَاتٌ حِسَانٌ
english: In these [gardens] will be [all] things most excellent and beautiful

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: حُورٌ مَقْصُورَاتٌ فِي الْخِيَامِ
english: [There the blest will live with their] companions pure and modest, in pavilions [splendid]

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow? –

arabic: لَمْ يَطْمِثْهُنَّ إِنْسٌ قَبْلَهُمْ وَلَا جَانٌّ
english: [companions] whom neither man nor invisible being will have touched ere then

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ رَفْرَفٍ خُضْرٍ وَعَبْقَرِيٍّ حِسَانٍ
english: [In such a paradise will they dwell,] reclining upon meadows green and carpets rich in beauty

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ آلَاءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
english: Which, then, of your Sustainer’s powers can you disavow

arabic: تَبَارَكَ اسْمُ رَبِّكَ ذِي الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ
english: HALLOWED be thy Sustainer’s name, full of majesty and glory

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا وَقَعَتِ الْوَاقِعَةُ
english: WHEN THAT which must come to pass [at last] comes to pass

arabic: لَيْسَ لِوَقْعَتِهَا كَاذِبَةٌ
english: there will be nought that could give the lie to its having come to pass

arabic: خَافِضَةٌ رَافِعَةٌ
english: abasing [some], exalting [others]

arabic: إِذَا رُجَّتِ الْأَرْضُ رَجًّا
english: When the earth is shaken with a shaking [severe]

arabic: وَبُسَّتِ الْجِبَالُ بَسًّا
english: and the mountains are shattered into [countless] shards

arabic: فَكَانَتْ هَبَاءً مُنْبَثًّا
english: so that they become as scattered dust –

arabic: وَكُنْتُمْ أَزْوَاجًا ثَلَاثَةً
english: [on that Day,] then, shall you be [divided into] three kinds

arabic: فَأَصْحَابُ الْمَيْمَنَةِ مَا أَصْحَابُ الْمَيْمَنَةِ
english: Thus, there shall be such as will have attained to what is right: oh, how [happy] will be they who have attained to what is right

arabic: وَأَصْحَابُ الْمَشْأَمَةِ مَا أَصْحَابُ الْمَشْأَمَةِ
english: And there shall be such as will have lost themselves in evil: oh, how [unhappy] will be they who have lost themselves in evil

arabic: وَالسَّابِقُونَ السَّابِقُونَ
english: But the foremost shall be [they who in life were] the foremost [in faith and good works]

arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ الْمُقَرَّبُونَ
english: they who were [always] drawn close unto God

arabic: فِي جَنَّاتِ النَّعِيمِ
english: In gardens of bliss [will they dwell]

arabic: ثُلَّةٌ مِنَ الْأَوَّلِينَ
english: a good many of those of olden times

arabic: وَقَلِيلٌ مِنَ الْآخِرِينَ
english: but [only] a few of later times

arabic: عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مَوْضُونَةٍ
english: [They will be seated] on gold-encrusted thrones of happiness

arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَيْهَا مُتَقَابِلِينَ
english: reclining upon them, facing one another [in love]

arabic: يَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَانٌ مُخَلَّدُونَ
english: Immortal youths will wait upon them

arabic: بِأَكْوَابٍ وَأَبَارِيقَ وَكَأْسٍ مِنْ مَعِينٍ
english: with goblets, and ewers, and cups filled with water from unsullied springs
