english: AND HOW MANY a community has turned with disdain from the commandment of its Sustainer and His apostles! -whereupon We callled them all to account with an accounting severe, and caused them to suffer with a suffering unnameable

arabic: فَذَاقَتْ وَبَالَ أَمْرِهَا وَكَانَ عَاقِبَةُ أَمْرِهَا خُسْرًا
english: and thus they had to taste the evil outcome of their own doing: for, [in this world,] the end of their doings was ruin

arabic: أَعَدَّ اللَّهُ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا ۖ فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ يَا أُولِي الْأَلْبَابِ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا ۚ قَدْ أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ إِلَيْكُمْ ذِكْرًا
english: [the while] God has readied for them [yet more] suffering severe [in the life to come] Hence, remain conscious of God, O you who are endowed with insight - [you] who have attained to faith! God has indeed bestowed on you a reminder from on high

arabic: رَسُولًا يَتْلُو عَلَيْكُمْ آيَاتِ اللَّهِ مُبَيِّنَاتٍ لِيُخْرِجَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ مِنَ الظُّلُمَاتِ إِلَى النُّورِ ۚ وَمَنْ يُؤْمِنْ بِاللَّهِ وَيَعْمَلْ صَالِحًا يُدْخِلْهُ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا ۖ قَدْ أَحْسَنَ اللَّهُ لَهُ رِزْقًا
english: [He has sent] an apostle who conveys unto you God's clear messages, so that He might those who have attained to faith and do righteous deeds out of the depths of darkness into the light. And whoever believes in God and does what is right and just, him will He admit into gardens through which running waters flow, therein to abide beyond the count of time: indeed, a most goodly provision will God have granted him

arabic: اللَّهُ الَّذِي خَلَقَ سَبْعَ سَمَاوَاتٍ وَمِنَ الْأَرْضِ مِثْلَهُنَّ يَتَنَزَّلُ الْأَمْرُ بَيْنَهُنَّ لِتَعْلَمُوا أَنَّ اللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ قَدْ أَحَاطَ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عِلْمًا
english: GOD is He who has created seven heavens, and, like them, [the many aspects] of the earth. Through all of them flows down from on high, unceasingly, His [creative] will, so that you might come to know that God has the power to will anything, and that God encompasses all things with His knowledge

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ لِمَ تُحَرِّمُ مَا أَحَلَّ اللَّهُ لَكَ ۖ تَبْتَغِي مَرْضَاتَ أَزْوَاجِكَ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ
english: O PROPHET! Why dost thou, out of a desire to please [one or another of] thy wives, impose [on thyself] a prohibition of something that God has made lawful to thee? But God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace

arabic: قَدْ فَرَضَ اللَّهُ لَكُمْ تَحِلَّةَ أَيْمَانِكُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ مَوْلَاكُمْ ۖ وَهُوَ الْعَلِيمُ الْحَكِيمُ
english: God has already enjoined upon you [O believers] the breaking and expiation of [such of] your oaths [as may run counter to what is right and just]: for, God is your Lord Supreme, and He alone is all-knowing, truly wise

arabic: وَإِذْ أَسَرَّ النَّبِيُّ إِلَىٰ بَعْضِ أَزْوَاجِهِ حَدِيثًا فَلَمَّا نَبَّأَتْ بِهِ وَأَظْهَرَهُ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ عَرَّفَ بَعْضَهُ وَأَعْرَضَ عَنْ بَعْضٍ ۖ فَلَمَّا نَبَّأَهَا بِهِ قَالَتْ مَنْ أَنْبَأَكَ هَٰذَا ۖ قَالَ نَبَّأَنِيَ الْعَلِيمُ الْخَبِيرُ
english: And lo! [It so happened that] the Prophet told something in confidence to one of his wives; and when she thereupon divulged it, and God made this known to him, he acquainted [others] with some of it and passed over some of it. And as soon as he let her know it, she asked, "Who has told thee this?" - [to which] he replied, "The All-Knowing, the All-Aware has told me

arabic: إِنْ تَتُوبَا إِلَى اللَّهِ فَقَدْ صَغَتْ قُلُوبُكُمَا ۖ وَإِنْ تَظَاهَرَا عَلَيْهِ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ مَوْلَاهُ وَجِبْرِيلُ وَصَالِحُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ۖ وَالْمَلَائِكَةُ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ ظَهِيرٌ
english: [Say, O Prophet:] "Would that you two turn unto God in repentance, for the hearts of both of you have swerved [from what is right]! And if you uphold each other against him [who is God's message-bearer, know that] God Himself is his Protector, and [that,] therefore, Gabriel, and all the righteous among the believers and all the [other] angels will come to his aid

arabic: عَسَىٰ رَبُّهُ إِنْ طَلَّقَكُنَّ أَنْ يُبْدِلَهُ أَزْوَاجًا خَيْرًا مِنْكُنَّ مُسْلِمَاتٍ مُؤْمِنَاتٍ قَانِتَاتٍ تَائِبَاتٍ عَابِدَاتٍ سَائِحَاتٍ ثَيِّبَاتٍ وَأَبْكَارًا
english: [O wives of the Prophet!] Were he to divorce [any of] you, God might well give him in your stead spouses better than you - women who surrender themselves unto God, who truly believe, devoutly obey His will, turn [unto Him] in repentance [whenever they have sinned] worship [Him alone] and go on and on [seeking His goodly acceptance] - be they women previously married or virgins

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا قُوا أَنْفُسَكُمْ وَأَهْلِيكُمْ نَارًا وَقُودُهَا النَّاسُ وَالْحِجَارَةُ عَلَيْهَا مَلَائِكَةٌ غِلَاظٌ شِدَادٌ لَا يَعْصُونَ اللَّهَ مَا أَمَرَهُمْ وَيَفْعَلُونَ مَا يُؤْمَرُونَ
english: O YOU who have attained to faith! Ward off from yourselves and those who are close to you that fire [of the hereafter] whose fuel is human beings and stones: [lording] over it are angelic powers awesome [and] severe, who do not disobey God in whatever He has commanded them, but [always] do what they are bidden to do

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَا تَعْتَذِرُوا الْيَوْمَ ۖ إِنَّمَا تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
english: [Hence,] O you who are bent on denying the truth, make no [empty] excuses today: [in the life to come] you shall be but recompensed for what you were doing [in this world]

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا تُوبُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ تَوْبَةً نَصُوحًا عَسَىٰ رَبُّكُمْ أَنْ يُكَفِّرَ عَنْكُمْ سَيِّئَاتِكُمْ وَيُدْخِلَكُمْ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ يَوْمَ لَا يُخْزِي اللَّهُ النَّبِيَّ وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مَعَهُ ۖ نُورُهُمْ يَسْعَىٰ بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَبِأَيْمَانِهِمْ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا أَتْمِمْ لَنَا نُورَنَا وَاغْفِرْ لَنَا ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
english: O you who have attained to faith! Turn unto God in sincere repentance: it may well be that your Sustainer will efface from you your bad deeds, and will admit you into gardens through which running waters flow, on a Day on which God will not shame the Prophet and those who share his faith: their light will spread rapidly before them, and on their right; [and] they will pray: "O our Sustainer! Cause this our light to shine for us forever, and forgive us our sins: for, verily, Thou hast the power to will anything

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ جَاهِدِ الْكُفَّارَ وَالْمُنَافِقِينَ وَاغْلُظْ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ وَمَأْوَاهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ
english: O PROPHET! Strive hard against the deniers of the truth and the hypocrites, and be adamant with them. And [if they do not repent,] their goal shall be hell - and how vile a journey’s end

arabic: ضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا امْرَأَتَ نُوحٍ وَامْرَأَتَ لُوطٍ ۖ كَانَتَا تَحْتَ عَبْدَيْنِ مِنْ عِبَادِنَا صَالِحَيْنِ فَخَانَتَاهُمَا فَلَمْ يُغْنِيَا عَنْهُمَا مِنَ اللَّهِ شَيْئًا وَقِيلَ ادْخُلَا النَّارَ مَعَ الدَّاخِلِينَ
english: For those who are bent on denying the truth God has propounded a parable in [the stories of] Noah's wife and Lot's wife: they were wedded to two of Our righteous servants, and each one betrayed her husband; and neither of the two [husbands] will be of any avail to these two women when they are told [on Judgment Day], "Enter the fire with all those [other sinners] who enter it

arabic: وَضَرَبَ اللَّهُ مَثَلًا لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا امْرَأَتَ فِرْعَوْنَ إِذْ قَالَتْ رَبِّ ابْنِ لِي عِنْدَكَ بَيْتًا فِي الْجَنَّةِ وَنَجِّنِي مِنْ فِرْعَوْنَ وَعَمَلِهِ وَنَجِّنِي مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ
english: And for those who have attained to faith God has propounded a parable in [the story of] Pharaoh's wife as she prayed "O my Sustainer! Build Thou for me a mansion in the paradise [that is] with Thee, and save me from Pharaoh and his doings, and save me, from all evildoing folk

arabic: وَمَرْيَمَ ابْنَتَ عِمْرَانَ الَّتِي أَحْصَنَتْ فَرْجَهَا فَنَفَخْنَا فِيهِ مِنْ رُوحِنَا وَصَدَّقَتْ بِكَلِمَاتِ رَبِّهَا وَكُتُبِهِ وَكَانَتْ مِنَ الْقَانِتِينَ
english: And [We have propounded yet another parable of God-consciousness in the story of] Mary, the daughter of Imran, who guarded her chastity, whereupon We breathed of Our spirit into that [which was in her womb], and who accepted the truth of her Sustainer’s words - and [thus,] of His revelations - and was one of the truly devout

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي بِيَدِهِ الْمُلْكُ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
english: HALLOWED be He in whose hand all dominion rests, since He has the power to will anything

arabic: الَّذِي خَلَقَ الْمَوْتَ وَالْحَيَاةَ لِيَبْلُوَكُمْ أَيُّكُمْ أَحْسَنُ عَمَلًا ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْغَفُورُ
english: He who has created death as well as life, so that He might put you to a test [and thus show] which of you is best in conduct, and [make you realize that] He alone is almighty, truly forgiving

arabic: الَّذِي خَلَقَ سَبْعَ سَمَاوَاتٍ طِبَاقًا ۖ مَا تَرَىٰ فِي خَلْقِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ مِنْ تَفَاوُتٍ ۖ فَارْجِعِ الْبَصَرَ هَلْ تَرَىٰ مِنْ فُطُورٍ
english: [Hallowed be] He who has created seven heavens in full harmony with one another: no fault will thou see in the creation of the Most Gracious. And turn thy vision [upon it] once more: canst thou see any flaw

arabic: ثُمَّ ارْجِعِ الْبَصَرَ كَرَّتَيْنِ يَنْقَلِبْ إِلَيْكَ الْبَصَرُ خَاسِئًا وَهُوَ حَسِيرٌ
english: Yea, turn thy vision [upon it] again and yet again: [and every time] thy vision will fall back upon thee, dazzled and truly defeated…

arabic: وَلَقَدْ زَيَّنَّا السَّمَاءَ الدُّنْيَا بِمَصَابِيحَ وَجَعَلْنَاهَا رُجُومًا لِلشَّيَاطِينِ ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لَهُمْ عَذَابَ السَّعِيرِ
english: And, indeed, We have adorned the skies nearest to the earth with lights, and have made them the object of futile guesses for the evil ones [from among men]: and for them have We readied suffering through a blazing flame –

arabic: وَلِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِرَبِّهِمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ وَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ
english: for, suffering in hell awaits all who are [thus] bent on blaspheming against their Sustainer: and how vile a journey's end

arabic: إِذَا أُلْقُوا فِيهَا سَمِعُوا لَهَا شَهِيقًا وَهِيَ تَفُورُ
english: When they are cast into that [hell], they will hear its breath indrawing as it boils up

arabic: تَكَادُ تَمَيَّزُ مِنَ الْغَيْظِ ۖ كُلَّمَا أُلْقِيَ فِيهَا فَوْجٌ سَأَلَهُمْ خَزَنَتُهَا أَلَمْ يَأْتِكُمْ نَذِيرٌ
english: well-nigh bursting with fury; [and] every time a host [of such sinners] is flung into it, its keepers will ask them, "Has no warner ever come to you

arabic: قَالُوا بَلَىٰ قَدْ جَاءَنَا نَذِيرٌ فَكَذَّبْنَا وَقُلْنَا مَا نَزَّلَ اللَّهُ مِنْ شَيْءٍ إِنْ أَنْتُمْ إِلَّا فِي ضَلَالٍ كَبِيرٍ
english: They will reply: "Yea, a warner did indeed come unto us, but we gave him the lie and said, 'Never has God sent down anything [by way of revelation]! You [self-styled warners] are but lost in a great delusion

arabic: وَقَالُوا لَوْ كُنَّا نَسْمَعُ أَوْ نَعْقِلُ مَا كُنَّا فِي أَصْحَابِ السَّعِيرِ
english: And they will add: "Had we but listened [to those warnings], or [at least] used our own reason, we would not [now] be among those who are destined for the blazing flame

arabic: فَاعْتَرَفُوا بِذَنْبِهِمْ فَسُحْقًا لِأَصْحَابِ السَّعِيرِ
english: Thus will they come to realize their sins: but [by that time,] remote will have become all good from those who are destined for the blazing flame

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَخْشَوْنَ رَبَّهُمْ بِالْغَيْبِ لَهُمْ مَغْفِرَةٌ وَأَجْرٌ كَبِيرٌ
english: [As against this,] behold, for those who stand in awe of God although He is beyond the reach of their perception, there is forgiveness in store and a great reward

arabic: وَأَسِرُّوا قَوْلَكُمْ أَوِ اجْهَرُوا بِهِ ۖ إِنَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ
english: AND [know, O men, that] whether you keep your beliefs secret or state them openly, He has full knowledge indeed of all that is in [your] hearts

arabic: أَلَا يَعْلَمُ مَنْ خَلَقَ وَهُوَ اللَّطِيفُ الْخَبِيرُ
english: How could it be that He who has created [all] should not know [all]? Yea, He alone is unfathomable [in His wisdom], aware

arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الْأَرْضَ ذَلُولًا فَامْشُوا فِي مَنَاكِبِهَا وَكُلُوا مِنْ رِزْقِهِ ۖ وَإِلَيْهِ النُّشُورُ
english: He it is who has made the earth easy to live upon: go about, then, in all its regions, and partake the sustenance which He provides: but [always bear in mind that] unto Him you shall be resurrected

arabic: أَأَمِنْتُمْ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاءِ أَنْ يَخْسِفَ بِكُمُ الْأَرْضَ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَمُورُ
english: Can you ever feel secure that He who is in heaven will not cause the earth to swallow you up when, lo and behold, it begins to quake

arabic: أَمْ أَمِنْتُمْ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاءِ أَنْ يُرْسِلَ عَلَيْكُمْ حَاصِبًا ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ كَيْفَ نَذِيرِ
english: Or can you ever feel secure that He who is in heaven will not let loose against you a deadly stormwind, whereupon you would come to know how [true] My warning was

arabic: وَلَقَدْ كَذَّبَ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ فَكَيْفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ
english: And, indeed, [many of] those who lived aforetime did give the lie [to My warnings]: and how awesome was My rejection [of them]

arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا إِلَى الطَّيْرِ فَوْقَهُمْ صَافَّاتٍ وَيَقْبِضْنَ ۚ مَا يُمْسِكُهُنَّ إِلَّا الرَّحْمَٰنُ ۚ إِنَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ بَصِيرٌ
english: Have they, then, never beheld the birds above them, spreading their wings and drawing them in? None but the Most Gracious upholds them: for, verily, He keeps all things in His sight

arabic: أَمَّنْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي هُوَ جُنْدٌ لَكُمْ يَنْصُرُكُمْ مِنْ دُونِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ ۚ إِنِ الْكَافِرُونَ إِلَّا فِي غُرُورٍ
english: [And] is there any, besides the Most Gracious, that could be a shield for you, and could succour you [against danger]? They who deny this truth are but lost in self- delusion

arabic: أَمَّنْ هَٰذَا الَّذِي يَرْزُقُكُمْ إِنْ أَمْسَكَ رِزْقَهُ ۚ بَلْ لَجُّوا فِي عُتُوٍّ وَنُفُورٍ
english: Or is there any that could provide you with sustenance if He should withhold His provision [from you]? Nay, but they [who are bent on denying the truth] stubbornly persist in their disdain [of God's messages] and in their headlong flight [from Him]

arabic: أَفَمَنْ يَمْشِي مُكِبًّا عَلَىٰ وَجْهِهِ أَهْدَىٰ أَمَّنْ يَمْشِي سَوِيًّا عَلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ
english: But then, is he that goes along with his face close to the ground better guided than he that walks upright on a straight way

arabic: قُلْ هُوَ الَّذِي أَنْشَأَكُمْ وَجَعَلَ لَكُمُ السَّمْعَ وَالْأَبْصَارَ وَالْأَفْئِدَةَ ۖ قَلِيلًا مَا تَشْكُرُونَ
english: SAY: "[God is] He who has brought you [all] into being, and has endowed you with hearing, and sight, and hearts: [yet] how seldom are you grateful

arabic: قُلْ هُوَ الَّذِي ذَرَأَكُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَإِلَيْهِ تُحْشَرُونَ
english: Say: "It is He who has multiplied you on earth; and it is unto Him that you shall be gathered [on resurrection]

arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا الْوَعْدُ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
english: But they [only] ask, "When is this promise to be fulfilled? [Answer this, O you who believe in it,] if you are men of truth

arabic: قُلْ إِنَّمَا الْعِلْمُ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ وَإِنَّمَا أَنَا نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ
english: Say thou, [O Prophet:] "Knowledge thereof rests with God alone; and I am only a plain warner

arabic: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهُ زُلْفَةً سِيئَتْ وُجُوهُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَقِيلَ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تَدَّعُونَ
english: Yet in the end, when they shall see that [fulfilment] close at hand, the faces of those who were bent on denying the truth will be stricken with grief; and they will be told, "This it is that you were [so derisively] calling for

arabic: قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَهْلَكَنِيَ اللَّهُ وَمَنْ مَعِيَ أَوْ رَحِمَنَا فَمَنْ يُجِيرُ الْكَافِرِينَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
english: SAY [O Prophet]: "What do you think? Whether God destroys me and those who follow me, or graces us with His mercy - is there anyone that could protect [you] deniers of the truth from grievous suffering [in the life to come]

arabic: قُلْ هُوَ الرَّحْمَٰنُ آمَنَّا بِهِ وَعَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا ۖ فَسَتَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ هُوَ فِي ضَلَالٍ مُبِينٍ
english: Say: "He is the Most Gracious: we have attained to faith in Him, and in Him have we placed our trust; and in time you will come to know which of us was lost in manifest error

arabic: قُلْ أَرَأَيْتُمْ إِنْ أَصْبَحَ مَاؤُكُمْ غَوْرًا فَمَنْ يَأْتِيكُمْ بِمَاءٍ مَعِينٍ
english: Say [unto those who deny the truth]: "What do you think? If of a sudden all your water were to vanish underground, who [but God] could provide you with water from [new] unsullied springs

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ ن ۚ وَالْقَلَمِ وَمَا يَسْطُرُونَ
english: Nun. CONSIDER the pen, and all that they write [therewith]

arabic: مَا أَنْتَ بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّكَ بِمَجْنُونٍ
english: Thou art not, by thy Sustainer's grace, a madman

arabic: وَإِنَّ لَكَ لَأَجْرًا غَيْرَ مَمْنُونٍ
english: And, verily, thine shall be a reward neverending –

arabic: وَإِنَّكَ لَعَلَىٰ خُلُقٍ عَظِيمٍ
english: for, behold, thou keepest indeed to a sublime way of life

arabic: فَسَتُبْصِرُ وَيُبْصِرُونَ
english: and [one day] thou shalt see, and they [who now deride thee] shall see

arabic: بِأَيْيِكُمُ الْمَفْتُونُ
english: which of you was bereft of reason

arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنْ ضَلَّ عَنْ سَبِيلِهِ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِالْمُهْتَدِينَ
english: Verily, thy Sustainer alone is fully aware as to who has strayed from His path, Just as He alone is fully aware of those who have found the right way

arabic: فَلَا تُطِعِ الْمُكَذِّبِينَ
english: Hence, defer not to [the likes and dislikes of] those who give the lie to the truth

arabic: وَدُّوا لَوْ تُدْهِنُ فَيُدْهِنُونَ
english: they would like thee to be soft [with them], so that they might be soft [with thee]

arabic: وَلَا تُطِعْ كُلَّ حَلَّافٍ مَهِينٍ
english: Furthermore, defer not to the contemptible swearer of oaths

arabic: هَمَّازٍ مَشَّاءٍ بِنَمِيمٍ
english: [or to] the slanderer that goes about with defaming tales

arabic: مَنَّاعٍ لِلْخَيْرِ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
english: [or] the withholder of good, [or] the sinful aggressor

arabic: عُتُلٍّ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ زَنِيمٍ
english: [or] one who is cruel, by greed possessed, and, in addition to all this, utterly useless [to his fellow-men]

arabic: أَنْ كَانَ ذَا مَالٍ وَبَنِينَ
english: Is it because he is possessed of worldly goods and children

arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ آيَاتُنَا قَالَ أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
english: that, whenever Our messages are conveyed to him, such a one says, "Fables of ancient times

arabic: سَنَسِمُهُ عَلَى الْخُرْطُومِ
english: [For this] We shall brand him with indelible disgrace

arabic: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَاهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَا أَصْحَابَ الْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
english: [As for such sinners,] behold, We [but] try them as We tried the owners of a certain garden who vowed that they would surely harvest its fruit on the morrow

arabic: وَلَا يَسْتَثْنُونَ
english: and made no allowance [for the will of God]

arabic: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَائِفٌ مِنْ رَبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَائِمُونَ
english: whereupon a visitation for thy Sustainer came upon that [garden] while they were asleep

arabic: فَأَصْبَحَتْ كَالصَّرِيمِ
english: so that by the morrow it became barren and bleak

arabic: فَتَنَادَوْا مُصْبِحِينَ
english: Now when they rose at early morn, they called unto one another

arabic: أَنِ اغْدُوا عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَارِمِينَ
english: Go early to your tilth if you want to harvest the fruit

arabic: فَانْطَلَقُوا وَهُمْ يَتَخَافَتُونَ
english: Thus they launched forth, whispering unto one another

arabic: أَنْ لَا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا الْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُمْ مِسْكِينٌ
english: Indeed, no needy person shall enter it today [and come] upon you [unawares]

arabic: وَغَدَوْا عَلَىٰ حَرْدٍ قَادِرِينَ
english: – and early they went, strongly bent upon their purpose

arabic: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهَا قَالُوا إِنَّا لَضَالُّونَ
english: But as soon as they beheld [the garden and could not recognize] it, they exclaimed, "Surely we have lost our way

arabic: بَلْ نَحْنُ مَحْرُومُونَ
english: [and then,] "Nay, but we have been rendered destitute

arabic: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُلْ لَكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
english: Said the most right-minded among them: "Did I not tell you, 'Will you not extol God's limitless glory?’

arabic: قَالُوا سُبْحَانَ رَبِّنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ
english: They answered: "Limitless in His glory is our Sustainer! Verily, we were doing wrong

arabic: فَأَقْبَلَ بَعْضُهُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ يَتَلَاوَمُونَ
english: and then they turned upon one another with mutual reproaches

arabic: قَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا طَاغِينَ
english: [In the end] they said: "Oh, woe unto us! Verily, we did behave outrageously

arabic: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَا أَنْ يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِنْهَا إِنَّا إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَاغِبُونَ
english: [But] it may be that our Sustainer will grant us something better instead: for, verily, unto our Sustainer do we turn with hope

arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ الْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ الْآخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا يَعْلَمُونَ
english: SUCH is the suffering [with which We try some people in this world]; but greater by far will be the suffering [which sinners shall have to bear] in the life to come - if they but knew it

arabic: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّاتِ النَّعِيمِ
english: For, behold, it is the God-conscious [alone] whom gardens of bliss await with their Sustainer

arabic: أَفَنَجْعَلُ الْمُسْلِمِينَ كَالْمُجْرِمِينَ
english: or should We, perchance, treat those who surrender themselves unto Us as [We would treat] those who remain lost in sin

arabic: مَا لَكُمْ كَيْفَ تَحْكُمُونَ
english: What is amiss with you? On what do you base your judgment [of right and wrong]

arabic: أَمْ لَكُمْ كِتَابٌ فِيهِ تَدْرُسُونَ
english: Or have you, perchance, a [special] divine writ which you study

arabic: إِنَّ لَكُمْ فِيهِ لَمَا تَخَيَّرُونَ
english: and in which you find all that you may wish to find

arabic: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَانٌ عَلَيْنَا بَالِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
english: Or have you received a solemn promise, binding on Us till Resurrection Day, that yours will assuredly be whatever you judge [to be your rightful due]

arabic: سَلْهُمْ أَيُّهُمْ بِذَٰلِكَ زَعِيمٌ
english: Ask them which of them is able to vouch for this

arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَاءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا بِشُرَكَائِهِمْ إِنْ كَانُوا صَادِقِينَ
english: Or have they, perchance, anys ages to support their views? Well, then, if they are sincere in this their claim, let them produce those supporters of theirs

arabic: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَنْ سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى السُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
english: on the Day when man's very being shall be bared to the bone, and when they [who now deny the truth] shall be called upon to prostrate themselves [before God], and shall be unable to do so

arabic: خَاشِعَةً أَبْصَارُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى السُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَالِمُونَ
english: downcast will be their eyes, with ignominy overwhelming them - seeing that they had been called upon [in vain] to prostrate themselves [before Him] while they were yet sound [and alive]

arabic: فَذَرْنِي وَمَنْ يُكَذِّبُ بِهَٰذَا الْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُمْ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
english: Hence, leave Me alone with such as give the lie to this tiding. We shall bring them low, step by step, without their perceiving how it has come about

arabic: وَأُمْلِي لَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ كَيْدِي مَتِينٌ
english: for, behold, though I may give them rein for a while, My subtle scheme is exceedingly firm

arabic: أَمْ تَسْأَلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُمْ مِنْ مَغْرَمٍ مُثْقَلُونَ
english: Or is it that [they fear lest] thou ask them for a reward, [O Prophet,] so that they would be burdened with debt [if they listened to thee]

arabic: أَمْ عِنْدَهُمُ الْغَيْبُ فَهُمْ يَكْتُبُونَ
english: Or [do they think] that the hidden reality [of all that exists] is within their grasp, so that [in time] they can write it down

arabic: فَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُنْ كَصَاحِبِ الْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
english: BEAR THEN with patience thy Sustainer's will and be not like him of the great fish, who cried out [in distress] after having given in to anger

arabic: لَوْلَا أَنْ تَدَارَكَهُ نِعْمَةٌ مِنْ رَبِّهِ لَنُبِذَ بِالْعَرَاءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ
english: [And remember:] had not grace from his Sustainer reached him, he would indeed have been cast forth upon that barren shore in a state of disgrace

arabic: فَاجْتَبَاهُ رَبُّهُ فَجَعَلَهُ مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
english: but [as it was,] his Sustainer had elected him and placed him among the righteous

arabic: وَإِنْ يَكَادُ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَارِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا الذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُ لَمَجْنُونٌ
english: Hence, [be patient,] even though they who are bent on denying the truth would all but kill thee with their eyes whenever they hear this reminder, and [though] they say, "[As for Mubammad,] behold, most surely he is a madman

arabic: وَمَا هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِلْعَالَمِينَ
english: [Be patient:] for this is nought else but a reminder [from God] to all mankind

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ الْحَاقَّةُ
english: OH, THE LAYING-BARE of the truth

arabic: مَا الْحَاقَّةُ
english: How awesome that laying-bare of the truth

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الْحَاقَّةُ
english: And what could make thee conceive what that laying-bare of the truth will be

arabic: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ وَعَادٌ بِالْقَارِعَةِ
english: THE LIE gave [the tribes of] Thamud and ‘Ad to [all tidings of] that sudden calamity

arabic: فَأَمَّا ثَمُودُ فَأُهْلِكُوا بِالطَّاغِيَةِ
english: Now as for the Thamud - they were destroyed by a violent upheaval [of the earth]

arabic: وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُوا بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ
english: and as for the ‘Ad - they were destroyed by a storm wind furiously raging

arabic: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍ وَثَمَانِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًا فَتَرَى الْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍ
english: which He willed against them for seven nights and eight days without cease, so that in the end thou couldst see those people laid low [in death], as though they were so many [uprooted] trunks of hollow palm trees

arabic: فَهَلْ تَرَىٰ لَهُمْ مِنْ بَاقِيَةٍ
english: and dost thou now see any remnant of them

arabic: وَجَاءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَنْ قَبْلَهُ وَالْمُؤْتَفِكَاتُ بِالْخَاطِئَةِ
english: And there was Pharaoh, too, and [many of] those who lived before him, and the cities that were overthrown - [all of them] indulged in sin upon sin

arabic: فَعَصَوْا رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةً رَابِيَةً
english: and rebelled against their Sustainer's apostles: and so He took them to task with a punishing grasp exceedingly severe

arabic: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَى الْمَاءُ حَمَلْنَاكُمْ فِي الْجَارِيَةِ
english: [And] behold: when the waters [of Noah's flood] burst beyond all limits, it was We who caused you to be borne [to safety] in that floating ark

arabic: لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةً وَتَعِيَهَا أُذُنٌ وَاعِيَةٌ
english: so that We might make all this a [lasting] reminder to you all, and that every wide-awake ear might consciously take it in

arabic: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِي الصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ
english: Hence, [bethink yourselves of the Last Hour,] when the trumpet [of judgment] shall be sounded with a single blast

arabic: وَحُمِلَتِ الْأَرْضُ وَالْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةً وَاحِدَةً
english: and the earth and the mountains shall be lifted up and crushed with a single stroke

arabic: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ وَقَعَتِ الْوَاقِعَةُ
english: And so, that which must come to pass will on that day have come to pass

arabic: وَانْشَقَّتِ السَّمَاءُ فَهِيَ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَاهِيَةٌ
english: and the sky will be rent asunder - for, frail will it have become on that Day

arabic: وَالْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰ أَرْجَائِهَا ۚ وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ ثَمَانِيَةٌ
english: and the angels [will appear] at its ends, and, above them, eight will bear aloft on that Day the throne of thy Sustainer’s almightiness…

arabic: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنْكُمْ خَافِيَةٌ
english: On that Day you shall be brought to judgment: not [even] the most hidden of your deeds will remain hidden

arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِيَمِينِهِ فَيَقُولُ هَاؤُمُ اقْرَءُوا كِتَابِيَهْ
english: Now as for him whose record shall be placed in his right hand, he will exclaim: "Come you all!" Read this my record

arabic: إِنِّي ظَنَنْتُ أَنِّي مُلَاقٍ حِسَابِيَهْ
english: Behold, I did know that [one day] I would have to face my account

arabic: فَهُوَ فِي عِيشَةٍ رَاضِيَةٍ
english: And so he will find himself in a happy state of life

arabic: فِي جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٍ
english: in a lofty paradise

arabic: قُطُوفُهَا دَانِيَةٌ
english: with its fruits within easy reach

arabic: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِي الْأَيَّامِ الْخَالِيَةِ
english: [And all who are thus blest will be told:] "Eat and drink with good cheer in return for all [the good deeds] that you have sent ahead in days gone by

arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِشِمَالِهِ فَيَقُولُ يَا لَيْتَنِي لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَابِيَهْ
english: But as for him whose record shall be placed in his left hand, he will exclaim: "Oh, would that I had never been shown this my record

arabic: وَلَمْ أَدْرِ مَا حِسَابِيَهْ
english: and neither known this my account

arabic: يَا لَيْتَهَا كَانَتِ الْقَاضِيَةَ
english: Oh, would that this [death of mine] had been the end of me

arabic: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنِّي مَالِيَهْ ۜ
english: Of no avail to me is all that I have [ever] possessed

arabic: هَلَكَ عَنِّي سُلْطَانِيَهْ
english: [and] all my power of argument has died away from me

arabic: خُذُوهُ فَغُلُّوهُ
english: [Thereupon the command will go forth:] "Lay hold of him, and shackle him

arabic: ثُمَّ الْجَحِيمَ صَلُّوهُ
english: and then let him enter hell

arabic: ثُمَّ فِي سِلْسِلَةٍ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًا فَاسْلُكُوهُ
english: and then thrust him into a chain [of other sinners like him - a chain] the length whereof is seventy cubits

arabic: إِنَّهُ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ الْعَظِيمِ
english: for, behold, he did not believe in God, the Tremendous

arabic: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ الْمِسْكِينِ
english: and did not feel any urge to feed the needy

arabic: فَلَيْسَ لَهُ الْيَوْمَ هَاهُنَا حَمِيمٌ
english: and so, no friend has here today

arabic: وَلَا طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِنْ غِسْلِينٍ
english: nor any food save the filth

arabic: لَا يَأْكُلُهُ إِلَّا الْخَاطِئُونَ
english: which none but the sinners eat

arabic: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِمَا تُبْصِرُونَ
english: BUT NAY! I call to witness an that you can see

arabic: وَمَا لَا تُبْصِرُونَ
english: as well as all that you cannot see

arabic: إِنَّهُ لَقَوْلُ رَسُولٍ كَرِيمٍ
english: Behold, this [Qur’an] is indeed the [inspired] word of a noble apostle

arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَا تُؤْمِنُونَ
english: and is not – however little you may [be prepared to] believe it - the word of a poet

arabic: وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
english: and neither is it - however little you may [be prepared to] take it to heart - the word of a soothsayer

arabic: تَنْزِيلٌ مِنْ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
english: [it is] a revelation from the Sustainer of all the worlds

arabic: وَلَوْ تَقَوَّلَ عَلَيْنَا بَعْضَ الْأَقَاوِيلِ
english: Now if he [whom We have entrusted with it] had dared to attribute some [of his own] sayings unto Us

arabic: لَأَخَذْنَا مِنْهُ بِالْيَمِينِ
english: We would indeed have seized him by his right hand

arabic: ثُمَّ لَقَطَعْنَا مِنْهُ الْوَتِينَ
english: and would indeed have cut his life-vein

arabic: فَمَا مِنْكُمْ مِنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَاجِزِينَ
english: and none of you could have saved him

arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَتَذْكِرَةٌ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
english: And, verily, this [Qur’an] is a reminder to all the God-conscious

arabic: وَإِنَّا لَنَعْلَمُ أَنَّ مِنْكُمْ مُكَذِّبِينَ
english: And, behold, well do We know that among you are such as will give the lie to it

arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَحَسْرَةٌ عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ
english: yet, behold, this [rejection] will indeed become a source of bitter regret for all who deny the truth [of God's revelation] –

arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لَحَقُّ الْيَقِينِ
english: for, verily, it is truth absolute

arabic: فَسَبِّحْ بِاسْمِ رَبِّكَ الْعَظِيمِ
english: Extol, then the limitless glory of thy Sustainer's mighty name

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ سَأَلَ سَائِلٌ بِعَذَابٍ وَاقِعٍ
english: ONE who is minded to ask might ask about the suffering which [in the hereafter] is bound to befall

arabic: لِلْكَافِرِينَ لَيْسَ لَهُ دَافِعٌ
english: those who deny the truth. [Know, then, that] nothing can ward it off

arabic: مِنَ اللَّهِ ذِي الْمَعَارِجِ
english: [since it will come] from God, unto whom there are many ways of ascent

arabic: تَعْرُجُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَالرُّوحُ إِلَيْهِ فِي يَوْمٍ كَانَ مِقْدَارُهُ خَمْسِينَ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ
english: all the angels and all the inspiration [ever granted to man] ascend unto Him [daily,] in a day the length whereof is [like] fifty thousand years…

arabic: فَاصْبِرْ صَبْرًا جَمِيلًا
english: Therefore, [O believer,] endure all adversity with goodly patience

arabic: إِنَّهُمْ يَرَوْنَهُ بَعِيدًا
english: behold, men look upon that [reckoning] as something far away –

arabic: وَنَرَاهُ قَرِيبًا
english: but, We see it as near

arabic: يَوْمَ تَكُونُ السَّمَاءُ كَالْمُهْلِ
english: [It will take place] on a Day when the sky will be like molten lead

arabic: وَتَكُونُ الْجِبَالُ كَالْعِهْنِ
english: and the mountains will be like tufts of wool

arabic: وَلَا يَسْأَلُ حَمِيمٌ حَمِيمًا
english: and [when] no friend will ask about his friend

arabic: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمْ ۚ يَوَدُّ الْمُجْرِمُ لَوْ يَفْتَدِي مِنْ عَذَابِ يَوْمِئِذٍ بِبَنِيهِ
english: though they may be in one another's sight: [for,] everyone who was lost in sin will on that Day but desire to ransom himself from suffering at the price of his own children

arabic: وَصَاحِبَتِهِ وَأَخِيهِ
english: and of his spouse, and of his brother

arabic: وَفَصِيلَتِهِ الَّتِي تُؤْوِيهِ
english: and of all the kinsfolk who ever sheltered him

arabic: وَمَنْ فِي الْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ يُنْجِيهِ
english: and of whoever [else] lives on earth, all of them - so that he could but save himself

arabic: كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّهَا لَظَىٰ
english: But nay! Verily, all [that awaits him] is a raging flame

arabic: نَزَّاعَةً لِلشَّوَىٰ
english: tearing away his skin

arabic: تَدْعُو مَنْ أَدْبَرَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
english: It will claim all such as turn their backs [on what is right], and turn away [from the truth]

arabic: وَجَمَعَ فَأَوْعَىٰ
english: and amass [wealth] and thereupon withhold [it from their fellow-men]

arabic: ۞ إِنَّ الْإِنْسَانَ خُلِقَ هَلُوعًا
english: VERILY, man is born with a restless disposition

arabic: إِذَا مَسَّهُ الشَّرُّ جَزُوعًا
english: [As a rule,] whenever misfortune touches him, he is filled with self-pity

arabic: وَإِذَا مَسَّهُ الْخَيْرُ مَنُوعًا
english: and whenever good fortune comes to him, he selfishly withholds it [from others]

arabic: إِلَّا الْمُصَلِّينَ
english: Not so, however, those who consciously turn towards God in prayer

arabic: الَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمْ دَائِمُونَ
english: [and] who incessantly persevere in their prayer

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ فِي أَمْوَالِهِمْ حَقٌّ مَعْلُومٌ
english: and in whose possessions there is a due share, acknowledged [by them]

arabic: لِلسَّائِلِ وَالْمَحْرُومِ
english: for such as ask [for help] and such as are deprived [of what is good in life]

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ يُصَدِّقُونَ بِيَوْمِ الدِّينِ
english: and who accept as true the [coming of the] Day of Judgment

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ مِنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِمْ مُشْفِقُونَ
english: and who stand in dread of their Sustainer's chastisement –

arabic: إِنَّ عَذَابَ رَبِّهِمْ غَيْرُ مَأْمُونٍ
english: for, behold, of their Sustainer's chastisement none may ever feel [wholly] secure

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ لِفُرُوجِهِمْ حَافِظُونَ
english: and who are mindful of their chastity

arabic: إِلَّا عَلَىٰ أَزْوَاجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ
english: [not giving way to their desires] with any but their spouses - that is, those whom they rightfully possess [through wedlock] -: for then, behold, they are free of all blame

arabic: فَمَنِ ابْتَغَىٰ وَرَاءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْعَادُونَ
english: whereas such as seek to go beyond that [limit] are truly transgressors

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ لِأَمَانَاتِهِمْ وَعَهْدِهِمْ رَاعُونَ
english: and who are faithful to their trusts and to their pledges

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ بِشَهَادَاتِهِمْ قَائِمُونَ
english: and who stand firm whenever they bear witness

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُمْ عَلَىٰ صَلَاتِهِمْ يُحَافِظُونَ
english: and who guard their prayers [from all worldly intent]

arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ مُكْرَمُونَ
english: These it is who in the gardens [of paradise] shall be honoured

arabic: فَمَالِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا قِبَلَكَ مُهْطِعِينَ
english: WHAT, THEN, is amiss with such as are bent on denying the truth, that they run about confusedly to and fro before thee

arabic: عَنِ الْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ الشِّمَالِ عِزِينَ
english: [coming upon thee] from the right and from the left, in crowds

arabic: أَيَطْمَعُ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ مِنْهُمْ أَنْ يُدْخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٍ
english: Does every one of them hope to enter [by this means] a garden of bliss

arabic: كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَاهُمْ مِمَّا يَعْلَمُونَ
english: Never! For, behold, We have created them out of something that they know [only too well]

arabic: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِرَبِّ الْمَشَارِقِ وَالْمَغَارِبِ إِنَّا لَقَادِرُونَ
english: But nay! I call to witness [Our being] the Sustainer of all the points of sunrise and sunset: verily, well able are We

arabic: عَلَىٰ أَنْ نُبَدِّلَ خَيْرًا مِنْهُمْ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ
english: to replace them with [people] better than they are; for there is nothing to prevent Us [from doing what We will]

arabic: فَذَرْهُمْ يَخُوضُوا وَيَلْعَبُوا حَتَّىٰ يُلَاقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ الَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
english: Hence, leave them to indulge in idle talk and play [with words] until they face that [Judgment] Day of theirs which they have been promised –

arabic: يَوْمَ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ الْأَجْدَاثِ سِرَاعًا كَأَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٍ يُوفِضُونَ
english: the Day when they shall come forth in haste from their graves, as if racing towards a goal-post

arabic: خَاشِعَةً أَبْصَارُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمُ الَّذِي كَانُوا يُوعَدُونَ
english: with downcast eyes, with ignominy overwhelming them: that Day which they were promised again and…

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِ أَنْ أَنْذِرْ قَوْمَكَ مِنْ قَبْلِ أَنْ يَأْتِيَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
english: BEHOLD. We sent Noah unto his people. [saying:] "Warn thy people ere grievous suffering befall them

arabic: قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ إِنِّي لَكُمْ نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ
english: [And Noah] said: "O my people! I am but a plain warner to you, [sent to tell you]

arabic: أَنِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ وَاتَّقُوهُ وَأَطِيعُونِ
english: that you should worship God [alone] and be conscious of Him. "Now do pay heed unto me

arabic: يَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ مِنْ ذُنُوبِكُمْ وَيُؤَخِّرْكُمْ إِلَىٰ أَجَلٍ مُسَمًّى ۚ إِنَّ أَجَلَ اللَّهِ إِذَا جَاءَ لَا يُؤَخَّرُ ۖ لَوْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
english: so that He may forgive you some of your sins, and grant you respite until a term known [to Him alone]: but, behold, when the term appointed by God does come, it can never be put back - if you but knew it

arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي دَعَوْتُ قَوْمِي لَيْلًا وَنَهَارًا
english: [And after a time, Noah] said: "O my Sustainer! Verily, I have been calling unto my people night and day

arabic: فَلَمْ يَزِدْهُمْ دُعَائِي إِلَّا فِرَارًا
english: but my call has only caused them to flee farther and farther away [from Thee]

arabic: وَإِنِّي كُلَّمَا دَعَوْتُهُمْ لِتَغْفِرَ لَهُمْ جَعَلُوا أَصَابِعَهُمْ فِي آذَانِهِمْ وَاسْتَغْشَوْا ثِيَابَهُمْ وَأَصَرُّوا وَاسْتَكْبَرُوا اسْتِكْبَارًا
english: And behold, whenever I called unto them with a view to Thy granting them forgiveness, they put their fingers into their ears, and wrapped themselves up in their garments [of sin]; and grew obstinate, and became [yet more] arrogant in their false pride

arabic: ثُمَّ إِنِّي دَعَوْتُهُمْ جِهَارًا
english: And behold I called unto them openly

arabic: ثُمَّ إِنِّي أَعْلَنْتُ لَهُمْ وَأَسْرَرْتُ لَهُمْ إِسْرَارًا
english: and, behold I preached to them in public; and I spoke to them secretly, in private

arabic: فَقُلْتُ اسْتَغْفِرُوا رَبَّكُمْ إِنَّهُ كَانَ غَفَّارًا
english: and I said: "'Ask your Sustainer to forgive you your sins - for, verily, He is all-forgiving

arabic: يُرْسِلِ السَّمَاءَ عَلَيْكُمْ مِدْرَارًا
english: He will shower upon you heavenly blessings abundant

arabic: وَيُمْدِدْكُمْ بِأَمْوَالٍ وَبَنِينَ وَيَجْعَلْ لَكُمْ جَنَّاتٍ وَيَجْعَلْ لَكُمْ أَنْهَارًا
english: and will aid you with worldly goods and children, and will bestow upon you gardens, and bestow upon you running waters

arabic: مَا لَكُمْ لَا تَرْجُونَ لِلَّهِ وَقَارًا
english: What is amiss with you that you cannot look forward to God's majesty

arabic: وَقَدْ خَلَقَكُمْ أَطْوَارًا
english: seeing that He has created [every one of] you in successive stages

arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَوْا كَيْفَ خَلَقَ اللَّهُ سَبْعَ سَمَاوَاتٍ طِبَاقًا
english: Do you not see how God has created seven heavens in full harmony with one another

arabic: وَجَعَلَ الْقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ نُورًا وَجَعَلَ الشَّمْسَ سِرَاجًا
english: and has set up within them the moon as a light [reflected] and set up the sun as a [radiant] lamp

arabic: وَاللَّهُ أَنْبَتَكُمْ مِنَ الْأَرْضِ نَبَاتًا
english: And God has caused you to grow out of the earth in [gradual] growth; and thereafter He will return you to it [in death]

arabic: ثُمَّ يُعِيدُكُمْ فِيهَا وَيُخْرِجُكُمْ إِخْرَاجًا
english: and [then] He will bring you forth [from It] in resurrection

arabic: وَاللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُمُ الْأَرْضَ بِسَاطًا
english: And God has made the earth a wide expanse for you

arabic: لِتَسْلُكُوا مِنْهَا سُبُلًا فِجَاجًا
english: so that you might walk thereon on spacious paths.’

arabic: قَالَ نُوحٌ رَبِّ إِنَّهُمْ عَصَوْنِي وَاتَّبَعُوا مَنْ لَمْ يَزِدْهُ مَالُهُ وَوَلَدُهُ إِلَّا خَسَارًا
english: [And] Noah continued: "O my Sustainer! Behold, they have opposed me [throughout], for they follow people whose wealth and children lead them increasingly into ruin

arabic: وَمَكَرُوا مَكْرًا كُبَّارًا
english: and who have devised a most awesome blasphemy [against Thee]

arabic: وَقَالُوا لَا تَذَرُنَّ آلِهَتَكُمْ وَلَا تَذَرُنَّ وَدًّا وَلَا سُوَاعًا وَلَا يَغُوثَ وَيَعُوقَ وَنَسْرًا
english: inasmuch as they said [to their followers], 'Do not ever abandon your gods: abandon neither Wadd nor Suwa', and neither Yaghuth nor Ya’uq nor Nasr

arabic: وَقَدْ أَضَلُّوا كَثِيرًا ۖ وَلَا تَزِدِ الظَّالِمِينَ إِلَّا ضَلَالًا
english: And so they have led many a one astray: hence, ordain Thou that these evildoers stray but farther and farther away [from all that they may desire]

arabic: مِمَّا خَطِيئَاتِهِمْ أُغْرِقُوا فَأُدْخِلُوا نَارًا فَلَمْ يَجِدُوا لَهُمْ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ أَنْصَارًا
english: And so, because of their sins, they were drowned [in the great flood], and were doomed to suffer the fire [of the hereafter]; and they found none who could succour them against God

arabic: وَقَالَ نُوحٌ رَبِّ لَا تَذَرْ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ دَيَّارًا
english: And Noah prayed: "O my Sustainer! Leave not on earth any of those who deny the truth

arabic: إِنَّكَ إِنْ تَذَرْهُمْ يُضِلُّوا عِبَادَكَ وَلَا يَلِدُوا إِلَّا فَاجِرًا كَفَّارًا
english: for, behold, If Thou dost leave them, they will [always try to] lead astray those who worship Thee, and will give birth to nothing but wickedness and stubborn ingratitude

arabic: رَبِّ اغْفِرْ لِي وَلِوَالِدَيَّ وَلِمَنْ دَخَلَ بَيْتِيَ مُؤْمِنًا وَلِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ وَلَا تَزِدِ الظَّالِمِينَ إِلَّا تَبَارًا
english: O my Sustainer! Grant Thy forgiveness unto me and unto my parents, and unto everyone who enters my house as a believer, and unto all believing men and believing women [of later times]; and grant Thou that the doers of evil shall increasingly meet with destruction

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أُوحِيَ إِلَيَّ أَنَّهُ اسْتَمَعَ نَفَرٌ مِنَ الْجِنِّ فَقَالُوا إِنَّا سَمِعْنَا قُرْآنًا عَجَبًا
english: SAY: "It has been revealed to me that some of the unseen beings gave ear [to this divine writ], and thereupon said [unto their fellow-beings]: "'Verily, we have heard a wondrous discourse

arabic: يَهْدِي إِلَى الرُّشْدِ فَآمَنَّا بِهِ ۖ وَلَنْ نُشْرِكَ بِرَبِّنَا أَحَدًا
english: guiding towards consciousness of what is right; and so We have come to believe in it. And we shall never ascribe divinity to anyone beside our Sustainer

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ تَعَالَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا اتَّخَذَ صَاحِبَةً وَلَا وَلَدًا
english: for [we know] that sublimely exalted is our Sustainer's majesty: no consort has He ever taken unto Himself, nor a son

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى اللَّهِ شَطَطًا
english: And [now we know] that the foolish among us were wont to say outrageous things about God

arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّا أَنْ لَنْ تَقُولَ الْإِنْسُ وَالْجِنُّ عَلَى اللَّهِ كَذِبًا
english: and that [we were mistaken when] we thought that neither man nor [any of] the invisible forces would ever tell a lie about God

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ كَانَ رِجَالٌ مِنَ الْإِنْسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٍ مِنَ الْجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمْ رَهَقًا
english: Yet [it has always happened] that certain kinds of humans would seek refuge with certain kinds of [such] invisible forces: but these only increased their confusion –

arabic: وَأَنَّهُمْ ظَنُّوا كَمَا ظَنَنْتُمْ أَنْ لَنْ يَبْعَثَ اللَّهُ أَحَدًا
english: so much so that they came to think, as you [once] thought, that God would never [again] send forth anyone [as His apostle]

arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَسْنَا السَّمَاءَ فَوَجَدْنَاهَا مُلِئَتْ حَرَسًا شَدِيدًا وَشُهُبًا
english: And [so it happened] that we reached out towards heaven: but we found it filled with mighty guards and flames

arabic: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقْعُدُ مِنْهَا مَقَاعِدَ لِلسَّمْعِ ۖ فَمَنْ يَسْتَمِعِ الْآنَ يَجِدْ لَهُ شِهَابًا رَصَدًا
english: notwithstanding that we were established in positions [which we had thought well-suited] to listening to [whatever secrets might be in] it: and anyone who now [or ever] tries to listen will [likewise] find a flame lying in wait for him

arabic: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدْرِي أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَنْ فِي الْأَرْضِ أَمْ أَرَادَ بِهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ رَشَدًا
english: And [now we have become aware] that we [created beings] may not know whether evil fortune is intended for [any of] those who live on earth, or whether it is their Sustainer’s will to endow them with consciousness of what is right

arabic: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا الصَّالِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ ۖ كُنَّا طَرَائِقَ قِدَدًا
english: Just as [we do not know how it happens] that some from among us are righteous, while some of us are [far] below that: we have always followed widely divergent paths

arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّا أَنْ لَنْ نُعْجِزَ اللَّهَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَنْ نُعْجِزَهُ هَرَبًا
english: And, withal, we have come to know that we can never elude God [while we live] on earth, and that we can never elude Him by escaping [from life]

arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعْنَا الْهُدَىٰ آمَنَّا بِهِ ۖ فَمَنْ يُؤْمِنْ بِرَبِّهِ فَلَا يَخَافُ بَخْسًا وَلَا رَهَقًا
english: Hence, as soon as we heard this [call to His] guidance, we came to believe in it: and he who believes in his Sustainer need never have fear of loss or injustice

arabic: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا الْمُسْلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا الْقَاسِطُونَ ۖ فَمَنْ أَسْلَمَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ تَحَرَّوْا رَشَدًا
english: Yet [it is true] that among us are such as have surrendered themselves to God - just as there are among us such as have abandoned themselves to wrongdoing. Now as for those who surrender themselves to Him - it is they that have attained to consciousness of what is right

arabic: وَأَمَّا الْقَاسِطُونَ فَكَانُوا لِجَهَنَّمَ حَطَبًا
english: but as for those who abandon themselves to wrongdoing - they are indeed but fuel for [the fires of] hell!’

arabic: وَأَنْ لَوِ اسْتَقَامُوا عَلَى الطَّرِيقَةِ لَأَسْقَيْنَاهُمْ مَاءً غَدَقًا
english: [KNOW,] THEN, that if they [who have heard Our call] keep firmly to the [right] path, We shall certainly shower them with blessings abundant

arabic: لِنَفْتِنَهُمْ فِيهِ ۚ وَمَنْ يُعْرِضْ عَنْ ذِكْرِ رَبِّهِ يَسْلُكْهُ عَذَابًا صَعَدًا
english: so as to test them by this means: for he who shall turn away from the remembrance of his Sustainer, him will He cause to undergo suffering most grievous

arabic: وَأَنَّ الْمَسَاجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدْعُوا مَعَ اللَّهِ أَحَدًا
english: And [know] that all worship is due to God [alone]: hence, do not invoke anyone side by side with God

arabic: وَأَنَّهُ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ يَدْعُوهُ كَادُوا يَكُونُونَ عَلَيْهِ لِبَدًا
english: Yet [thus it is] that whenever a servant of God stands up in prayer to Him, they [who are bent on denying the truth] would gladly overwhelm him with their crowds

arabic: قُلْ إِنَّمَا أَدْعُو رَبِّي وَلَا أُشْرِكُ بِهِ أَحَدًا
english: Say: "I invoke my Sustainer alone, for I do not ascribe divinity to anyone beside Him

arabic: قُلْ إِنِّي لَا أَمْلِكُ لَكُمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا رَشَدًا
english: Say: "Verily, it is not in my power to cause you harm or to endow you with consciousness of what is right

arabic: قُلْ إِنِّي لَنْ يُجِيرَنِي مِنَ اللَّهِ أَحَدٌ وَلَنْ أَجِدَ مِنْ دُونِهِ مُلْتَحَدًا
english: Say: "Verily, no one could ever protect me from God, nor could I ever find a place to hide from Him

arabic: إِلَّا بَلَاغًا مِنَ اللَّهِ وَرِسَالَاتِهِ ۚ وَمَنْ يَعْصِ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ فَإِنَّ لَهُ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا
english: if I should fail to convey [to the world whatever illumination comes to me] from God and His messages." Now as for him who rebels against God and His Apostle - verily, the fire of hell awaits him, therein to abide beyond the count of time

arabic: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا رَأَوْا مَا يُوعَدُونَ فَسَيَعْلَمُونَ مَنْ أَضْعَفُ نَاصِرًا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدًا
english: [Let them, then, wait] until the time when they behold that [doom] of which they were forewarned: for then they will come to understand which [kind of man] is more helpless and counts for less

arabic: قُلْ إِنْ أَدْرِي أَقَرِيبٌ مَا تُوعَدُونَ أَمْ يَجْعَلُ لَهُ رَبِّي أَمَدًا
english: Say: "I do not know whether that [doom] of which you were forewarned is near, or whether my Sustainer has set for it a distant term

arabic: عَالِمُ الْغَيْبِ فَلَا يُظْهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَيْبِهِ أَحَدًا
english: He [alone] knows that which is beyond the reach of a created being's perception, and to none does He disclose aught of the mysteries of His Own unfathomable knowledge

arabic: إِلَّا مَنِ ارْتَضَىٰ مِنْ رَسُولٍ فَإِنَّهُ يَسْلُكُ مِنْ بَيْنِ يَدَيْهِ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِ رَصَدًا
english: unless it be to an apostle whom He has been pleased to elect [there for]: and then He sends forth [the forces of heaven] to watch over him in whatever lies open before him and in what is beyond his ken –

arabic: لِيَعْلَمَ أَنْ قَدْ أَبْلَغُوا رِسَالَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيْهِمْ وَأَحْصَىٰ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ عَدَدًا
english: so as to make manifest that it is indeed [but] their Sustainer's messages that these [apostles] deliver: for it is He who encompasses [with His knowledge] all that they have [to say], just as He takes count, one by one, of everything [that exists]

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمُزَّمِّلُ
english: O THOU enwrapped one

arabic: قُمِ اللَّيْلَ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا
english: Keep awake [in prayer] at night, all but a small part

arabic: نِصْفَهُ أَوِ انْقُصْ مِنْهُ قَلِيلًا
english: of one-half thereof - or make it a little less than that

arabic: أَوْ زِدْ عَلَيْهِ وَرَتِّلِ الْقُرْآنَ تَرْتِيلًا
english: or add to it [at will]; and [during that time] recite the Qur’an calmly and distinctly, with thy mind attuned to its meaning

arabic: إِنَّا سَنُلْقِي عَلَيْكَ قَوْلًا ثَقِيلًا
english: Behold, We shall bestow upon thee a weighty message –

arabic: إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ اللَّيْلِ هِيَ أَشَدُّ وَطْئًا وَأَقْوَمُ قِيلًا
english: [and,] verily, the hours of night impress the mind most strongly and speak with the clearest voice

arabic: إِنَّ لَكَ فِي النَّهَارِ سَبْحًا طَوِيلًا
english: whereas by day a long chain of doings is thy portion

arabic: وَاذْكُرِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلْ إِلَيْهِ تَبْتِيلًا
english: But [whether by night or by day,] remember thy Sustainer's name, and devote thyself unto Him with utter devotion

arabic: رَبُّ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَاتَّخِذْهُ وَكِيلًا
english: The Sustainer of the east and the west [is He]: there is no deity save Him: hence, ascribe to Him alone the power to determine thy fate

arabic: وَاصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَاهْجُرْهُمْ هَجْرًا جَمِيلًا
english: and endure with patience whatever people may say [against thee], and avoid them with a comely avoidance

arabic: وَذَرْنِي وَالْمُكَذِّبِينَ أُولِي النَّعْمَةِ وَمَهِّلْهُمْ قَلِيلًا
english: And leave Me alone [to deal] with those who give the lie to the truth - those who enjoy the blessings of life [without any thought of God] - and bear thou with them for a little while

arabic: إِنَّ لَدَيْنَا أَنْكَالًا وَجَحِيمًا
english: for, behold, heavy fetters [await them] with Us, and a blazing fire

arabic: وَطَعَامًا ذَا غُصَّةٍ وَعَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
english: and food that chokes, and grievous suffering

arabic: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ الْأَرْضُ وَالْجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ الْجِبَالُ كَثِيبًا مَهِيلًا
english: on the Day when the earth and the mountains will be convulsed and the mountains will [crumble and] become like a sand-dune on the move

arabic: إِنَّا أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَيْكُمْ رَسُولًا شَاهِدًا عَلَيْكُمْ كَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ رَسُولًا
english: BEHOLD, [O men,] We have sent unto you an apostle who shall bear witness to the truth before you, even as We sent an apostle unto Pharaoh

arabic: فَعَصَىٰ فِرْعَوْنُ الرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذْنَاهُ أَخْذًا وَبِيلًا
english: and Pharaoh rebelled against the apostle, whereupon We took him to task with a crushing grip

arabic: فَكَيْفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِنْ كَفَرْتُمْ يَوْمًا يَجْعَلُ الْوِلْدَانَ شِيبًا
english: How, then, if you refuse to acknowledge the truth, will you protect yourselves on that Day which shall turn the hair of children grey

arabic: السَّمَاءُ مُنْفَطِرٌ بِهِ ۚ كَانَ وَعْدُهُ مَفْعُولًا
english: [the Day] on which the skies shall be rent asunder, [and] His promise [of resurrection] fulfilled

arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِ تَذْكِرَةٌ ۖ فَمَنْ شَاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبِيلًا
english: This, verily, is a reminder: let him who wills, then set out on a way to his Sustainer

arabic: ۞ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعْلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدْنَىٰ مِنْ ثُلُثَيِ اللَّيْلِ وَنِصْفَهُ وَثُلُثَهُ وَطَائِفَةٌ مِنَ الَّذِينَ مَعَكَ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ ۚ عَلِمَ أَنْ لَنْ تُحْصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ فَاقْرَءُوا مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ الْقُرْآنِ ۚ عَلِمَ أَنْ سَيَكُونُ مِنْكُمْ مَرْضَىٰ ۙ وَآخَرُونَ يَضْرِبُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ يَبْتَغُونَ مِنْ فَضْلِ اللَّهِ ۙ وَآخَرُونَ يُقَاتِلُونَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۖ فَاقْرَءُوا مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنْهُ ۚ وَأَقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَآتُوا الزَّكَاةَ وَأَقْرِضُوا اللَّهَ قَرْضًا حَسَنًا ۚ وَمَا تُقَدِّمُوا لِأَنْفُسِكُمْ مِنْ خَيْرٍ تَجِدُوهُ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ هُوَ خَيْرًا وَأَعْظَمَ أَجْرًا ۚ وَاسْتَغْفِرُوا اللَّهَ ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ
english: BEHOLD, [O Prophet,] thy Sustainer knows that thou keepest awake [in prayer] nearly two-thirds of the night, or one-half of it, or a third of it, together with some of those who follow thee. And God who determines the measure of night and day, is aware that you would never grudge it: and therefore He turns towards you in His grace. Recite, then, as much of the Qur’an as you may do with ease. He knows that in time there will be among you sick people, and others who will go about the land in search of God's bounty, and others who will fight in God’s cause. Recite, then, [only] as much of it as you may do with ease, and be constant in prayer, and spend in charity, and [thus] lend unto God a goodly loan: for whatever good deed you may offer up in your own behalf, you shall truly find it with God - yea, better, and richer in reward. And [always] seek God's forgiveness: behold, God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمُدَّثِّرُ
english: O THOU [in thy solitude] enfolded

arabic: قُمْ فَأَنْذِرْ
english: Arise and warn

arabic: وَرَبَّكَ فَكَبِّرْ
english: And thy Sustainer's greatness glorify

arabic: وَثِيَابَكَ فَطَهِّرْ
english: And thine inner self purify

arabic: وَالرُّجْزَ فَاهْجُرْ
english: And all defilement shun

arabic: وَلَا تَمْنُنْ تَسْتَكْثِرُ
english: And do not through giving seek thyself to gain

arabic: وَلِرَبِّكَ فَاصْبِرْ
english: but unto thy Sustainer turn in patience

arabic: فَإِذَا نُقِرَ فِي النَّاقُورِ
english: And [warn all men that] when the trumpet-call [of resurrection] is sounded

arabic: فَذَٰلِكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَوْمٌ عَسِيرٌ
english: that very Day shall be a day of anguish

arabic: عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ غَيْرُ يَسِيرٍ
english: not of ease, for all who [now] deny the truth

arabic: ذَرْنِي وَمَنْ خَلَقْتُ وَحِيدًا
english: LEAVE Me alone [to deal] with him whom I have created alone

arabic: وَجَعَلْتُ لَهُ مَالًا مَمْدُودًا
english: and to whom I have granted resources vast

arabic: وَبَنِينَ شُهُودًا
english: and children as [love's] witnesses

arabic: وَمَهَّدْتُ لَهُ تَمْهِيدًا
english: and to whose life I gave so wide a scope

arabic: ثُمَّ يَطْمَعُ أَنْ أَزِيدَ
english: and yet, he greedily desires that I give yet more

arabic: كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّهُ كَانَ لِآيَاتِنَا عَنِيدًا
english: Nay, verily, it is against Our messages that he knowingly, stubbornly sets himself

arabic: سَأُرْهِقُهُ صَعُودًا
english: [and so] I shall constrain him to endure a painful uphill climb

arabic: إِنَّهُ فَكَّرَ وَقَدَّرَ
english: Behold, [when Our messages are conveyed to one who is bent on denying the truth,] he reflects and meditates [as to how to disprove them] –

arabic: فَقُتِلَ كَيْفَ قَدَّرَ
english: and thus he destroys himself, the way he meditates

arabic: ثُمَّ قُتِلَ كَيْفَ قَدَّرَ
english: yea, he destroys himself, the way he meditates

arabic: ثُمَّ نَظَرَ
english: and then he looks [around for new arguments]

arabic: ثُمَّ عَبَسَ وَبَسَرَ
english: and then he frowns and glares

arabic: ثُمَّ أَدْبَرَ وَاسْتَكْبَرَ
english: and in the end he turns his back [on Our message], and glories in his arrogance

arabic: فَقَالَ إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا سِحْرٌ يُؤْثَرُ
english: and says, "All this is mere spellbinding eloquence handed down [from olden times]

arabic: إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا قَوْلُ الْبَشَرِ
english: This is nothing but the word of mortal man

arabic: سَأُصْلِيهِ سَقَرَ
english: [Hence,] I shall cause him to endure hell-fire [in the life to come]

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا سَقَرُ
english: And what could make thee conceive what hell-fire is

arabic: لَا تُبْقِي وَلَا تَذَرُ
english: It does not allow to live, and neither leaves [to die]

arabic: لَوَّاحَةٌ لِلْبَشَرِ
english: making [all truth] visible to mortal man

arabic: عَلَيْهَا تِسْعَةَ عَشَرَ
english: Over it are nineteen [powers]

arabic: وَمَا جَعَلْنَا أَصْحَابَ النَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَائِكَةً ۙ وَمَا جَعَلْنَا عِدَّتَهُمْ إِلَّا فِتْنَةً لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لِيَسْتَيْقِنَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ وَيَزْدَادَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِيمَانًا ۙ وَلَا يَرْتَابَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ وَالْمُؤْمِنُونَ ۙ وَلِيَقُولَ الَّذِينَ فِي قُلُوبِهِمْ مَرَضٌ وَالْكَافِرُونَ مَاذَا أَرَادَ اللَّهُ بِهَٰذَا مَثَلًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ اللَّهُ مَنْ يَشَاءُ وَيَهْدِي مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۚ وَمَا يَعْلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ وَمَا هِيَ إِلَّا ذِكْرَىٰ لِلْبَشَرِ
english: For We have caused none but angelic powers to lord over the fire [of hell]; and We have not caused their number to be aught but a trial for those who are bent on denying the truth - to the end that they who have been granted revelation aforetime might be convinced [of the truth of this divine writ]; and that they who have attained to faith [in it] might grow yet more firm in their faith; and that [both] they who have been granted the earlier revelation and they who believe [in this one] might be freed of all doubt; and that they in whose hearts is disease and the who deny the truth outright might ask, "What does [your] God mean by this parable?" In this way God lets go astray him that wills [to go astray], and guides aright him that wills [to be guided]. And none can comprehend thy Sustainers forces save Him alone: and all this is but a reminder to mortal man

arabic: كَلَّا وَالْقَمَرِ
english: NAY, but consider the moon

arabic: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذْ أَدْبَرَ
english: Consider the night when it departs

arabic: وَالصُّبْحِ إِذَا أَسْفَرَ
english: and the morn when it dawns

arabic: إِنَّهَا لَإِحْدَى الْكُبَرِ
english: Verily, that [hell-fire) is Indeed one of the great [forewarnings] –

arabic: نَذِيرًا لِلْبَشَرِ
english: a warning to mortal man –

arabic: لِمَنْ شَاءَ مِنْكُمْ أَنْ يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوْ يَتَأَخَّرَ
english: to everyone of you, whether he chooses to come forward or to hang back

arabic: كُلُّ نَفْسٍ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ رَهِينَةٌ
english: [On the Day of Judgment,] every human being will be held in pledge for whatever [evil] he has wrought –

arabic: إِلَّا أَصْحَابَ الْيَمِينِ
english: save those who shall have attained to righteousness

arabic: فِي جَنَّاتٍ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ
english: [dwelling] In gardens [of paradise], they will inquire

arabic: عَنِ الْمُجْرِمِينَ
english: of those who were lost in sin

arabic: مَا سَلَكَكُمْ فِي سَقَرَ
english: What has brought you into hell-fire

arabic: قَالُوا لَمْ نَكُ مِنَ الْمُصَلِّينَ
english: They will answer: "We were not among those who prayed

arabic: وَلَمْ نَكُ نُطْعِمُ الْمِسْكِينَ
english: and neither did we feed the needy

arabic: وَكُنَّا نَخُوضُ مَعَ الْخَائِضِينَ
english: and we were wont to indulge in sinning together with all [the others] who indulged in it

arabic: وَكُنَّا نُكَذِّبُ بِيَوْمِ الدِّينِ
english: and the Day of Judgment we were wont to call a lie –

arabic: حَتَّىٰ أَتَانَا الْيَقِينُ
english: until certainty came upon us [in death]

arabic: فَمَا تَنْفَعُهُمْ شَفَاعَةُ الشَّافِعِينَ
english: And so, of no benefit to them could be the intercession of any that would intercede for them

arabic: فَمَا لَهُمْ عَنِ التَّذْكِرَةِ مُعْرِضِينَ
english: WHAT, THEN, is amiss with them that they turn away from all admonition

arabic: كَأَنَّهُمْ حُمُرٌ مُسْتَنْفِرَةٌ
english: as though they were terrified asses

arabic: فَرَّتْ مِنْ قَسْوَرَةٍ
english: fleeing from a lion

arabic: بَلْ يُرِيدُ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ مِنْهُمْ أَنْ يُؤْتَىٰ صُحُفًا مُنَشَّرَةً
english: Yea, everyone of them claims that he [himself] ought to have been given revelations unfolded

arabic: كَلَّا ۖ بَلْ لَا يَخَافُونَ الْآخِرَةَ
english: Nay, but they do not [believe in and, hence, do not] fear the life to come

arabic: كَلَّا إِنَّهُ تَذْكِرَةٌ
english: Nay, verily, this is an admonition –

arabic: فَمَنْ شَاءَ ذَكَرَهُ
english: and whoever wills may take it to heart

arabic: وَمَا يَذْكُرُونَ إِلَّا أَنْ يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ هُوَ أَهْلُ التَّقْوَىٰ وَأَهْلُ الْمَغْفِرَةِ
english: But they [who do not believe in the life to come] will not take it to heart unless God so wills: [for] He is the Fount of all God-consciousness, and the Fount of all forgiveness

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ لَا أُقْسِمُ بِيَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ
english: NAY! I call to witness the Day of Resurrection

arabic: وَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِالنَّفْسِ اللَّوَّامَةِ
english: But nay! I call to witness the accusing voice of man's own conscience

arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ الْإِنْسَانُ أَلَّنْ نَجْمَعَ عِظَامَهُ
english: Does man think that We cannot [resurrect him and] bring his bones together again

arabic: بَلَىٰ قَادِرِينَ عَلَىٰ أَنْ نُسَوِّيَ بَنَانَهُ
english: Yea indeed, We are able to make whole his very finger-tips

arabic: بَلْ يُرِيدُ الْإِنْسَانُ لِيَفْجُرَ أَمَامَهُ
english: None the less man chooses to deny what lies ahead of him

arabic: يَسْأَلُ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ الْقِيَامَةِ
english: asking [derisively], "When is that Resurrection Day to be

arabic: فَإِذَا بَرِقَ الْبَصَرُ
english: But [on that Day,] when the eyesight is by fear confounded

arabic: وَخَسَفَ الْقَمَرُ
english: and the moon is darkened

arabic: وَجُمِعَ الشَّمْسُ وَالْقَمَرُ
english: and the sun and the moon are brought together

arabic: يَقُولُ الْإِنْسَانُ يَوْمَئِذٍ أَيْنَ الْمَفَرُّ
english: on that Day will man exclaim "Whither to flee

arabic: كَلَّا لَا وَزَرَ
english: But nay: no refuge [for thee, O man]

arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ الْمُسْتَقَرُّ
english: With thy Sustainer, on that Day, the journey's end will be

arabic: يُنَبَّأُ الْإِنْسَانُ يَوْمَئِذٍ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ
english: Man will be apprised, on that Day, of what he has done and what he has left undone

arabic: بَلِ الْإِنْسَانُ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِهِ بَصِيرَةٌ
english: nay, but man shall against himself be an eye-witness

arabic: وَلَوْ أَلْقَىٰ مَعَاذِيرَهُ
english: even though he may veil himself in excuses

arabic: لَا تُحَرِّكْ بِهِ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعْجَلَ بِهِ
english: MOVE NOT thy tongue in haste, [repeating the words of the revelation]

arabic: إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا جَمْعَهُ وَقُرْآنَهُ
english: for, behold, it is for Us to gather it [in thy heart,] and to cause it to be read [as it ought to be read]

arabic: فَإِذَا قَرَأْنَاهُ فَاتَّبِعْ قُرْآنَهُ
english: Thus, when We recite it, follow thou its wording [with all thy mind]

arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا بَيَانَهُ
english: and then, behold, it will be for Us to make its meaning clear

arabic: كَلَّا بَلْ تُحِبُّونَ الْعَاجِلَةَ
english: NAY, but [most of] you love this fleeting life

arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ الْآخِرَةَ
english: and give no thought to the life to come [and to Judgment Day]

arabic: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ نَاضِرَةٌ
english: Some faces will on that Day be bright with happiness

arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّهَا نَاظِرَةٌ
english: looking up to their Sustainer

arabic: وَوُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ بَاسِرَةٌ
english: and some faces will on that Day be overcast with despair

arabic: تَظُنُّ أَنْ يُفْعَلَ بِهَا فَاقِرَةٌ
english: knowing that a crushing calamity is about to befall them

arabic: كَلَّا إِذَا بَلَغَتِ التَّرَاقِيَ
english: NAY, but when [the last breath] comes up to the throat [of a dying man]

arabic: وَقِيلَ مَنْ ۜ رَاقٍ
english: and people ask, "Is there any wizard [that could save him]

arabic: وَظَنَّ أَنَّهُ الْفِرَاقُ
english: the while he [himself] knows that this is the parting

arabic: وَالْتَفَّتِ السَّاقُ بِالسَّاقِ
english: and is enwrapped in the pangs of death

arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوْمَئِذٍ الْمَسَاقُ
english: at that time towards thy Sustainer does he feel impelled to turn

arabic: فَلَا صَدَّقَ وَلَا صَلَّىٰ
english: Useless, though, will be his repentance: for [as long as he was alive] he did not accept the truth, nor did he pray [for enlightenment]

arabic: وَلَٰكِنْ كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
english: but, on the contrary, he gave the lie to the truth and turned away [from it]

arabic: ثُمَّ ذَهَبَ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِ يَتَمَطَّىٰ
english: and then went arrogantly back to what he had come from

arabic: أَوْلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوْلَىٰ
english: [And yet, O man, thine end comes hourly] nearer unto thee, and nearer –

arabic: ثُمَّ أَوْلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوْلَىٰ
english: and ever nearer unto thee, and nearer

arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ الْإِنْسَانُ أَنْ يُتْرَكَ سُدًى
english: DOES MAN, then, think that he is to be left to himself to go about at will

arabic: أَلَمْ يَكُ نُطْفَةً مِنْ مَنِيٍّ يُمْنَىٰ
english: Was he not once a [mere] drop of sperm that had been spilt

arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ عَلَقَةً فَخَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ
english: and thereafter became a germ-cell - whereupon He created and formed [it] in accordance with what [it] was meant to be

arabic: فَجَعَلَ مِنْهُ الزَّوْجَيْنِ الذَّكَرَ وَالْأُنْثَىٰ
english: and fashioned out of it the two sexes, the male and the female

arabic: أَلَيْسَ ذَٰلِكَ بِقَادِرٍ عَلَىٰ أَنْ يُحْيِيَ الْمَوْتَىٰ
english: Is not He, then; able to bring the dead back to life

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ هَلْ أَتَىٰ عَلَى الْإِنْسَانِ حِينٌ مِنَ الدَّهْرِ لَمْ يَكُنْ شَيْئًا مَذْكُورًا
english: HAS THERE [not] been an endless span of time before man [appeared - a time] when he was not yet a thing to be thought of

arabic: إِنَّا خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ مِنْ نُطْفَةٍ أَمْشَاجٍ نَبْتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلْنَاهُ سَمِيعًا بَصِيرًا
english: Verily, it is We who have created man out of a drop of sperm intermingled, so that We might try him [in his later life]: and therefore We made him a being endowed with hearing and sight

arabic: إِنَّا هَدَيْنَاهُ السَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرًا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا
english: Verily, We have shown him the way: [and it rests with him to prove himself] either grateful or ungrateful

arabic: إِنَّا أَعْتَدْنَا لِلْكَافِرِينَ سَلَاسِلَ وَأَغْلَالًا وَسَعِيرًا
english: [Now,] behold, for those who deny the truth We have readied chains and shackles, and a blazing flame

arabic: إِنَّ الْأَبْرَارَ يَشْرَبُونَ مِنْ كَأْسٍ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا
english: [whereas,] behold, the truly virtuous shall drink from a cup flavoured with the calyx of sweet-smelling flowers

arabic: عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ اللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفْجِيرًا
english: a source [of bliss] whereof God's servants shall drink, seeing it flow in a flow abundant

arabic: يُوفُونَ بِالنَّذْرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوْمًا كَانَ شَرُّهُ مُسْتَطِيرًا
english: [The truly virtuous are] they [who] fulfil their vows, and stand in awe of a Day the woe of which is bound to spread far and wide

arabic: وَيُطْعِمُونَ الطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِ مِسْكِينًا وَيَتِيمًا وَأَسِيرًا
english: and who give food - however great be their own want of it - unto the needy, and the orphan, and the captive

arabic: إِنَّمَا نُطْعِمُكُمْ لِوَجْهِ اللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنْكُمْ جَزَاءً وَلَا شُكُورًا
english: [saying, in their hearts,] "We feed you for the sake of God alone: we desire no recompense from you, nor thanks

arabic: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِنْ رَبِّنَا يَوْمًا عَبُوسًا قَمْطَرِيرًا
english: behold, we stand in awe of our Sustainer's judgment on a distressful, fateful Day

arabic: فَوَقَاهُمُ اللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمِ وَلَقَّاهُمْ نَضْرَةً وَسُرُورًا
english: And so, God will preserve them from the woes of that Day, and will bestow on them brightness and joy

arabic: وَجَزَاهُمْ بِمَا صَبَرُوا جَنَّةً وَحَرِيرًا
english: and will reward them for all their patience in adversity with a garden [of bliss] and with [garments of] silk

arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ فِيهَا عَلَى الْأَرَائِكِ ۖ لَا يَرَوْنَ فِيهَا شَمْسًا وَلَا زَمْهَرِيرًا
english: In that [garden] they will on couches recline, and will know therein neither [burning] sun nor cold severe

arabic: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيْهِمْ ظِلَالُهَا وَذُلِّلَتْ قُطُوفُهَا تَذْلِيلًا
english: since its [blissful] shades will come down low over them, and low will hang down its clusters of fruit, most easy to reach

arabic: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيْهِمْ بِآنِيَةٍ مِنْ فِضَّةٍ وَأَكْوَابٍ كَانَتْ قَوَارِيرَا
english: And they will be waited upon with vessels of silver and goblets that will [seem to] be crystal –

arabic: قَوَارِيرَ مِنْ فِضَّةٍ قَدَّرُوهَا تَقْدِيرًا
english: crystal-like, [but] of silver - the measure whereof they alone will determine

arabic: وَيُسْقَوْنَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنْجَبِيلًا
english: And in that [paradise] they will be given to drink of a cup flavoured with ginger

arabic: عَيْنًا فِيهَا تُسَمَّىٰ سَلْسَبِيلًا
english: [derived from] a source [to be found] therein, whose name is "Seek Thy Way

arabic: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَانٌ مُخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيْتَهُمْ حَسِبْتَهُمْ لُؤْلُؤًا مَنْثُورًا
english: And immortal youths will wait upon them: when thou seest them, thou wouldst deem them to be scattered pearls

arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَيْتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيْتَ نَعِيمًا وَمُلْكًا كَبِيرًا
english: and when thou seest [anything that is] there thou wilt see [only] bliss and a realm transcendent

arabic: عَالِيَهُمْ ثِيَابُ سُنْدُسٍ خُضْرٌ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٌ ۖ وَحُلُّوا أَسَاوِرَ مِنْ فِضَّةٍ وَسَقَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ شَرَابًا طَهُورًا
english: Upon those [blest] will be garments of green silk and brocade; and they will be adorned with bracelets of silver. And their Sustainer will give them to drink of a drink most pure

arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمْ جَزَاءً وَكَانَ سَعْيُكُمْ مَشْكُورًا
english: [And they will be told:] "Verily, all this is your reward since Your endeavour [in life] has met [God's] goodly acceptance

arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكَ الْقُرْآنَ تَنْزِيلًا
english: VERILY, [O believer,] it is We who have bestowed from on high this Qur’an upon thee, step by step - truly a bestowal from on high

arabic: فَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعْ مِنْهُمْ آثِمًا أَوْ كَفُورًا
english: Await, then, in all patience thy Sustainer's judgment, and pay no heed to any of them, who is a wilful sinner or an ingrate

arabic: وَاذْكُرِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا
english: and bear in mind thy Sustainer's name at morn and evening

arabic: وَمِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَاسْجُدْ لَهُ وَسَبِّحْهُ لَيْلًا طَوِيلًا
english: and during some of the night, and prostrate thyself before Him, and extol His limitless glory throughout the long night

arabic: إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ يُحِبُّونَ الْعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَاءَهُمْ يَوْمًا ثَقِيلًا
english: Behold, they [who are unmindful of God] love this fleeting life, and leave behind them [all thought of] a grief-laden Day

arabic: نَحْنُ خَلَقْنَاهُمْ وَشَدَدْنَا أَسْرَهُمْ ۖ وَإِذَا شِئْنَا بَدَّلْنَا أَمْثَالَهُمْ تَبْدِيلًا
english: [They will not admit to themselves that] it We who have created them and strengthened their make - and [that] if it be Our will We can replace them entirely with others of their kind

arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِ تَذْكِرَةٌ ۖ فَمَنْ شَاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبِيلًا
english: VERILY, all this is an admonition: whoever, then, so wills, may unto his Sustainer find a way

arabic: وَمَا تَشَاءُونَ إِلَّا أَنْ يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًا
english: But you cannot will it unless God wills [to show you that way]: for, behold, God is indeed all-seeing, wise

arabic: يُدْخِلُ مَنْ يَشَاءُ فِي رَحْمَتِهِ ۚ وَالظَّالِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
english: He admits unto His grace everyone who wills [to be admitted]; but as for the evildoers - for them has He readied grievous suffering [in the life to come]

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالْمُرْسَلَاتِ عُرْفًا
english: CONSIDER these [messages,] sent forth in waves

arabic: فَالْعَاصِفَاتِ عَصْفًا
english: and then storming on with a tempest's force

arabic: وَالنَّاشِرَاتِ نَشْرًا
english: Consider these [messages] that spread [the truth] far and wide

arabic: فَالْفَارِقَاتِ فَرْقًا
english: thus separating [right and wrong] with all clarity

arabic: فَالْمُلْقِيَاتِ ذِكْرًا
english: and then giving forth a reminder

arabic: عُذْرًا أَوْ نُذْرًا
english: [promising] freedom from blame or [offering] a warning

arabic: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَوَاقِعٌ
english: BEHOLD, all that you are told to expect will surely come to pass

arabic: فَإِذَا النُّجُومُ طُمِسَتْ
english: Thus, [it will come to pass] when the stars are effaced

arabic: وَإِذَا السَّمَاءُ فُرِجَتْ
english: and when the sky is rent asunder

arabic: وَإِذَا الْجِبَالُ نُسِفَتْ
english: and when the mountains are scattered like dust

arabic: وَإِذَا الرُّسُلُ أُقِّتَتْ
english: and when all the apostles are called together at a time appointed

arabic: لِأَيِّ يَوْمٍ أُجِّلَتْ
english: For what day has the term [of all this] been set

arabic: لِيَوْمِ الْفَصْلِ
english: For the Day of Distinction [between the true and the false]

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا يَوْمُ الْفَصْلِ
english: And what could make thee conceive what that Day of Distinction will be

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
english: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth

arabic: أَلَمْ نُهْلِكِ الْأَوَّلِينَ
english: Did We not destroy [so many of] those [sinners] of olden days

arabic: ثُمَّ نُتْبِعُهُمُ الْآخِرِينَ
english: And We shall let them be followed by those of later times

arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ نَفْعَلُ بِالْمُجْرِمِينَ
english: [for] thus do We deal with such as are lost in sin

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
english: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth

arabic: أَلَمْ نَخْلُقْكُمْ مِنْ مَاءٍ مَهِينٍ
english: Did We not create you out of a humble fluid

arabic: فَجَعَلْنَاهُ فِي قَرَارٍ مَكِينٍ
english: which We then let remain in [the womb's] firm keeping

arabic: إِلَىٰ قَدَرٍ مَعْلُومٍ
english: for a term pre-ordained

arabic: فَقَدَرْنَا فَنِعْمَ الْقَادِرُونَ
english: Thus have We determined [the nature of man's creation]: and excellent indeed is Our power to determine [what is to be]

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
english: Woe, on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth

arabic: أَلَمْ نَجْعَلِ الْأَرْضَ كِفَاتًا
english: Have We not caused the earth to hold within itself

arabic: أَحْيَاءً وَأَمْوَاتًا
english: the living and the dead

arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا فِيهَا رَوَاسِيَ شَامِخَاتٍ وَأَسْقَيْنَاكُمْ مَاءً فُرَاتًا
english: and have We not set on it proud, firm mountains, and given you sweet water to drink

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
english: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth

arabic: انْطَلِقُوا إِلَىٰ مَا كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تُكَذِّبُونَ
english: GO ON towards that [resurrection] which you were wont to call a lie

arabic: انْطَلِقُوا إِلَىٰ ظِلٍّ ذِي ثَلَاثِ شُعَبٍ
english: Go on towards the threefold shadow

arabic: لَا ظَلِيلٍ وَلَا يُغْنِي مِنَ اللَّهَبِ
english: that will offer no [cooling] shade and will be of no avail against the flame

arabic: إِنَّهَا تَرْمِي بِشَرَرٍ كَالْقَصْرِ
english: which – behold!- will throw up sparks like [burning] logs

arabic: كَأَنَّهُ جِمَالَتٌ صُفْرٌ
english: like giant fiery ropes

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
english: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth –

arabic: هَٰذَا يَوْمُ لَا يَنْطِقُونَ
english: that Day on which they will not [be able to] utter a word

arabic: وَلَا يُؤْذَنُ لَهُمْ فَيَعْتَذِرُونَ
english: nor be allowed to proffer excuses

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
english: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth –

arabic: هَٰذَا يَوْمُ الْفَصْلِ ۖ جَمَعْنَاكُمْ وَالْأَوَّلِينَ
english: that Day of Distinction [between the true and the false, when they will be told]: "We have brought you together with those [sinners] of olden times

arabic: فَإِنْ كَانَ لَكُمْ كَيْدٌ فَكِيدُونِ
english: and if you [think that you] have a subterfuge left, try to outwit Me

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
english: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth

arabic: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي ظِلَالٍ وَعُيُونٍ
english: [AS AGAINST this,] behold, the God-conscious shall dwell amidst [cooling] shades and springs

arabic: وَفَوَاكِهَ مِمَّا يَشْتَهُونَ
english: and [partake of] whatever fruit they may desire

arabic: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
english: [and they will be told:] "Eat and drink in good cheer in return for what you did [in life]

arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ
english: Thus, behold, do We reward the doers of good

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
english: [but] woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth

arabic: كُلُوا وَتَمَتَّعُوا قَلِيلًا إِنَّكُمْ مُجْرِمُونَ
english: EAT [your fill] and enjoy your life for a little while, O you who are lost in sin

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
