english: [But] woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth

arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ارْكَعُوا لَا يَرْكَعُونَ
english: and when they are told, "Bow down [before God]", do not bow down

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
english: woe on that Day unto those who give the to the truth

arabic: فَبِأَيِّ حَدِيثٍ بَعْدَهُ يُؤْمِنُونَ
english: In what other tiding, then, will they, after this, believe

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ عَمَّ يَتَسَاءَلُونَ
english: ABOUT WHAT do they [most often] ask one another

arabic: عَنِ النَّبَإِ الْعَظِيمِ
english: About the awesome tiding [of resurrection]

arabic: الَّذِي هُمْ فِيهِ مُخْتَلِفُونَ
english: on which they [so utterly] disagree

arabic: كَلَّا سَيَعْلَمُونَ
english: Nay, but in time they will come to understand [it]

arabic: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَيَعْلَمُونَ
english: And once again: Nay, but in time they will come to understand

arabic: أَلَمْ نَجْعَلِ الْأَرْضَ مِهَادًا
english: HAVE WE NOT made the earth a resting-place [for you]

arabic: وَالْجِبَالَ أَوْتَادًا
english: and the mountains [its] pegs

arabic: وَخَلَقْنَاكُمْ أَزْوَاجًا
english: And We have created you in pairs

arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا نَوْمَكُمْ سُبَاتًا
english: and We have made your sleep [a symbol of] death

arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا اللَّيْلَ لِبَاسًا
english: and made the night [its] cloak

arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا النَّهَارَ مَعَاشًا
english: and made the day [a symbol of] life

arabic: وَبَنَيْنَا فَوْقَكُمْ سَبْعًا شِدَادًا
english: And We have built above you seven firmaments

arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا سِرَاجًا وَهَّاجًا
english: and have placed [therein the sun,] a lamp full of blazing splendour

arabic: وَأَنْزَلْنَا مِنَ الْمُعْصِرَاتِ مَاءً ثَجَّاجًا
english: And from the wind-driven clouds We send down waters pouring in abundance

arabic: لِنُخْرِجَ بِهِ حَبًّا وَنَبَاتًا
english: so that We might bring forth thereby grain, and herbs

arabic: وَجَنَّاتٍ أَلْفَافًا
english: and gardens dense with follage

arabic: إِنَّ يَوْمَ الْفَصْلِ كَانَ مِيقَاتًا
english: VERILY, the Day of Distinction [between the true and the false] has indeed its appointed time

arabic: يَوْمَ يُنْفَخُ فِي الصُّورِ فَتَأْتُونَ أَفْوَاجًا
english: the Day when the trumpet [of resurrection] is sounded and you all come forward in multitudes

arabic: وَفُتِحَتِ السَّمَاءُ فَكَانَتْ أَبْوَابًا
english: and when the skies are opened and become [as wide-flung] gates

arabic: وَسُيِّرَتِ الْجِبَالُ فَكَانَتْ سَرَابًا
english: and when the mountains are made to vanish as if they had been a mirage

arabic: إِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ كَانَتْ مِرْصَادًا
english: [On that Day,] verily, hell will lie in wait [for those who deny the truth] –

arabic: لِلطَّاغِينَ مَآبًا
english: a goal for all who are wont to transgress the bounds of what is right

arabic: لَابِثِينَ فِيهَا أَحْقَابًا
english: In it shall they remain for a long time

arabic: لَا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا بَرْدًا وَلَا شَرَابًا
english: Neither coolness shall they taste therein nor any [thirst-quenching] drink –

arabic: إِلَّا حَمِيمًا وَغَسَّاقًا
english: only burning despair and ice-cold darkness

arabic: جَزَاءً وِفَاقًا
english: a meet requital [for their sins]

arabic: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا لَا يَرْجُونَ حِسَابًا
english: Behold, they were not expecting to be called to account

arabic: وَكَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا كِذَّابًا
english: having given the lie to Our messages one and all

arabic: وَكُلَّ شَيْءٍ أَحْصَيْنَاهُ كِتَابًا
english: but We have placed on record every single thing [of what they did]

arabic: فَذُوقُوا فَلَنْ نَزِيدَكُمْ إِلَّا عَذَابًا
english: [And so We shall say:] "Taste, then, [the fruit of your evil doings,] for now We shall bestow on you nothing but more and more suffering

arabic: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ مَفَازًا
english: [But,] verily for the God-conscious there is supreme fulfilment in store

arabic: حَدَائِقَ وَأَعْنَابًا
english: luxuriant gardens and vinyards

arabic: وَكَوَاعِبَ أَتْرَابًا
english: and splendid companions well matched

arabic: وَكَأْسًا دِهَاقًا
english: and a cup [of happiness] overflowing

arabic: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا كِذَّابًا
english: No empty talk will they hear in that [paradise], nor any lie

arabic: جَزَاءً مِنْ رَبِّكَ عَطَاءً حِسَابًا
english: [All this will be] a reward from thy Sustainer, a gift in accordance with [His Own] reckoning –

arabic: رَبِّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا الرَّحْمَٰنِ ۖ لَا يَمْلِكُونَ مِنْهُ خِطَابًا
english: [a reward from] the Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Most Gracious! [And] none shall have it in their power to raise their voices unto Him

arabic: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ الرُّوحُ وَالْمَلَائِكَةُ صَفًّا ۖ لَا يَتَكَلَّمُونَ إِلَّا مَنْ أَذِنَ لَهُ الرَّحْمَٰنُ وَقَالَ صَوَابًا
english: on the Day when all [human] souls and all the angels will stand up in ranks: none will speak but he to whom the Most Gracious will have given leave; and [everyone] will say [only] what is right

arabic: ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمُ الْحَقُّ ۖ فَمَنْ شَاءَ اتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ مَآبًا
english: That will be the Day of Ultimate Truth: whoever wills, then, let him take the path that leads towards his Sustainer

arabic: إِنَّا أَنْذَرْنَاكُمْ عَذَابًا قَرِيبًا يَوْمَ يَنْظُرُ الْمَرْءُ مَا قَدَّمَتْ يَدَاهُ وَيَقُولُ الْكَافِرُ يَا لَيْتَنِي كُنْتُ تُرَابًا
english: Verily, We have warned you of suffering near at hand - [suffering] on the Day when man shall [clearly] see what his hands have sent ahead, and when he who has denied the truth shall say, "Oh, would that I were mere dust

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالنَّازِعَاتِ غَرْقًا
english: CONSIDER those [stars] that rise only to set

arabic: وَالنَّاشِطَاتِ نَشْطًا
english: and move [in their orbits] with steady motion

arabic: وَالسَّابِحَاتِ سَبْحًا
english: and float [through space] with floating serene

arabic: فَالسَّابِقَاتِ سَبْقًا
english: and yet overtake [one another] with swift overtaking

arabic: فَالْمُدَبِّرَاتِ أَمْرًا
english: and thus they fulfil the [Creator's] behest

arabic: يَوْمَ تَرْجُفُ الرَّاجِفَةُ
english: [HENCE, think of] the Day when a violent convulsion will convulse [the world]

arabic: تَتْبَعُهَا الرَّادِفَةُ
english: to be followed by further [convulsions]

arabic: قُلُوبٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَاجِفَةٌ
english: On that Day will [men's] hearts be throbbing

arabic: أَبْصَارُهَا خَاشِعَةٌ
english: [and] their eyes downcast

arabic: يَقُولُونَ أَإِنَّا لَمَرْدُودُونَ فِي الْحَافِرَةِ
english: [And yet,] some say, "What! Are we indeed to be restored to our former state –

arabic: أَإِذَا كُنَّا عِظَامًا نَخِرَةً
english: even though we may have become [a heap of] crumbling bones

arabic: قَالُوا تِلْكَ إِذًا كَرَّةٌ خَاسِرَةٌ
english: [And] they add, "That, then, would be a return with loss

arabic: فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجْرَةٌ وَاحِدَةٌ
english: [But,] then, that [Last Hour] will be [upon them of a sudden, as if it were] but a single accusing cry

arabic: فَإِذَا هُمْ بِالسَّاهِرَةِ
english: and then, lo, they will be fully awakened [to the truth]

arabic: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ مُوسَىٰ
english: HAS THE STORY of Moses ever come within thy ken

arabic: إِذْ نَادَاهُ رَبُّهُ بِالْوَادِ الْمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى
english: Lo! His Sustainer called out to him in the twice-hallowed valley

arabic: اذْهَبْ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُ طَغَىٰ
english: Go unto Pharaoh - for, verily, he has transgressed all bounds of what is right

arabic: فَقُلْ هَلْ لَكَ إِلَىٰ أَنْ تَزَكَّىٰ
english: and say [unto him], 'Art thou desirous of attaining to purity

arabic: وَأَهْدِيَكَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَتَخْشَىٰ
english: [If so,] then I shall guide thee towards [a cognition of] thy Sustainer, so that [henceforth] thou wilt stand in awe [of Him].’

arabic: فَأَرَاهُ الْآيَةَ الْكُبْرَىٰ
english: And thereupon he [went to Pharaoh and] made him aware of the great wonder [of God's grace]

arabic: فَكَذَّبَ وَعَصَىٰ
english: But [Pharaoh] gave him the lie and rebelliously rejected [all guidance]

arabic: ثُمَّ أَدْبَرَ يَسْعَىٰ
english: and brusquely turned his back [on Moses]

arabic: فَحَشَرَ فَنَادَىٰ
english: and then he gathered [his great ones], and called [unto his people]

arabic: فَقَالَ أَنَا رَبُّكُمُ الْأَعْلَىٰ
english: and said, "I am your Lord All-Highest

arabic: فَأَخَذَهُ اللَّهُ نَكَالَ الْآخِرَةِ وَالْأُولَىٰ
english: And thereupon God took him to task, [and made him] a warning example in the life to come as well as in this world

arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبْرَةً لِمَنْ يَخْشَىٰ
english: In this, behold, there is a lesson indeed for all who stand in awe [of God]

arabic: أَأَنْتُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَمِ السَّمَاءُ ۚ بَنَاهَا
english: [O MEN!] Are you more difficult to create than the heaven which He has built

arabic: رَفَعَ سَمْكَهَا فَسَوَّاهَا
english: High has He reared its vault and formed it in accordance with what it was meant to be

arabic: وَأَغْطَشَ لَيْلَهَا وَأَخْرَجَ ضُحَاهَا
english: and He has made dark its night and brought forth its light of day

arabic: وَالْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ دَحَاهَا
english: And after that, the earth: wide has He spread its expanse

arabic: أَخْرَجَ مِنْهَا مَاءَهَا وَمَرْعَاهَا
english: and has caused its waters to come out of it, and its pastures

arabic: وَالْجِبَالَ أَرْسَاهَا
english: and has made the mountains firm

arabic: مَتَاعًا لَكُمْ وَلِأَنْعَامِكُمْ
english: [all this] as a means of livelihood for you and your animals

arabic: فَإِذَا جَاءَتِ الطَّامَّةُ الْكُبْرَىٰ
english: AND SO, when the great overwhelming event [of, resurrection] comes to pass –

arabic: يَوْمَ يَتَذَكَّرُ الْإِنْسَانُ مَا سَعَىٰ
english: on that Day man will [clearly] remember all that he has ever wrought

arabic: وَبُرِّزَتِ الْجَحِيمُ لِمَنْ يَرَىٰ
english: and the blazing fire [of hell] will be lad open before all who [are destined to] see it

arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ طَغَىٰ
english: For, unto him who shall have transgressed the bounds of what is right

arabic: وَآثَرَ الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا
english: and preferred the life of this world [to the good of his soul]

arabic: فَإِنَّ الْجَحِيمَ هِيَ الْمَأْوَىٰ
english: that blazing fire will truly be the goal

arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِ وَنَهَى النَّفْسَ عَنِ الْهَوَىٰ
english: But unto him who shall have stood in fear of his Sustainer's Presence, and held back his inner self from base desires

arabic: فَإِنَّ الْجَنَّةَ هِيَ الْمَأْوَىٰ
english: paradise will truly be the goal

arabic: يَسْأَلُونَكَ عَنِ السَّاعَةِ أَيَّانَ مُرْسَاهَا
english: THEY WILL ASK thee [O Prophet] about the Last Hour: "When will it come to pass

arabic: فِيمَ أَنْتَ مِنْ ذِكْرَاهَا
english: [But] how couldst thou tell anything about it

arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ مُنْتَهَاهَا
english: [seeing that] with thy Sustainer alone rests the beginning and the end [of all knowledge] thereof

arabic: إِنَّمَا أَنْتَ مُنْذِرُ مَنْ يَخْشَاهَا
english: Thou art but [sent] to warn those who stand in awe of it

arabic: كَأَنَّهُمْ يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَهَا لَمْ يَلْبَثُوا إِلَّا عَشِيَّةً أَوْ ضُحَاهَا
english: On the Day when they behold it, [it will seem to them] as if they had tarried [in this world] no longer than one evening or [one night, ending with] its morn

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ عَبَسَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
english: HE FROWNED and turned away

arabic: أَنْ جَاءَهُ الْأَعْمَىٰ
english: because the blind man approached him

arabic: وَمَا يُدْرِيكَ لَعَلَّهُ يَزَّكَّىٰ
english: Yet for all thou didst know, [O Muhammad,] he might perhaps have grown in purity

arabic: أَوْ يَذَّكَّرُ فَتَنْفَعَهُ الذِّكْرَىٰ
english: or have been reminded [of the truth], and helped by this reminder

arabic: أَمَّا مَنِ اسْتَغْنَىٰ
english: Now as for him who believes himself to be self-sufficient

arabic: فَأَنْتَ لَهُ تَصَدَّىٰ
english: to him didst thou give thy whole attention

arabic: وَمَا عَلَيْكَ أَلَّا يَزَّكَّىٰ
english: although thou art not accountable for his failure to attain to purity

arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ جَاءَكَ يَسْعَىٰ
english: but as for him who came unto thee full of eagerness

arabic: وَهُوَ يَخْشَىٰ
english: and in awe [of God]

arabic: فَأَنْتَ عَنْهُ تَلَهَّىٰ
english: him didst thou disregard

arabic: كَلَّا إِنَّهَا تَذْكِرَةٌ
english: NAY, VERILY, these [messages] are but a reminder

arabic: فَمَنْ شَاءَ ذَكَرَهُ
english: and so, whoever is willing may remember Him

arabic: فِي صُحُفٍ مُكَرَّمَةٍ
english: in [the light of His] revelations blest with dignity

arabic: مَرْفُوعَةٍ مُطَهَّرَةٍ
english: lofty and pure

arabic: بِأَيْدِي سَفَرَةٍ
english: [borne] by the hands of messengers

arabic: كِرَامٍ بَرَرَةٍ
english: noble and most virtuous

arabic: قُتِلَ الْإِنْسَانُ مَا أَكْفَرَهُ
english: [But only too often] man destroys himself: how stubbornly does he deny the truth

arabic: مِنْ أَيِّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقَهُ
english: [Does man ever consider] out of what substance [God] creates him

arabic: مِنْ نُطْفَةٍ خَلَقَهُ فَقَدَّرَهُ
english: Out of a drop of sperm He creates him, and thereupon determines his nature

arabic: ثُمَّ السَّبِيلَ يَسَّرَهُ
english: and then makes it easy for him to go through life

arabic: ثُمَّ أَمَاتَهُ فَأَقْبَرَهُ
english: and in the end He causes him to die and brings him to the grave

arabic: ثُمَّ إِذَا شَاءَ أَنْشَرَهُ
english: and then, if it be His will, He shall raise him again to life

arabic: كَلَّا لَمَّا يَقْضِ مَا أَمَرَهُ
english: Nay, but [man] has never yet fulfilled what He has enjoined upon him

arabic: فَلْيَنْظُرِ الْإِنْسَانُ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِهِ
english: Let man, then, consider [the sources of] his food

arabic: أَنَّا صَبَبْنَا الْمَاءَ صَبًّا
english: [how it is] that We pour down water, pouring it down abundantly

arabic: ثُمَّ شَقَقْنَا الْأَرْضَ شَقًّا
english: and then We cleave the earth [with new growth], cleaving it asunder

arabic: فَأَنْبَتْنَا فِيهَا حَبًّا
english: and thereupon We cause grain to grow out of it

arabic: وَعِنَبًا وَقَضْبًا
english: and vines and edible plants

arabic: وَزَيْتُونًا وَنَخْلًا
english: and olive trees and date-palms

arabic: وَحَدَائِقَ غُلْبًا
english: and gardens dense with foliage

arabic: وَفَاكِهَةً وَأَبًّا
english: and fruits and herbage

arabic: مَتَاعًا لَكُمْ وَلِأَنْعَامِكُمْ
english: for you and for your animals to enjoy

arabic: فَإِذَا جَاءَتِ الصَّاخَّةُ
english: AND SO, when the piercing call [of resurrection] is heard

arabic: يَوْمَ يَفِرُّ الْمَرْءُ مِنْ أَخِيهِ
english: on a Day when everyone will [want to] flee from his brother

arabic: وَأُمِّهِ وَأَبِيهِ
english: and from his mother and father

arabic: وَصَاحِبَتِهِ وَبَنِيهِ
english: and from his spouse and his children

arabic: لِكُلِّ امْرِئٍ مِنْهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ شَأْنٌ يُغْنِيهِ
english: on that Day, to every one of them will his own state be of sufficient concern

arabic: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ مُسْفِرَةٌ
english: Some faces will on that Day be bright with happiness

arabic: ضَاحِكَةٌ مُسْتَبْشِرَةٌ
english: laughing, rejoicing at glad tidings

arabic: وَوُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ عَلَيْهَا غَبَرَةٌ
english: And some faces will on that Day with dust be covered

arabic: تَرْهَقُهَا قَتَرَةٌ
english: with darkness overspread

arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْكَفَرَةُ الْفَجَرَةُ
english: these, these will be the ones who denied the truth and were immersed in iniquity

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا الشَّمْسُ كُوِّرَتْ
english: THEN THE SUN is shrouded in darkness

arabic: وَإِذَا النُّجُومُ انْكَدَرَتْ
english: and when the stars lose their light

arabic: وَإِذَا الْجِبَالُ سُيِّرَتْ
english: and when the mountains are made to vanish

arabic: وَإِذَا الْعِشَارُ عُطِّلَتْ
english: and when she-camels big with young, about to give birth, are left untended

arabic: وَإِذَا الْوُحُوشُ حُشِرَتْ
english: and when all beasts are gathered together

arabic: وَإِذَا الْبِحَارُ سُجِّرَتْ
english: and when the seas boil over

arabic: وَإِذَا النُّفُوسُ زُوِّجَتْ
english: and when all human beings are coupled [with their deeds]

arabic: وَإِذَا الْمَوْءُودَةُ سُئِلَتْ
english: and when the girl-child that was buried alive is made to ask

arabic: بِأَيِّ ذَنْبٍ قُتِلَتْ
english: for what crime she had been slain

arabic: وَإِذَا الصُّحُفُ نُشِرَتْ
english: and when the scrolls [of men's deeds] are unfolded

arabic: وَإِذَا السَّمَاءُ كُشِطَتْ
english: and when heaven is laid bare

arabic: وَإِذَا الْجَحِيمُ سُعِّرَتْ
english: and when the blazing fire [of hell] is kindled bright

arabic: وَإِذَا الْجَنَّةُ أُزْلِفَتْ
english: and when paradise is brought into view

arabic: عَلِمَتْ نَفْسٌ مَا أَحْضَرَتْ
english: [on that Day] every human being will come to know what he has prepared [for himself]

arabic: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِالْخُنَّسِ
english: BUT NAY! I call to witness the revolving stars

arabic: الْجَوَارِ الْكُنَّسِ
english: the planets that run their course and set

arabic: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا عَسْعَسَ
english: and the night as it darkly falls

arabic: وَالصُّبْحِ إِذَا تَنَفَّسَ
english: and the morn as it softly breathes

arabic: إِنَّهُ لَقَوْلُ رَسُولٍ كَرِيمٍ
english: behold, this [divine writ] is indeed the [inspired] word of a noble apostle

arabic: ذِي قُوَّةٍ عِنْدَ ذِي الْعَرْشِ مَكِينٍ
english: with strength endowed, secure with Him who in almightiness is enthroned

arabic: مُطَاعٍ ثَمَّ أَمِينٍ
english: [the word] of one to be heeded, and worthy of trust

arabic: وَمَا صَاحِبُكُمْ بِمَجْنُونٍ
english: For, this fellow-man of yours is not a madman

arabic: وَلَقَدْ رَآهُ بِالْأُفُقِ الْمُبِينِ
english: he truly beheld [the angel - beheld] him on the clear horizon

arabic: وَمَا هُوَ عَلَى الْغَيْبِ بِضَنِينٍ
english: and he is not one to begrudge others the knowledge [of whatever has been revealed to him] out of that which is beyond the reach of human Perception

arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَيْطَانٍ رَجِيمٍ
english: Nor is this [message] the word of any satanic force accursed

arabic: فَأَيْنَ تَذْهَبُونَ
english: Whither, then, will you go

arabic: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌ لِلْعَالَمِينَ
english: This [message] is no less than a reminder to all mankind –

arabic: لِمَنْ شَاءَ مِنْكُمْ أَنْ يَسْتَقِيمَ
english: to everyone of you who wills to walk a straight way

arabic: وَمَا تَشَاءُونَ إِلَّا أَنْ يَشَاءَ اللَّهُ رَبُّ الْعَالَمِينَ
english: But you cannot will it unless God, the Sustainer of all the worlds, wills [to show you that way]

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا السَّمَاءُ انْفَطَرَتْ
english: WHEN THE SKY is cleft asunder

arabic: وَإِذَا الْكَوَاكِبُ انْتَثَرَتْ
english: and when the stars are scattered

arabic: وَإِذَا الْبِحَارُ فُجِّرَتْ
english: and when the seas burst beyond their bounds

arabic: وَإِذَا الْقُبُورُ بُعْثِرَتْ
english: and when the graves are overturned –

arabic: عَلِمَتْ نَفْسٌ مَا قَدَّمَتْ وَأَخَّرَتْ
english: every human being will [at last] comprehend, what he has sent ahead and what he has held back [in this world]

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الْإِنْسَانُ مَا غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ الْكَرِيمِ
english: O MAN! What is it that lures thee away from thy bountiful Sustainer

arabic: الَّذِي خَلَقَكَ فَسَوَّاكَ فَعَدَلَكَ
english: who has created thee, and formed thee in accordance with what thou art meant' to be, and shaped thy nature in just proportions

arabic: فِي أَيِّ صُورَةٍ مَا شَاءَ رَكَّبَكَ
english: having put thee together in whatever form He willed [thee to have]

arabic: كَلَّا بَلْ تُكَذِّبُونَ بِالدِّينِ
english: Nay, [O men,] but you [are lured away from God whenever you are tempted to] give the lie to [God’s] Judgment

arabic: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكُمْ لَحَافِظِينَ
english: And yet, verily, there are ever-watchful forces over you

arabic: كِرَامًا كَاتِبِينَ
english: noble, recording

arabic: يَعْلَمُونَ مَا تَفْعَلُونَ
english: aware of whatever you do

arabic: إِنَّ الْأَبْرَارَ لَفِي نَعِيمٍ
english: Behold, [in the life to come] the truly virtuous: will indeed be in bliss

arabic: وَإِنَّ الْفُجَّارَ لَفِي جَحِيمٍ
english: whereas, behold, the wicked will indeed be in a blazing fire –

arabic: يَصْلَوْنَهَا يَوْمَ الدِّينِ
english: [a fire] which they shall enter on Judgment Day

arabic: وَمَا هُمْ عَنْهَا بِغَائِبِينَ
english: and which they shall not [be able to] evade

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا يَوْمُ الدِّينِ
english: And what could make thee conceive what that Judgment Day will be

arabic: ثُمَّ مَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا يَوْمُ الدِّينِ
english: And once again: What could make thee conceive what that Judgment Day will be

arabic: يَوْمَ لَا تَمْلِكُ نَفْسٌ لِنَفْسٍ شَيْئًا ۖ وَالْأَمْرُ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلَّهِ
english: [It will be] a Day when no human being shall be of the least avail to another human being: for on that Day [it will become manifest that] all sovereignty is God's alone

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَيْلٌ لِلْمُطَفِّفِينَ
english: WOE UNTO THOSE who give short measure

arabic: الَّذِينَ إِذَا اكْتَالُوا عَلَى النَّاسِ يَسْتَوْفُونَ
english: those who, when they are to receive their due from [other] people, demand that it be given in full –

arabic: وَإِذَا كَالُوهُمْ أَوْ وَزَنُوهُمْ يُخْسِرُونَ
english: but when they have to measure or weigh whatever they owe to others, give less than what is due

arabic: أَلَا يَظُنُّ أُولَٰئِكَ أَنَّهُمْ مَبْعُوثُونَ
english: Do they not know that they are bound to be raised from the dead

arabic: لِيَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
english: [and called to account] on an awesome Day –

arabic: يَوْمَ يَقُومُ النَّاسُ لِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
english: the Day when all men shall stand before the Sustainer of all the worlds

arabic: كَلَّا إِنَّ كِتَابَ الْفُجَّارِ لَفِي سِجِّينٍ
english: NAY, VERILY, the record of the wicked is indeed [set down] in a mode inescapable

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا سِجِّينٌ
english: And what could make thee conceive what that that mode inescapable will be

arabic: كِتَابٌ مَرْقُومٌ
english: A record [indelibly] inscribed

arabic: وَيْلٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُكَذِّبِينَ
english: Woe on that Day unto those who give the lie to the truth –

arabic: الَّذِينَ يُكَذِّبُونَ بِيَوْمِ الدِّينِ
english: those who give the lie to the [coming of] Judgment Day

arabic: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
english: for, none gives the lie to it but such as are wont to transgress against all that is [and are] immersed in sin

arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ آيَاتُنَا قَالَ أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
english: [and so,] whenever Our messages are conveyed to them, they but say, "Fables of ancient times

arabic: كَلَّا ۖ بَلْ ۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ مَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ
english: Nay, but their hearts are corroded by all [the evil] that they were wont to do

arabic: كَلَّا إِنَّهُمْ عَنْ رَبِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَمَحْجُوبُونَ
english: Nay, verily, from [the grace of] their Sustainer shall they on that Day be debarred

arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّهُمْ لَصَالُو الْجَحِيمِ
english: and then, behold, they shall enter the blazing fire

arabic: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَٰذَا الَّذِي كُنْتُمْ بِهِ تُكَذِّبُونَ
english: and be told: "This is the [very thing] to which you were wont to give the lie

arabic: كَلَّا إِنَّ كِتَابَ الْأَبْرَارِ لَفِي عِلِّيِّينَ
english: NAY, VERILY - the record of the truly virtuous is [set down] in a mode most lofty

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا عِلِّيُّونَ
english: And what could make thee conceive what that mode most lofty will be

arabic: كِتَابٌ مَرْقُومٌ
english: A record [indelibly] inscribed

arabic: يَشْهَدُهُ الْمُقَرَّبُونَ
english: witnessed~ by all who have [ever] been drawn close unto God

arabic: إِنَّ الْأَبْرَارَ لَفِي نَعِيمٍ
english: Behold, [in the life to come] the truly virtuous will indeed be in bliss

arabic: عَلَى الْأَرَائِكِ يَنْظُرُونَ
english: resting on couches, they will look up [to God]

arabic: تَعْرِفُ فِي وُجُوهِهِمْ نَضْرَةَ النَّعِيمِ
english: upon their faces thou wilt see the brightness of bliss

arabic: يُسْقَوْنَ مِنْ رَحِيقٍ مَخْتُومٍ
english: They will be given a drink of pure wine whereon the seal [of God] will have been set

arabic: خِتَامُهُ مِسْكٌ ۚ وَفِي ذَٰلِكَ فَلْيَتَنَافَسِ الْمُتَنَافِسُونَ
english: pouring forth with a fragrance of musk. To that [wine of paradise], then, let all such aspire as [are willing to] aspire to things of high account

arabic: وَمِزَاجُهُ مِنْ تَسْنِيمٍ
english: for it is composed of all that is most exalting

arabic: عَيْنًا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا الْمُقَرَّبُونَ
english: a source [of bliss] whereof those who are drawn close unto God shall drink

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا كَانُوا مِنَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا يَضْحَكُونَ
english: BEHOLD, those who have abandoned themselves to sin are wont to laugh at such as have attained to faith

arabic: وَإِذَا مَرُّوا بِهِمْ يَتَغَامَزُونَ
english: and whenever they pass by them, they wink at one another [derisively]

arabic: وَإِذَا انْقَلَبُوا إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِمُ انْقَلَبُوا فَكِهِينَ
english: and whenever they return to people of their own kind, they return full of jests

arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوْهُمْ قَالُوا إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ لَضَالُّونَ
english: and whenever they see those [who believe,] they say, "Behold, these [people] have indeed gone astray

arabic: وَمَا أُرْسِلُوا عَلَيْهِمْ حَافِظِينَ
english: And, withal, they have no call to watch over [the beliefs of] others

arabic: فَالْيَوْمَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مِنَ الْكُفَّارِ يَضْحَكُونَ
english: But on the Day [of Judgment], they who had attained to faith will [be able to] laugh at the [erstwhile] deniers of the truth

arabic: عَلَى الْأَرَائِكِ يَنْظُرُونَ
english: [for, resting in paradise] on couches, they will look on [and say to themselves]

arabic: هَلْ ثُوِّبَ الْكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا يَفْعَلُونَ
english: Are these deniers of the truth being [thus] requited for [aught but] what they were wont to do

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا السَّمَاءُ انْشَقَّتْ
english: WHEN THE SKY is split asunder

arabic: وَأَذِنَتْ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتْ
english: obeying its Sustainer, as in truth it must

arabic: وَإِذَا الْأَرْضُ مُدَّتْ
english: and when the earth is leveled

arabic: وَأَلْقَتْ مَا فِيهَا وَتَخَلَّتْ
english: and casts forth whatever is in it, and becomes utterly void

arabic: وَأَذِنَتْ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتْ
english: obeying its Sustainer, as in truth it must

arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الْإِنْسَانُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدْحًا فَمُلَاقِيهِ
english: [then,] O man - thou [that] hast, verily, been toiling towards thy Sustainer in painful toil - then shalt thou meet Him

arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ بِيَمِينِهِ
english: And as for him whose record shall be placed in his right hand

arabic: فَسَوْفَ يُحَاسَبُ حِسَابًا يَسِيرًا
english: he will in time be called to account with an easy accounting

arabic: وَيَنْقَلِبُ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِ مَسْرُورًا
english: and will [be able to] turn joyfully to those of his own kind

arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِيَ كِتَابَهُ وَرَاءَ ظَهْرِهِ
english: But as for him whose record shall be given to him behind his back

arabic: فَسَوْفَ يَدْعُو ثُبُورًا
english: he will in time pray for utter destruction

arabic: وَيَصْلَىٰ سَعِيرًا
english: but he will enter the blazing flame

arabic: إِنَّهُ كَانَ فِي أَهْلِهِ مَسْرُورًا
english: Behold, [in his earthly life] he lived joyfully among people of his own kind

arabic: إِنَّهُ ظَنَّ أَنْ لَنْ يَحُورَ
english: for, behold, he never thought that he would have to return [to God]

arabic: بَلَىٰ إِنَّ رَبَّهُ كَانَ بِهِ بَصِيرًا
english: Yea indeed! His Sustainer did see all that was in him

arabic: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِالشَّفَقِ
english: BUT NAY! I call to witness the sunset's [fleeting] afterglow

arabic: وَاللَّيْلِ وَمَا وَسَقَ
english: and the night, and what it [step by step] unfolds

arabic: وَالْقَمَرِ إِذَا اتَّسَقَ
english: and the moon, as it grows to its fullness

arabic: لَتَرْكَبُنَّ طَبَقًا عَنْ طَبَقٍ
english: [even thus, O men,] are you bound to move; onward from stage to stage

arabic: فَمَا لَهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
english: What, then, is amiss with them that they will not believe [in a life to come]

arabic: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَيْهِمُ الْقُرْآنُ لَا يَسْجُدُونَ ۩
english: and [that], when the Qur’an is read unto them, they do not fall down in prostration

arabic: بَلِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا يُكَذِّبُونَ
english: Nay, but they who are bent on denying the truth give the lie [to this divine writ]

arabic: وَاللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يُوعُونَ
english: Yet God has full knowledge of what they conceal [in their hearts]

arabic: فَبَشِّرْهُمْ بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
english: Hence, give them the tiding of grievous suffering [in the life to come] –

arabic: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍ
english: unless it be such [of them] as [repent, and] attain to faith, and do good works: for theirs shall be a reward unending

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الْبُرُوجِ
english: CONSIDER the sky full of great constellations

arabic: وَالْيَوْمِ الْمَوْعُودِ
english: and [then bethink thyself of] the promised Day

arabic: وَشَاهِدٍ وَمَشْهُودٍ
english: and [of] Him who witnesses [all], and [of] that unto which witness is borne [by Him]

arabic: قُتِلَ أَصْحَابُ الْأُخْدُودِ
english: THEY DESTROY [but] themselves, they who would ready a pit

arabic: النَّارِ ذَاتِ الْوَقُودِ
english: of fire fiercely burning [for all who have attained to faith]

arabic: إِذْ هُمْ عَلَيْهَا قُعُودٌ
english: Lo! [With glee do] they contemplate that [fire]

arabic: وَهُمْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَفْعَلُونَ بِالْمُؤْمِنِينَ شُهُودٌ
english: fully conscious of what they are doing to the believers

arabic: وَمَا نَقَمُوا مِنْهُمْ إِلَّا أَنْ يُؤْمِنُوا بِاللَّهِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَمِيدِ
english: whom they hate for no other reason than that they believe in God, the Almighty, the One to whom all praise is due

arabic: الَّذِي لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ شَهِيدٌ
english: [and] to whom the dominion of the heavens and the earth belongs. But God is witness unto everything

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ فَتَنُوا الْمُؤْمِنِينَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَتُوبُوا فَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ الْحَرِيقِ
english: Verily, as for those who persecute believing men and believing women, and thereafter do not repent, hell's suffering awaits them: yea, suffering through fire awaits them

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَهُمْ جَنَّاتٌ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ الْفَوْزُ الْكَبِيرُ
english: [But,] verily, they who attain to faith and do righteous deeds shall [in the life to come] have gardens through which running waters flow - that triumph most great

arabic: إِنَّ بَطْشَ رَبِّكَ لَشَدِيدٌ
english: VERILY, thy Sustainer's grip is exceedingly strong

arabic: إِنَّهُ هُوَ يُبْدِئُ وَيُعِيدُ
english: Behold, it is He who creates [man] in the first instance, and He [it is who] will bring him forth anew

arabic: وَهُوَ الْغَفُورُ الْوَدُودُ
english: And He alone is truly-forgiving, all-embracing in His love

arabic: ذُو الْعَرْشِ الْمَجِيدُ
english: in sublime almightiness enthroned

arabic: فَعَّالٌ لِمَا يُرِيدُ
english: a sovereign doer of whatever He wills

arabic: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ الْجُنُودِ
english: HAS IT ever come within thy ken, the story of the [sinful] hosts

arabic: فِرْعَوْنَ وَثَمُودَ
english: of Pharaoh, and of [the tribe of] Thamud

arabic: بَلِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فِي تَكْذِيبٍ
english: And yet, they who are bent on denying the truth persist in giving it the lie

arabic: وَاللَّهُ مِنْ وَرَائِهِمْ مُحِيطٌ
english: but all the while God encompasses them [with His knowledge and might] without their being aware of it

arabic: بَلْ هُوَ قُرْآنٌ مَجِيدٌ
english: Nay, but this [divine writ which they reject] is a discourse sublime

arabic: فِي لَوْحٍ مَحْفُوظٍ
english: upon an imperishable tablet [inscribed]

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالسَّمَاءِ وَالطَّارِقِ
english: CONSIDER the heavens and that which comes in the night

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الطَّارِقُ
english: And what could make thee conceive what it is that comes in the night

arabic: النَّجْمُ الثَّاقِبُ
english: It is the star that pierces through [life's] darkness

arabic: إِنْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ لَمَّا عَلَيْهَا حَافِظٌ
english: [for] no human being has ever been left unguarded

arabic: فَلْيَنْظُرِ الْإِنْسَانُ مِمَّ خُلِقَ
english: LET MAN, then, observe out of what he has been created

arabic: خُلِقَ مِنْ مَاءٍ دَافِقٍ
english: he has been created out of a seminal fluid

arabic: يَخْرُجُ مِنْ بَيْنِ الصُّلْبِ وَالتَّرَائِبِ
english: issuing from between the loins [of man] and the pelvic arch [of woman]

arabic: إِنَّهُ عَلَىٰ رَجْعِهِ لَقَادِرٌ
english: Now, verily, He [who thus creates man in the first instance] is well able to bring him back [to life]

arabic: يَوْمَ تُبْلَى السَّرَائِرُ
english: on the Day when all secrets will be laid bare

arabic: فَمَا لَهُ مِنْ قُوَّةٍ وَلَا نَاصِرٍ
english: and [man] will have neither strength nor helper

arabic: وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الرَّجْعِ
english: Consider the heavens, ever-revolving

arabic: وَالْأَرْضِ ذَاتِ الصَّدْعِ
english: and the earth, bursting forth with plants

arabic: إِنَّهُ لَقَوْلٌ فَصْلٌ
english: BEHOLD, this [divine writ] is indeed a word that between truth and falsehood

arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِالْهَزْلِ
english: and is no idle tale

arabic: إِنَّهُمْ يَكِيدُونَ كَيْدًا
english: Behold, they [who refuse to accept it] devise many a false argument [to disprove its truth]

arabic: وَأَكِيدُ كَيْدًا
english: but I shall bring all their scheming to nought

arabic: فَمَهِّلِ الْكَافِرِينَ أَمْهِلْهُمْ رُوَيْدًا
english: Let, then, the deniers of the truth have their will: let them have their will for a little while

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ سَبِّحِ اسْمَ رَبِّكَ الْأَعْلَى
english: EXTOL the limitless glory of thy Sustainer's name: [the glory of] the Al-Highest

arabic: الَّذِي خَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ
english: who creates [every thing], and thereupon forms it in accordance with what it is meant to be

arabic: وَالَّذِي قَدَّرَ فَهَدَىٰ
english: and who determines the nature [of all that exists], and thereupon guides it [towards its fulfilment]

arabic: وَالَّذِي أَخْرَجَ الْمَرْعَىٰ
english: and who brings forth herbage

arabic: فَجَعَلَهُ غُثَاءً أَحْوَىٰ
english: and thereupon causes it to decay into rust-brown stubble

arabic: سَنُقْرِئُكَ فَلَا تَنْسَىٰ
english: WE SHALL teach thee, and thou wilt not forget [aught of what thou art taught]

arabic: إِلَّا مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ يَعْلَمُ الْجَهْرَ وَمَا يَخْفَىٰ
english: save what God may will [thee to forget] - for, verily, He [alone] knows all that is open to [man's] perception as well as all that is hidden [from it]

arabic: وَنُيَسِّرُكَ لِلْيُسْرَىٰ
english: and [thus] shall We make easy for thee the path towards [ultimate] ease

arabic: فَذَكِّرْ إِنْ نَفَعَتِ الذِّكْرَىٰ
english: REMIND, THEN, [others of the truth, regardless of] whether this reminding [would seem to] be of use [or not]

arabic: سَيَذَّكَّرُ مَنْ يَخْشَىٰ
english: in mind will keep it he who stands in awe [of God]

arabic: وَيَتَجَنَّبُهَا الْأَشْقَى
english: but aloof from it will remain that most hapless wretch –

arabic: الَّذِي يَصْلَى النَّارَ الْكُبْرَىٰ
english: he who [in the life to come] shall have to endure the great fire

arabic: ثُمَّ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحْيَىٰ
english: wherein he will neither die nor remain alive

arabic: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَنْ تَزَكَّىٰ
english: To happiness [in the life to come] will indeed attain he who attains to purity [in this world]

arabic: وَذَكَرَ اسْمَ رَبِّهِ فَصَلَّىٰ
english: and remembers his Sustainer's name, and prays [unto Him]

arabic: بَلْ تُؤْثِرُونَ الْحَيَاةَ الدُّنْيَا
english: But nay, [O men,] you prefer the life of this world

arabic: وَالْآخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰ
english: although the life to come is better and more enduring

arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَفِي الصُّحُفِ الْأُولَىٰ
english: Verily, [all] this has indeed been [said] in the earlier revelations –

arabic: صُحُفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَمُوسَىٰ
english: the revelations of Abraham and Moses

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ الْغَاشِيَةِ
english: HAS THERE COME unto thee the tiding of the Overshadowing Event

arabic: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ خَاشِعَةٌ
english: Some faces will on that Day be downcast

arabic: عَامِلَةٌ نَاصِبَةٌ
english: toiling [under burdens of sin], worn out [by fear]

arabic: تَصْلَىٰ نَارًا حَامِيَةً
english: about to enter a glowing fire

arabic: تُسْقَىٰ مِنْ عَيْنٍ آنِيَةٍ
english: given to drink from a boiling spring

arabic: لَيْسَ لَهُمْ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِنْ ضَرِيعٍ
english: No food for them save the bitterness of dry thorns

arabic: لَا يُسْمِنُ وَلَا يُغْنِي مِنْ جُوعٍ
english: which gives no strength and neither stills hunger

arabic: وُجُوهٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ نَاعِمَةٌ
english: [And] some faces will on that Day shine with bliss

arabic: لِسَعْيِهَا رَاضِيَةٌ
english: well-pleased with [the fruit of] their striving

arabic: فِي جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٍ
english: in a garden sublime

arabic: لَا تَسْمَعُ فِيهَا لَاغِيَةً
english: wherein thou wilt hear no empty talk

arabic: فِيهَا عَيْنٌ جَارِيَةٌ
english: Countless springs will flow therein

arabic: فِيهَا سُرُرٌ مَرْفُوعَةٌ
english: [and] there will be thrones [of happiness] raised high

arabic: وَأَكْوَابٌ مَوْضُوعَةٌ
english: and goblets placed ready

arabic: وَنَمَارِقُ مَصْفُوفَةٌ
english: and cushions ranged

arabic: وَزَرَابِيُّ مَبْثُوثَةٌ
english: and carpets spread out…

arabic: أَفَلَا يَنْظُرُونَ إِلَى الْإِبِلِ كَيْفَ خُلِقَتْ
english: DO, THEN, they [who deny resurrection] never gaze at the clouds pregnant with water, [and observe] how they are created

arabic: وَإِلَى السَّمَاءِ كَيْفَ رُفِعَتْ
english: And at the sky, how it is raised aloft

arabic: وَإِلَى الْجِبَالِ كَيْفَ نُصِبَتْ
english: And at the mountains, how firmly they are reared

arabic: وَإِلَى الْأَرْضِ كَيْفَ سُطِحَتْ
english: And at the earth, how it is spread out

arabic: فَذَكِّرْ إِنَّمَا أَنْتَ مُذَكِّرٌ
english: And so, [O Prophet,] exhort them; thy task is only to exhort

arabic: لَسْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ بِمُصَيْطِرٍ
english: thou canst not compel them [to believe]

arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ تَوَلَّىٰ وَكَفَرَ
english: However, as for him who turns away, being bent on denying the truth

arabic: فَيُعَذِّبُهُ اللَّهُ الْعَذَابَ الْأَكْبَرَ
english: him will God cause to suffer the greatest suffering [in the life to come]

arabic: إِنَّ إِلَيْنَا إِيَابَهُمْ
english: for behold, unto Us will be their return

arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا حِسَابَهُمْ
english: and verily, It is for Us to call them to account

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالْفَجْرِ
english: CONSIDER the daybreak

arabic: وَلَيَالٍ عَشْرٍ
english: and the ten nights

arabic: وَالشَّفْعِ وَالْوَتْرِ
english: Consider the multiple and the One

arabic: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا يَسْرِ
english: Consider the night as it runs its course

arabic: هَلْ فِي ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِذِي حِجْرٍ
english: Considering all this - could there be, to anyone endowed with reason, a [more] solemn evidence of the truth

arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ
english: ART THOU NOT aware of how thy Sustainer has dealt with [the tribe of] ‘Ad

arabic: إِرَمَ ذَاتِ الْعِمَادِ
english: [the people of] Iram the many-pillared

arabic: الَّتِي لَمْ يُخْلَقْ مِثْلُهَا فِي الْبِلَادِ
english: the like of whom has never been reared in all the land? –

arabic: وَثَمُودَ الَّذِينَ جَابُوا الصَّخْرَ بِالْوَادِ
english: and with [the tribe of] Thamud, who hollowed out rocks in the valley? –

arabic: وَفِرْعَوْنَ ذِي الْأَوْتَادِ
english: and with Pharaoh of the [many] tent-poles

arabic: الَّذِينَ طَغَوْا فِي الْبِلَادِ
english: [It was they] who transgressed all bounds of equity all over their lands

arabic: فَأَكْثَرُوا فِيهَا الْفَسَادَ
english: and brought about great corruption therein

arabic: فَصَبَّ عَلَيْهِمْ رَبُّكَ سَوْطَ عَذَابٍ
english: and therefore thy Sustainer let loose upon them a scourge of suffering

arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَبِالْمِرْصَادِ
english: for, verily, thy Sustainer is ever on the watch

arabic: فَأَمَّا الْإِنْسَانُ إِذَا مَا ابْتَلَاهُ رَبُّهُ فَأَكْرَمَهُ وَنَعَّمَهُ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّي أَكْرَمَنِ
english: BUT AS FOR man, whenever his Sustainer tries him by His generosity and by letting him enjoy a life of ease, he says, "My Sustainer has been [justly] generous towards me

arabic: وَأَمَّا إِذَا مَا ابْتَلَاهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقَهُ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّي أَهَانَنِ
english: whereas, whenever He tries him by straitening his means of livelihood, he says, "My Sustainer has disgraced me

arabic: كَلَّا ۖ بَلْ لَا تُكْرِمُونَ الْيَتِيمَ
english: But nay, nay, [O men, consider all that you do and fail to do:] you are not generous towards the orphan

arabic: وَلَا تَحَاضُّونَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ الْمِسْكِينِ
english: and you do not urge one another to feed the needy

arabic: وَتَأْكُلُونَ التُّرَاثَ أَكْلًا لَمًّا
english: and you devour the inheritance [of others] with devouring greed

arabic: وَتُحِبُّونَ الْمَالَ حُبًّا جَمًّا
english: and you love wealth with boundless love

arabic: كَلَّا إِذَا دُكَّتِ الْأَرْضُ دَكًّا دَكًّا
english: Nay, but [how will you fare on Judgment Day,] when the earth is crushed with crushing upon crushing

arabic: وَجَاءَ رَبُّكَ وَالْمَلَكُ صَفًّا صَفًّا
english: and [the majesty of] thy Sustainer stands revealed, as well as [the true nature of] the angels; rank upon rank

arabic: وَجِيءَ يَوْمَئِذٍ بِجَهَنَّمَ ۚ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَذَكَّرُ الْإِنْسَانُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ الذِّكْرَىٰ
english: And on that Day hell will be brought [within sight]; on that Day man will remember [all that he did and failed to do]: but what will that remembrance avail him

arabic: يَقُولُ يَا لَيْتَنِي قَدَّمْتُ لِحَيَاتِي
english: He will say, "Oh, would that I had. provided beforehand for my life [to come]

arabic: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ لَا يُعَذِّبُ عَذَابَهُ أَحَدٌ
english: For, none can make suffer as He will make suffer [the sinners] on that Day

arabic: وَلَا يُوثِقُ وَثَاقَهُ أَحَدٌ
english: and none can bind with bonds like His

arabic: يَا أَيَّتُهَا النَّفْسُ الْمُطْمَئِنَّةُ
english: [But unto the righteous God will say,] "O thou human being that hast attained to inner peace

arabic: ارْجِعِي إِلَىٰ رَبِّكِ رَاضِيَةً مَرْضِيَّةً
english: Return thou unto thy Sustainer, well-pleased [and] pleasing [Him]

arabic: فَادْخُلِي فِي عِبَادِي
english: enter, then, together with My [other true] servants –

arabic: وَادْخُلِي جَنَّتِي
english: yea, enter thou My paradise

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ لَا أُقْسِمُ بِهَٰذَا الْبَلَدِ
english: NAY! I call to witness this land –

arabic: وَأَنْتَ حِلٌّ بِهَٰذَا الْبَلَدِ
english: this land in which thou art free to dwell

arabic: وَوَالِدٍ وَمَا وَلَدَ
english: and [I call to witness] parent and offspring

arabic: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ فِي كَبَدٍ
english: Verily, We have created man into [a life of] pain, toil and trial

arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ أَنْ لَنْ يَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ أَحَدٌ
english: Does he, then, think that no one has power over him

arabic: يَقُولُ أَهْلَكْتُ مَالًا لُبَدًا
english: He boasts, "I have spent wealth abundant

arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ أَنْ لَمْ يَرَهُ أَحَدٌ
english: Does he, then, think that no one sees him

arabic: أَلَمْ نَجْعَلْ لَهُ عَيْنَيْنِ
english: Have We not given him two eyes

arabic: وَلِسَانًا وَشَفَتَيْنِ
english: and a tongue, and a pair of lips

arabic: وَهَدَيْنَاهُ النَّجْدَيْنِ
english: and shown him the two highways [of good and evil]

arabic: فَلَا اقْتَحَمَ الْعَقَبَةَ
english: But he would not try to ascend the steep uphill road

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الْعَقَبَةُ
english: And what could make thee conceive what it is, that steep uphill road

arabic: فَكُّ رَقَبَةٍ
english: [It is] the freeing of one's neck [from the burden of sin]

arabic: أَوْ إِطْعَامٌ فِي يَوْمٍ ذِي مَسْغَبَةٍ
english: or the feeding, upon a day of [one's own] hunger

arabic: يَتِيمًا ذَا مَقْرَبَةٍ
english: of an orphan near of kin

arabic: أَوْ مِسْكِينًا ذَا مَتْرَبَةٍ
english: or of a needy [stranger] lying in the dust –

arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالصَّبْرِ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالْمَرْحَمَةِ
english: and being, withal, of those who have attained to faith, and who enjoin upon one another patience in adversity, and enjoin upon one another compassion

arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ الْمَيْمَنَةِ
english: Such are they that have attained to righteousness

arabic: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِآيَاتِنَا هُمْ أَصْحَابُ الْمَشْأَمَةِ
english: whereas those who are bent on denying the truth of Our messages – they are such as have lost themselves in evil

arabic: عَلَيْهِمْ نَارٌ مُؤْصَدَةٌ
english: [with] fire closing in upon them

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالشَّمْسِ وَضُحَاهَا
english: CONSIDER the sun and its radiant brightness

arabic: وَالْقَمَرِ إِذَا تَلَاهَا
english: and the moon as it reflects the sun

arabic: وَالنَّهَارِ إِذَا جَلَّاهَا
english: Consider the day as it reveals the world

arabic: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَاهَا
english: and the night as it veils it darkly

arabic: وَالسَّمَاءِ وَمَا بَنَاهَا
english: Consider the sky and its wondrous make

arabic: وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا طَحَاهَا
english: and the earth and all its expanse

arabic: وَنَفْسٍ وَمَا سَوَّاهَا
english: Consider the human self, and how it is formed in accordance with what it is meant to be

arabic: فَأَلْهَمَهَا فُجُورَهَا وَتَقْوَاهَا
english: and how it is imbued with moral failings as well as with consciousness of God

arabic: قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَنْ زَكَّاهَا
english: To a happy state shall indeed attain he who causes this [self] to grow in purity

arabic: وَقَدْ خَابَ مَنْ دَسَّاهَا
english: and truly lost is he who buries it [in darkness]

arabic: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ بِطَغْوَاهَا
english: TO [THIS] TRUTH gave the lie, in their overweening arrogance, [the tribe of] Thamud

arabic: إِذِ انْبَعَثَ أَشْقَاهَا
english: when that most hapless wretch from among them rushed forward [to commit his evil deed]

arabic: فَقَالَ لَهُمْ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ نَاقَةَ اللَّهِ وَسُقْيَاهَا
english: although God's apostle had told them, "It is a she-camel belonging to God, so let her drink [and do her no harm]

arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمْدَمَ عَلَيْهِمْ رَبُّهُمْ بِذَنْبِهِمْ فَسَوَّاهَا
english: But they gave him the lie, and cruelly slaughtered her - whereupon their Sustainer visited them with utter destruction for this their sin, destroying them all alike

arabic: وَلَا يَخَافُ عُقْبَاهَا
english: for none [of them] had any fear of what might befall them

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا يَغْشَىٰ
english: CONSIDER the night as it veils [the earth] in darkness

arabic: وَالنَّهَارِ إِذَا تَجَلَّىٰ
english: and the day as it rises bright

arabic: وَمَا خَلَقَ الذَّكَرَ وَالْأُنْثَىٰ
english: Consider the creation of the male and the female

arabic: إِنَّ سَعْيَكُمْ لَشَتَّىٰ
english: Verily, [O men,] you aim at most divergent ends

arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أَعْطَىٰ وَاتَّقَىٰ
english: Thus, as for him who gives [to others] and is conscious of God

arabic: وَصَدَّقَ بِالْحُسْنَىٰ
english: and believes in the truth of the ultimate good

arabic: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُ لِلْيُسْرَىٰ
english: for him shall We make easy the path towards [ultimate] ease

arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ بَخِلَ وَاسْتَغْنَىٰ
english: But as for him who is niggardly, and thinks that he is self-sufficient

arabic: وَكَذَّبَ بِالْحُسْنَىٰ
english: and calls the ultimate good a lie –

arabic: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُ لِلْعُسْرَىٰ
english: for him shall We make easy the path towards hardship

arabic: وَمَا يُغْنِي عَنْهُ مَالُهُ إِذَا تَرَدَّىٰ
english: and what will his wealth avail him when he goes down [to his grave]

arabic: إِنَّ عَلَيْنَا لَلْهُدَىٰ
english: BEHOLD, it is indeed for Us to grace [you] with guidance

arabic: وَإِنَّ لَنَا لَلْآخِرَةَ وَالْأُولَىٰ
english: and, behold, Ours is [the dominion over] the life to come as well as [over] this earlier part [of your life]

arabic: فَأَنْذَرْتُكُمْ نَارًا تَلَظَّىٰ
english: and so I warn you of the raging fire

arabic: لَا يَصْلَاهَا إِلَّا الْأَشْقَى
english: [the fire] which none shall have to endure but that most hapless wretch

arabic: الَّذِي كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
english: who gives the lie to the truth and turns away [from it]

arabic: وَسَيُجَنَّبُهَا الْأَتْقَى
english: For, distant from it shall remain he who is truly conscious of God

arabic: الَّذِي يُؤْتِي مَالَهُ يَتَزَكَّىٰ
english: he that spends his possessions [on others] so that he might grow in purity –

arabic: وَمَا لِأَحَدٍ عِنْدَهُ مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ تُجْزَىٰ
english: not as payment for favours received

arabic: إِلَّا ابْتِغَاءَ وَجْهِ رَبِّهِ الْأَعْلَىٰ
english: but only out of a longing for the countenance of his Sustainer, the All-Highest

arabic: وَلَسَوْفَ يَرْضَىٰ
english: and such, indeed, shall in time be well-pleased

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالضُّحَىٰ
english: CONSIDER the bright morning hours

arabic: وَاللَّيْلِ إِذَا سَجَىٰ
english: and the night when it grows still and dark

arabic: مَا وَدَّعَكَ رَبُّكَ وَمَا قَلَىٰ
english: Thy Sustainer has not forsaken thee, nor does He scorn thee

arabic: وَلَلْآخِرَةُ خَيْرٌ لَكَ مِنَ الْأُولَىٰ
english: for, indeed, the life to come will be better for thee than this earlier part [of thy life]

arabic: وَلَسَوْفَ يُعْطِيكَ رَبُّكَ فَتَرْضَىٰ
english: And, indeed, in time will thy Sustainer grant thee [what thy heart desires], and thou shalt be well-pleased

arabic: أَلَمْ يَجِدْكَ يَتِيمًا فَآوَىٰ
english: Has He not found thee an orphan, and given thee shelter

arabic: وَوَجَدَكَ ضَالًّا فَهَدَىٰ
english: And found thee lost on thy way, and guided thee

arabic: وَوَجَدَكَ عَائِلًا فَأَغْنَىٰ
english: And found thee in want, and given thee sufficiency

arabic: فَأَمَّا الْيَتِيمَ فَلَا تَقْهَرْ
english: Therefore, the orphan shalt thou never wrong

arabic: وَأَمَّا السَّائِلَ فَلَا تَنْهَرْ
english: and him that seeks [thy] help shalt thou never chide

arabic: وَأَمَّا بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّكَ فَحَدِّثْ
english: and of thy Sustainer's blessings shalt thou [ever] speak

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ أَلَمْ نَشْرَحْ لَكَ صَدْرَكَ
english: HAVE WE NOT opened up thy heart

arabic: وَوَضَعْنَا عَنْكَ وِزْرَكَ
english: and lifted from thee the burden

arabic: الَّذِي أَنْقَضَ ظَهْرَكَ
english: that had weighed so heavily on thy back

arabic: وَرَفَعْنَا لَكَ ذِكْرَكَ
english: And [have We not] raised thee high in dignity

arabic: فَإِنَّ مَعَ الْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
english: And, behold, with every hardship comes ease

arabic: إِنَّ مَعَ الْعُسْرِ يُسْرًا
english: verily, with every hardship comes ease

arabic: فَإِذَا فَرَغْتَ فَانْصَبْ
english: Hence, when thou art freed [from distress], remain steadfast

arabic: وَإِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَارْغَبْ
english: and unto thy Sustainer turn with love

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالتِّينِ وَالزَّيْتُونِ
english: CONSIDER the fig and the olive

arabic: وَطُورِ سِينِينَ
english: and Mount Sinai

arabic: وَهَٰذَا الْبَلَدِ الْأَمِينِ
english: and this land secure

arabic: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنْسَانَ فِي أَحْسَنِ تَقْوِيمٍ
english: Verily, We create man in the best conformation

arabic: ثُمَّ رَدَدْنَاهُ أَسْفَلَ سَافِلِينَ
english: and thereafter We reduce him to the lowest of low

arabic: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ فَلَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍ
english: excepting only such as attain to faith and do good works: and theirs shall be a reward unending

arabic: فَمَا يُكَذِّبُكَ بَعْدُ بِالدِّينِ
english: What, then, [O man,] could henceforth cause thee to give the lie to this moral law

arabic: أَلَيْسَ اللَّهُ بِأَحْكَمِ الْحَاكِمِينَ
english: Is not God the most just of judges

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ اقْرَأْ بِاسْمِ رَبِّكَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ
english: READ in the name of thy Sustainer, who has

arabic: خَلَقَ الْإِنْسَانَ مِنْ عَلَقٍ
english: created man out of a germ-cell

arabic: اقْرَأْ وَرَبُّكَ الْأَكْرَمُ
english: Read - for thy Sustainer is the Most Bountiful One

arabic: الَّذِي عَلَّمَ بِالْقَلَمِ
english: who has taught [man] the use of the pen –

arabic: عَلَّمَ الْإِنْسَانَ مَا لَمْ يَعْلَمْ
english: taught man what he did not know

arabic: كَلَّا إِنَّ الْإِنْسَانَ لَيَطْغَىٰ
english: Nay, verily, man becomes grossly overweening

arabic: أَنْ رَآهُ اسْتَغْنَىٰ
english: whenever he believes himself to be self-sufficient

arabic: إِنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ الرُّجْعَىٰ
english: for, behold, unto thy Sustainer all must return

arabic: أَرَأَيْتَ الَّذِي يَنْهَىٰ
english: HAST THOU ever considered him who tries to prevent

arabic: عَبْدًا إِذَا صَلَّىٰ
english: a servant [of God] from praying

arabic: أَرَأَيْتَ إِنْ كَانَ عَلَى الْهُدَىٰ
english: Hast thou considered whether he is on the right way

arabic: أَوْ أَمَرَ بِالتَّقْوَىٰ
english: or is concerned with God-consciousness

arabic: أَرَأَيْتَ إِنْ كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ
english: Hast thou considered whether he may [not] be giving the lie to the truth and turning his back [upon it]

arabic: أَلَمْ يَعْلَمْ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ يَرَىٰ
english: Does he, then, not know that God sees [all]

arabic: كَلَّا لَئِنْ لَمْ يَنْتَهِ لَنَسْفَعًا بِالنَّاصِيَةِ
english: Nay, if he desist not, We shall most surely drag him down upon his forehead

arabic: نَاصِيَةٍ كَاذِبَةٍ خَاطِئَةٍ
english: the lying, rebellious forehead! –

arabic: فَلْيَدْعُ نَادِيَهُ
english: and then let him summon [to his aid] the counsels of his own [spurious] wisdom

arabic: سَنَدْعُ الزَّبَانِيَةَ
english: [the while] We shall summon the forces of heavenly chastisement

arabic: كَلَّا لَا تُطِعْهُ وَاسْجُدْ وَاقْتَرِبْ ۩
english: Nay, pay thou no heed to him, but prostrate thyself [before God] and draw close [unto Him]

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِنَّا أَنْزَلْنَاهُ فِي لَيْلَةِ الْقَدْرِ
english: BEHOLD, from on high have We bestowed this [divine writ] on Night of Destiny

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا لَيْلَةُ الْقَدْرِ
english: And what could make thee conceive what it is, that Night of Destiny

arabic: لَيْلَةُ الْقَدْرِ خَيْرٌ مِنْ أَلْفِ شَهْرٍ
english: The Night of Destiny is better than a thousand months

arabic: تَنَزَّلُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَالرُّوحُ فِيهَا بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِمْ مِنْ كُلِّ أَمْرٍ
english: in hosts descend in it the angels, bearing divine inspiration by their Sustainer's leave; from all [evil] that may happen

arabic: سَلَامٌ هِيَ حَتَّىٰ مَطْلَعِ الْفَجْرِ
english: does it make secure, until the rise of dawn

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ لَمْ يَكُنِ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ وَالْمُشْرِكِينَ مُنْفَكِّينَ حَتَّىٰ تَأْتِيَهُمُ الْبَيِّنَةُ
english: IT IS NOT [conceivable] that such as are bent on denying the truth - [be they] from among the followers of earlier revelation or from among those who ascribe divinity to aught beside God should ever be abandoned [by Him] ere there comes unto them the [full] evidence of the truth

arabic: رَسُولٌ مِنَ اللَّهِ يَتْلُو صُحُفًا مُطَهَّرَةً
english: an apostle from God, conveying [unto them] revelations blest with purity

arabic: فِيهَا كُتُبٌ قَيِّمَةٌ
english: wherein there are ordinances of ever-true soundness and clarity

arabic: وَمَا تَفَرَّقَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ إِلَّا مِنْ بَعْدِ مَا جَاءَتْهُمُ الْبَيِّنَةُ
english: Now those who have been vouchsafed revelation aforetime did break up their unity [of faith] after such an evidence of the truth had come to them

arabic: وَمَا أُمِرُوا إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ الدِّينَ حُنَفَاءَ وَيُقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَيُؤْتُوا الزَّكَاةَ ۚ وَذَٰلِكَ دِينُ الْقَيِّمَةِ
english: And withal, they were not enjoined aught but that they should worship God, sincere in their faith in Him alone, turning away from all that is false; and that they should be constant in prayer; and that they should spend in charity: for this is a moral law endowed with ever-true soundness and clarity

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ وَالْمُشْرِكِينَ فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمْ شَرُّ الْبَرِيَّةِ
english: Verily, those who [despite all evidence] are bent on denying the truth - [be they] from among the followers of earlier revelation or from among those who ascribe divinity to aught beside God - will find themselves in the fire of hell, therein to abide: they are the worst of all creatures

arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمْ خَيْرُ الْبَرِيَّةِ
english: [And,] verily, those who have attained to faith, and do righteous deeds - it is they, they who are the best of all creatures

arabic: جَزَاؤُهُمْ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّاتُ عَدْنٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا أَبَدًا ۖ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ عَنْهُمْ وَرَضُوا عَنْهُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِمَنْ خَشِيَ رَبَّهُ
english: Their reward [awaits them] with God: gardens of perpetual bliss, through which running waters flow, therein to abide beyond the count of time; well-pleased is God with them, and well-pleased are they with Him: all this awaits him who of his Sustainer stands in awe

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا زُلْزِلَتِ الْأَرْضُ زِلْزَالَهَا
english: WHEN THE EARTH quakes with her [last] mighty quaking

arabic: وَأَخْرَجَتِ الْأَرْضُ أَثْقَالَهَا
english: and [when] the earth yields up her burdens

arabic: وَقَالَ الْإِنْسَانُ مَا لَهَا
english: and man cries out, "What has happened to her

arabic: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُحَدِّثُ أَخْبَارَهَا
english: on that Day will she recount all her tidings

arabic: بِأَنَّ رَبَّكَ أَوْحَىٰ لَهَا
english: as thy Sustainer will have inspired her to do

arabic: يَوْمَئِذٍ يَصْدُرُ النَّاسُ أَشْتَاتًا لِيُرَوْا أَعْمَالَهُمْ
english: On that Day will all men come forward, cut off from one another, to be shown their [past] deeds

arabic: فَمَنْ يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيْرًا يَرَهُ
english: And so, he who shall have done an atom's weight of good, shall behold it

arabic: وَمَنْ يَعْمَلْ مِثْقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ شَرًّا يَرَهُ
english: and he who shall have done an atom's weight of evil, shall behold it

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالْعَادِيَاتِ ضَبْحًا
english: Oh, the chargers that run panting

arabic: فَالْمُورِيَاتِ قَدْحًا
english: sparks of fire striking

arabic: فَالْمُغِيرَاتِ صُبْحًا
english: rushing to assault at morn

arabic: فَأَثَرْنَ بِهِ نَقْعًا
english: thereby raising clouds of dust

arabic: فَوَسَطْنَ بِهِ جَمْعًا
english: thereby storming [blindly] into any host

arabic: إِنَّ الْإِنْسَانَ لِرَبِّهِ لَكَنُودٌ
english: VERILY, towards his Sustainer man is most ungrateful

arabic: وَإِنَّهُ عَلَىٰ ذَٰلِكَ لَشَهِيدٌ
english: and to this, behold, he [himself] bears witness indeed

arabic: وَإِنَّهُ لِحُبِّ الْخَيْرِ لَشَدِيدٌ
english: for, verily, to the love of wealth is he most ardently devoted

arabic: ۞ أَفَلَا يَعْلَمُ إِذَا بُعْثِرَ مَا فِي الْقُبُورِ
english: But does he not know that [on the Last Day,] when all that is in the graves is raised and brought out

arabic: وَحُصِّلَ مَا فِي الصُّدُورِ
english: and all that is [hidden] in men's hearts is bared

arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّهُمْ بِهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَخَبِيرٌ
english: that on that Day their Sustainer [will show that He] has always been fully aware of them

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ الْقَارِعَةُ
english: OH, the sudden calamity

arabic: مَا الْقَارِعَةُ
english: How awesome the sudden calamity

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الْقَارِعَةُ
english: And what could make thee conceive what that sudden calamity will be

arabic: يَوْمَ يَكُونُ النَّاسُ كَالْفَرَاشِ الْمَبْثُوثِ
english: [It will occur] on the Day when men will be like moths swarming in confusion

arabic: وَتَكُونُ الْجِبَالُ كَالْعِهْنِ الْمَنْفُوشِ
english: and the mountains will be like fluffy tufts of wool

arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنْ ثَقُلَتْ مَوَازِينُهُ
english: And then, he whose weight [of good deeds] is heavy in the balance

arabic: فَهُوَ فِي عِيشَةٍ رَاضِيَةٍ
english: shall find himself in a happy' state of life

arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنْ خَفَّتْ مَوَازِينُهُ
english: whereas he whose weight is light in the balance

arabic: فَأُمُّهُ هَاوِيَةٌ
english: shall be engulfed by an abyss

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا هِيَهْ
english: And what could make thee conceive what that [abyss] will be

arabic: نَارٌ حَامِيَةٌ
english: A fire hotly burning

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ أَلْهَاكُمُ التَّكَاثُرُ
english: YOU ARE OBSESSED by greed for more and more

arabic: حَتَّىٰ زُرْتُمُ الْمَقَابِرَ
english: until you go down to your graves

arabic: كَلَّا سَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
english: Nay, in time you will come to understand

arabic: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
english: And once again: Nay, in time you will come to understand

arabic: كَلَّا لَوْ تَعْلَمُونَ عِلْمَ الْيَقِينِ
english: Nay, if you could but understand [it] with an understanding [born] of certainty

arabic: لَتَرَوُنَّ الْجَحِيمَ
english: you would indeed, most surely, behold the blazing fire [of hell]

arabic: ثُمَّ لَتَرَوُنَّهَا عَيْنَ الْيَقِينِ
english: In the end you will indeed, most surely, behold it with the eye of certainty

arabic: ثُمَّ لَتُسْأَلُنَّ يَوْمَئِذٍ عَنِ النَّعِيمِ
english: and on that Day you will most surely be called to account for [what you did with] the boon of life

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَالْعَصْرِ
english: CONSIDER the flight of time

arabic: إِنَّ الْإِنْسَانَ لَفِي خُسْرٍ
english: Verily, man is bound to lose himself

arabic: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالْحَقِّ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالصَّبْرِ
english: unless he be of those who attain to faith, and do good works, and enjoin upon one another the keeping to truth, and enjoin upon one another patience in adversity

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ وَيْلٌ لِكُلِّ هُمَزَةٍ لُمَزَةٍ
english: WOE unto every slanderer, fault-finder

arabic: الَّذِي جَمَعَ مَالًا وَعَدَّدَهُ
english: Woe unto him who amasses wealth and counts it a safeguard

arabic: يَحْسَبُ أَنَّ مَالَهُ أَخْلَدَهُ
english: thinking that his wealth will make him live forever

arabic: كَلَّا ۖ لَيُنْبَذَنَّ فِي الْحُطَمَةِ
english: Nay, but [in the life to come such as] he shall indeed be abandoned to crushing torment

arabic: وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا الْحُطَمَةُ
english: And what could make thee conceive what that crushing torment will be

arabic: نَارُ اللَّهِ الْمُوقَدَةُ
english: A fire kindled by God

arabic: الَّتِي تَطَّلِعُ عَلَى الْأَفْئِدَةِ
english: which will rise over the [guilty] hearts

arabic: إِنَّهَا عَلَيْهِمْ مُؤْصَدَةٌ
english: verily, it will close in upon them

arabic: فِي عَمَدٍ مُمَدَّدَةٍ
english: in endless columns

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصْحَابِ الْفِيلِ
english: ART THOU NOT aware of how thy Sustainer dealt with the Army of the Elephant

arabic: أَلَمْ يَجْعَلْ كَيْدَهُمْ فِي تَضْلِيلٍ
english: Did He not utterly confound their artful planning

arabic: وَأَرْسَلَ عَلَيْهِمْ طَيْرًا أَبَابِيلَ
english: Thus, He let loose upon them great swarms of flying creatures

arabic: تَرْمِيهِمْ بِحِجَارَةٍ مِنْ سِجِّيلٍ
english: which smote them with stone-hard blows of chastisement pre-ordained

arabic: فَجَعَلَهُمْ كَعَصْفٍ مَأْكُولٍ
english: and caused them to become like a field of grain that has been eaten down to stubble

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ لِإِيلَافِ قُرَيْشٍ
english: SO THAT the Quraysh might remain secure

arabic: إِيلَافِهِمْ رِحْلَةَ الشِّتَاءِ وَالصَّيْفِ
english: secure in their winter and summer journeys

arabic: فَلْيَعْبُدُوا رَبَّ هَٰذَا الْبَيْتِ
english: Let them, therefore, worship the Sustainer of this Temple

arabic: الَّذِي أَطْعَمَهُمْ مِنْ جُوعٍ وَآمَنَهُمْ مِنْ خَوْفٍ
english: who has given them food against hunger, and made them safe from danger

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ أَرَأَيْتَ الَّذِي يُكَذِّبُ بِالدِّينِ
english: HAST THOU ever considered [the kind of man] who gives the lie to all moral law

arabic: فَذَٰلِكَ الَّذِي يَدُعُّ الْيَتِيمَ
english: Behold, it is this [kind of man] that thrusts the orphan away

arabic: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ الْمِسْكِينِ
english: and feels no urge to feed the needy

arabic: فَوَيْلٌ لِلْمُصَلِّينَ
english: Woe, then, unto those praying ones

arabic: الَّذِينَ هُمْ عَنْ صَلَاتِهِمْ سَاهُونَ
english: whose hearts from their prayer are remote

arabic: الَّذِينَ هُمْ يُرَاءُونَ
english: those who want only to be seen and praised

arabic: وَيَمْنَعُونَ الْمَاعُونَ
english: and, withal, deny all assistance [to their fellow-men]

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِنَّا أَعْطَيْنَاكَ الْكَوْثَرَ
english: BEHOLD, We have bestowed upon thee good in abundance

arabic: فَصَلِّ لِرَبِّكَ وَانْحَرْ
english: hence, pray unto thy Sustainer [alone], and sacrifice [unto Him alone]

arabic: إِنَّ شَانِئَكَ هُوَ الْأَبْتَرُ
english: Verily, he that hates thee has indeed been cut off [from all that is good]

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ يَا أَيُّهَا الْكَافِرُونَ
english: SAY: "O you who deny the truth

arabic: لَا أَعْبُدُ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ
english: I do not worship that which you worship

arabic: وَلَا أَنْتُمْ عَابِدُونَ مَا أَعْبُدُ
english: and neither do you worship that which I worship

arabic: وَلَا أَنَا عَابِدٌ مَا عَبَدْتُمْ
english: And I will not worship that which you have [ever] worshipped

arabic: وَلَا أَنْتُمْ عَابِدُونَ مَا أَعْبُدُ
english: and neither will you [ever] worship that which I worship

arabic: لَكُمْ دِينُكُمْ وَلِيَ دِينِ
english: Unto you, your moral law, and unto me, mine

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ إِذَا جَاءَ نَصْرُ اللَّهِ وَالْفَتْحُ
english: WHEN GOD'S SUCCOUR comes, and victory

arabic: وَرَأَيْتَ النَّاسَ يَدْخُلُونَ فِي دِينِ اللَّهِ أَفْوَاجًا
english: and thou seest people enter God's religion in hosts

arabic: فَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ وَاسْتَغْفِرْهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ تَوَّابًا
english: extol thy Sustainer's limitless glory, and praise Him, and seek His forgiveness: for, behold, He is ever an acceptor of repentance

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ تَبَّتْ يَدَا أَبِي لَهَبٍ وَتَبَّ
english: DOOMED are the hands of him of the glowing countence: and doomed is he

arabic: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُ مَالُهُ وَمَا كَسَبَ
english: What will his wealth avail him, and all that he has gained

arabic: سَيَصْلَىٰ نَارًا ذَاتَ لَهَبٍ
english: [In the life to come] he shall have to endure a fire fiercely glowing

arabic: وَامْرَأَتُهُ حَمَّالَةَ الْحَطَبِ
english: together with his wife, that carrier of evil tales

arabic: فِي جِيدِهَا حَبْلٌ مِنْ مَسَدٍ
english: [who bears] around her neck a rope of twisted strands

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ
english: SAY: "He is the One God

arabic: اللَّهُ الصَّمَدُ
english: God the Eternal, the Uncaused Cause of All Being

arabic: لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ
english: He begets not, and neither is He begotten

arabic: وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ
english: and there is nothing that could be compared with Him

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَقِ
english: SAY: "I seek refuge with the Sustainer of the rising dawn

arabic: مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ
english: from the evil of aught that He has created

arabic: وَمِنْ شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ
english: and from the evil of the black darkness whenever it descends

arabic: وَمِنْ شَرِّ النَّفَّاثَاتِ فِي الْعُقَدِ
english: and from the evil of all human beings bent on occult endeavours

arabic: وَمِنْ شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ
english: and from the evil of the envious when he envies

arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ
english: SAY: "I seek refuge with the Sustainer of men

arabic: مَلِكِ النَّاسِ
english: the Sovereign of men

arabic: إِلَٰهِ النَّاسِ
english: the God of men

arabic: مِنْ شَرِّ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ
english: from the evil of the whispering, elusive tempter

arabic: الَّذِي يُوَسْوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ النَّاسِ
english: who whispers in the hearts of men

arabic: مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ
english: from all [temptation to evil by] invisible forces as well as men
